title: Shopify E-commerce Lead (Shopify build + SEO/SEA + Customer Support)
description:
We are launching a Shopify webshop selling bicycles in Europe. We’re looking for an experienced Shopify e-commerce specialist (or a small team/agency with one clear point of contact) who can build the store, run SEO + Google Ads (SEA), and help set up and handle customer support.



This is a long-term collaboration: first we launch, then we optimize and grow.



Responsibilities



1) Shopify store build & launch

 • Build and launch a high-quality Shopify webshop (theme setup/customization)

 • Set up navigation, collections, product pages, filters, and search

 • Configure payments, shipping, taxes/VAT (EU), policies, and legal pages (basic setup)

 • Install and configure essential apps (reviews,
 marketing, bundles/upsells, feeds, etc.)

 • Set up tracking: GA4, Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel (if needed), and conversion events

 • Basic speed/performance improvements and QA testing



2) SEO (setup + ongoing growth)

 • Technical SEO basics (site structure, indexation, redirects, canonicals)

 • On-page optimization (titles/meta, headings, internal links, category copy)

 • Keyword research for EU markets and a simple content plan

 • Optimize product data for discoverability (structured product content, SEO-friendly URLs)



3) SEA / Performance Marketing (Google Ads)

 • Set up and manage Google Ads (Search + Shopping / Performance Max)

 • Create and optimize Google Merchant Center + product feed(s)

 • Keyword research, campaign structure, ad copy, negative keywords

 • Landing page improvements and basic CRO suggestions

 • Weekly optimization and monthly reporting (ROAS, CAC, conversion rate)



4) Customer Support (setup + daily handling)

 • Set up a helpdesk tool (e.g., Gorgias / Zendesk / Freshdesk) and workflows

 • Build an FAQ and templates for common questions (shipping, returns, warranty)

 • Handle customer
s/chat professionally (English required; Dutch/German/French is a plus)

 • Coordinate with our team on order issues, refunds, returns, and warranty requests



Requirements (must-have)

 • Proven experience building Shopify stores (please share portfolio links)

 • Proven experience with Google Ads + Shopping / Merchant Center

 • Solid understanding of e-commerce SEO

 • Strong written English and professional customer communication

 • Organized, proactive, and able to work independently

 • Able to work with some overlap with European business hours



Nice to have

 • Experience selling into EU markets (VAT, shipping, returns, compliance basics)

 • Experience with bicycles / cycling products

 • CRO experience (heatmaps, A/B testing, funnel improvements)

 •
 marketing (Klaviyo) and feed tools (Channable, DataFeedWatch, etc.)

title: Full-Time Bookkeeper
description:
About Us

At TaxAce, we provide expert financial services including Tax Preparation, Bookkeeping, Payroll, Agent Service of Process, Tax Resolution, Tax Planning, and CFO Services for businesses and entrepreneurs.



We’re guided by five core values:

• Integrity – Transparent guidance for informed decisions

• Communication – Clear, timely support that builds trust

• Accountability – Goal-focused with measurable results

• Respect – Personalized service with professionalism

• Education – Ongoing learning to stay ahead of tax changes

Our mission is to deliver reliable, high-quality financial support that empowers clients to grow with confidence.



Who You Are

You’re a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) who thrives in an organized, fast-paced environment. With a knack for numbers and a commitment to accuracy, you bring value by streamlining financial records, identifying trends, and ensuring compliance.



Key Responsibilities

• Maintain accurate financial records for a variety of clients

• Process accounts payable and receivable, bank reconciliations, and payroll

• Prepare monthly, quarterly, and year-end financial reports

• Collaborate with tax professionals during tax season and audits

• Manage multiple client accounts in QuickBooks Online

• Reconcile credit card and bank statements

• Ensure compliance with GAAP and internal accounting policies

• Communicate regularly with clients to collect necessary documentation and clarify discrepancies



Qualifications

• CPA designation (required)

• Minimum of 2 years of professional bookkeeping or accounting experience

• Proficiency in QuickBooks Online, Excel, and cloud-based bookkeeping tools

• Strong understanding of accrual accounting and financial reporting

• Excellent time management and organizational skills

• Strong communication skills, both verbal and written



Preferred Skills

• QuickBooks Online ProAdvisor certification (a plus)

• Experience working with tax firms or accounting practices

• Experience in Xero (a plus)

• Familiarity with payroll systems and third-party integrations

• Ability to handle multiple client accounts concurrently

• Comfortable working in a remote, collaborative environment



Compensation & Benefits

• Competitive salary (based on experience)

• Flexible work hours

• Professional development support (CE credits, licensing fees, etc.)

• Performance bonuses



How to Apply

Submit your resume, cover letter, and proof of CPA license (and QuickBooks certification, if applicable) to 
 or 
 include “Full-Time Bookkeeper Application” in the subject line.



If
 is not visible, please apply through the platform job posting.



Learn more about us at:

title: Payroll Support
description:
About Us

At TaxAce, we provide expert financial services including Tax Preparation, Bookkeeping, Payroll, Agent Service of Process, Tax Resolution, Tax Planning, and CFO Services for businesses and entrepreneurs.



We’re guided by five core values:

• Integrity – Transparent guidance for informed decisions

• Respect – Personalized service with professionalism

• Education – Ongoing learning to stay ahead of tax changes



Our mission is to deliver reliable, high-quality financial support that empowers clients to grow with confidence.



Who You Are

You’re a detail-oriented Payroll Support Specialist who thrives in a structured, deadline-driven environment. You understand that payroll accuracy directly impacts client trust. You take ownership of your work, meet deadlines consistently, and communicate proactively when issues arise. You are organized, responsive, and committed to compliance.



Key Responsibilities

• Process payroll accurately and on time for multiple client accounts (100% on-time payroll processing)

• Maintain payroll accuracy rate of 99% or higher

• Process payroll adjustments, bonuses, commissions, and reimbursements as needed

• Prepare and file payroll tax forms (941, 940, DE9/DE9C, W-2, 1099, etc.) by all federal and state deadlines (100?adline compliance)

• Ensure payroll tax payments are submitted accurately and on time

• Reconcile payroll reports, tax liabilities, and general ledger entries within 3 business days of payroll processing

• Maintain organized digital payroll files and documentation for audit readiness

• Respond to internal team and client payroll inquiries within 24 business hours

• Assist with onboarding new payroll clients within 5 business days of receiving complete documentation

• Identify discrepancies proactively and resolve issues efficiently



Qualifications

• Minimum of 2 years of payroll processing experience

• Experience with payroll systems such as Gusto, ADP, QuickBooks Payroll, or similar platforms

• Strong understanding of payroll tax compliance (federal and state)

• Familiarity with quarterly and annual payroll filings

• Proficiency in Excel and cloud-based systems

• Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills



Preferred Skills

• Experience working in an accounting or tax firm

• Multi-state payroll experience

• Experience handling payroll for multiple clients simultaneously

• Knowledge of workers’ compensation audits and payroll reporting

• QuickBooks Online experience

• Comfortable working in a remote, collaborative environment

• Professional development support

mber and get started

title: SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGER — TIKTOK & INSTAGRAM ORGANIC GROWTH
description:
OVERVIEW



We’re looking for a Social Media Manager who can grow organic TikTok and Instagram accounts — driving traffic, followers, and product sales through consistent, engaging, and trend-driven content.



You’ll post 2 pieces of content daily per platform (14 per week each), engage with followers, and identify trends that match our brand and audience.



Your job: Post consistently. Go viral regularly. Drive traffic that converts.



STOP HERE IF ANY OF THESE APPLY



You need guaranteed income regardless of performance



You can’t post 2x daily consistently



You don’t understand TikTok/Instagram trends or algorithms



You’re not comfortable being on camera or sourcing creator content



You think “posting pretty pictures” = social media management



Still reading? Perfect — you might be our next growth partner.



 COMPENSATION STRUCTURE



BASE:

 $240/month — 42 posts/week total + engagement tracked + content calendar maintained



PERFORMANCE BONUS:

 +$0–480/month — engagement rate 5%+, follower growth 10%+/week, or a post with 50K+ views



EXCELLENCE BONUS:

 +$300/month — account reaches 10K+ followers or viral post hits 500K+ views



TOTAL RANGE:

 $240–1,020+/month



Progression Example:



Month 1: $240–350



Month 2–3: $450–650



Month 4+: $700–1,200+



WHAT YOU’LL DO



Post 2 pieces of content daily across TikTok and Instagram



Manage and grow engagement (comments, replies, shares)



Spot and use trending sounds, challenges, and formats



Collaborate with our creative team to plan weekly content



Analyze performance metrics and suggest improvements



REQUIREMENTS



Proven experience managing TikTok or Instagram growth



Understanding of organic reach, hashtags, and virality triggers



Strong visual sense and ability to plan short-form content



Reliable internet and consistent communication



Creativity + data-driven mindset



???? HOW TO APPLY



Send your application here with the subject line:



“Social Media Manager Application — [Your Full Name]”

title: Customer Service Team Lead (Starting Role) | Health Tech Company | Full-Time Remote
description:
About the role: We're not just another remote job. We're a mission-driven health technology company helping thousands of older Americans reduce chronic pain and avoid unnecessary medications. We're growing fast, and we need someone exceptionally detail-oriented to handle customer service and content tasks using AI tools.



Our customers are older adults (50+) who are often skeptical, technically challenged, and need compassionate, clear communication. You'll be their main point of contact.



This role is 60% customer service, 40% content work.



What you'll actually be doing:



Customer Service (Primary Focus - 60% of time):

- Respond to 20-30 customer inquiries daily 
 & chat) in our ticketing system

- Use Claude AI to draft responses, then critically review and personalize them

- Adapt our
 templates (makros) to each customer's specific situation

- Read full conversation history before responding, context is everything

- Handle returns, warranty cases, medical questions following our protocols

- Know when to escalate vs. handle independently



Content & Marketing (40% of time):

- Write science-backed blog posts with AI assistance (you prompt, proofread, fact-check, optimize)

- Create social media content with Canva (using our templates)

- Schedule posts and engage with our audience

- Reach out to health & wellness influencers for partnerships (80% automated already)



Critical requirements (no exceptions):

- 5+ years of customer service experience (preferably in health, wellness, or medical devices)

- Near-native English (our customers are American seniors)

- Proven experience using AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, etc.). You should already be using AI in your current work

- Experience with project management tools (ClickUp, Asana, Trello etc)

- Obsessive attention to detail. You catch mistakes others miss

- Fast learner who takes notes and doesn't repeat mistakes

- Excellent internet connection and professional workspace



You'll struggle in this role if you:

- Copy-paste AI responses without critical thinking

- Don't read full context before responding

- Tend to make the same mistake over and over again

- Need constant supervision

- Work multiple jobs and can't focus



What makes someone successful here:

- Read full context before responding (you're thorough, not rushed)

- Customize templates thoughtfully (not copy-paste)

- Think critically about whether your responses make sense

- Take pride in helping people solve real problems

- Want to build something, not just clock hours

- See feedback as a gift, not criticism

- You work independently but know when to ask for help



What makes this opportunity different:

- Career growth path: We're hiring for a Customer Service Specialist today, but we're building toward a Customer Service Team Lead role. As we scale, the right person will lead our support team, train new hires, and shape our customer experience strategy. 

- Competitive compensation: $1,000 - $1,200/month USD for full-time (40 hours/week) with true growth potential.

- Paid time off: 15 days paid annual leave (includes public holidays, you choose when to take them).

- Professional development: Access to courses, AI tools, and direct mentorship from our founder. We invest in people who invest in themselves.

- Flexible schedule (must overlap at least 3 hours with Thailand time)

- Process-driven company with comprehensive training with documentation, videos, and daily feedback

- Cutting-edge tools: You'll work with the latest AI technology. This isn't data entry, you're learning skills that will be valuable for years to come.

- Meaningful work: Our customers are grandparents who want to play with their grandkids without pain, veterans managing injuries, people avoiding opioids. Your work directly improves lives.

- Stability with a startup: We're profitable, growing steadily, and been in business for 3 years. You get startup opportunity without the risk.



Our hiring process:

1) Video application (3-5 min) - see questions below

2) Video interview (30 min) - we'll get to know you, answer your questions & test your thinking

3) Paid trial task (4 hours, $50) - customer service scenarios to filter for skills. Tests attention to detail, AI usage, customer service judgment

4) Trial week (20 hours, $160) - Work with real tickets. We will filter for learning ability & work ethic.

5) Probation month ($1,000) - for both of us to understand whether we're a good fit



This is a high bar. We've had candidates with 10+ years of experience not work out because they lacked attention to detail and didn't learn from mistakes. If you're not someone who naturally catches details and learns quickly, this isn't the right fit.



To apply, create a video (Use Loom, Dubb or similar tools) answering these questions:

1) Customer service experience: Tell me about your experience (years, industry etc) and mention one of the most challenging tickets you worked on and how you resolved it.

2) AI usage: How do you currently use AI in your work? Be specific with tools and tasks

3) Why you: Let us know why you think we should choose you over other candidates



Your video should be max 5 minutes. Applications without video will be automatically rejected.

title: Finance / Accounting Manager - E-commerce
description:
Job Type: Full-time / Part-time



About the Company:



We are a growing e-commerce social enterprise that sells handcrafted bracelets to fund feeding operations for abandoned dogs worldwide. We operate 100+ feeding locations globally and have fed over 350,000 dogs since 2020.



Job Overview:

We're looking for an experienced Finance Manager to take full ownership of our financial tracking and reporting. You will be responsible for creating comprehensive financial oversight sheets and maintaining accurate records of all business finances across our e-commerce operations.

Key Responsibilities:



Create and maintain detailed financial tracking sheets for complete business oversight

Track and reconcile all revenue streams (e-commerce sales, subscriptions, donations)

Monitor and report on ad spend across all marketing channels 
, Google, etc.)

Calculate and track COGS (Cost of Goods Sold) for all products

Track and manage refunds, chargebacks, and payment disputes

Create monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports

Monitor cash flow and maintain accurate P&L statements

Track expenses across multiple categories (production, shipping, operations, team, etc.)

Reconcile transactions from multiple platforms (Shopify, payment processors, etc.)

Manage multi-currency transactions and international vendor payments

Maintain organized financial records and documentation

Prepare financial summaries and dashboards for leadership review



Required Skills & Experience:



MUST HAVE: Prior experience in e-commerce finance management

Expert-level proficiency in Google Sheets and/or Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, formulas, VLOOKUP, financial modeling)

Strong experience creating financial tracking systems and comprehensive oversight sheets

Experience tracking ad spend, ROAS, and marketing budgets

Understanding of e-commerce metrics: COGS, refund rates, chargeback management, profit margins

Experience with Shopify or similar e-commerce platforms

Familiarity with payment processors (Stripe, PayPal, etc.)

High attention to detail and accuracy with numbers

Excellent organizational skills

Strong communication skills in English (written and verbal)

Self-motivated and able to work independently

Reliable internet connection and professional work setup



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience with accounting software (QuickBooks, Xero, Wave, or similar)

Experience managing subscription-based business finances

Knowledge of multi-currency transactions

Experience with
 Ads Manager and Google Ads financial reporting

Previous work with international e-commerce businesses



What You'll Be Working With:



Shopify store

 Ads, Google Ads

Multiple payment processors

International vendors and suppliers

Subscription management systems

Multi-currency transactions



Important Notes:



This role focuses on financial tracking and reporting ONLY

You will NOT be required to provide financial advice or strategic recommendations

You will create the sheets and systems; we handle the strategic decisions



What We're Looking For:

Someone who is obsessed with accuracy, loves working with numbers and spreadsheets, and can build comprehensive financial tracking systems from the ground up. You should be comfortable managing multiple data sources and creating clear, organized reports.

To Apply:

Please submit:



Your updated resume/CV

Brief description of your e-commerce finance experience

Examples of financial tracking sheets or systems you've created (screenshots or samples)

Your availability and expected salary



Application Questions:



How many years of experience do you have in e-commerce finance?

What e-commerce platforms have you worked with?

What tools/software do you use for financial tracking?

Can you provide an example of a complex financial sheet you've built?

title: ClickUp Expert — Workspace Setup for Media & Content Business
description:
We run a luxury travel agency and an online travel education course as part of a larger media brand. We're a small team of 3 with no project management system in place. We need an experienced ClickUp expert to build a workspace from scratch and train us on how to use it.

Our business has two core areas that need organising:

1. Travel Agency (Luxury Hotel Bookings)

We handle high-end hotel booking requests from clients. We need a system to manage:

— New client enquiries and lead tracking

— Booking requests in progress (hotel, dates, status, special requests, VIP amenities)

— Client communication follow-ups and reminders

— Post-trip follow-ups and feedback

— A clear view of all active bookings and their status at a glance

2. Online Course (Video Education Product)

We run an online course that requires ongoing maintenance and updates. We need a system to manage:

— Video content that needs updating or re-recording

— New lessons or modules in production

— Tasks related to course launches and promotions

— Student support tickets and common issues

— Affiliate marketing tasks and tracking

What we expect you to deliver:

— A fully configured ClickUp workspace covering both areas above — Spaces, Folders, Lists, Custom Fields, Views, and Statuses tailored to our workflows

— Automations for recurring tasks, reminders, status changes, and notifications

— Dashboards so the team can see what needs attention at a glance

— Templates for common recurring workflows (e.g. new booking request, new course update task)

— Written documentation explaining the setup and how to use it

— A recorded walkthrough / training video so the team can use the system confidently



Requirements:

— Proven ClickUp expertise — you must share examples of workspaces you've built

— Experience with service-based businesses, client management, or course/education businesses is a strong plus

— Clear communicator who can explain the "why" behind setup decisions

— Available to complete the project within 2–3 weeks



To apply, please include:

Examples or screenshots of ClickUp workspaces you've built

A brief description of how you'd approach this project

Your fixed price for the full scope

Your availability to start

title: Personal Virtual Assistant -- Organized, Proactive, AI-Friendly
description:
## Job Title



Personal Virtual Assistant -- Organized, Proactive, AI-Friendly



## Job Description



I'm a tech entrepreneur running multiple projects (a software company, investments, and a DJ side business). I'm looking for a sharp, organized virtual assistant to be my right hand on the operations side of things.



This isn't a typical VA role. **You'll essentially be my number two** -- helping me run things, not just checking off tasks. I need someone who takes ownership, builds systems, thinks strategically, and holds me accountable. If I'm dragging my feet on something, I expect you to follow up and push me to get it done. If you're someone who waits quietly for the next task, this isn't the right fit.



### What You'll Be Doing



- **Document & file organization** -- Organizing Google Drive, cloud storage, and local files. Building folder structures and naming conventions. Proactively thinking about ways to improve our efficiency and readiness for taxes and other document-heavy events -- not just organizing once, but creating systems that stay organized.

- **Personal admin & gifting** -- Researching and ordering gifts for friends, family, and business contacts. Handling purchases and managing recurring personal tasks that keep falling through the cracks.

- **Travel booking & points optimization** -- Booking travel, tracking my points balances across programs, and recommending the best way to use them for each trip. Proactively flagging deals and redemption opportunities.

- **Calendar & scheduling** -- Coordinating meetings, blocking focus time, keeping me on track.

- **Sales operations & client support** -- I handle the selling, but you help close the loop. Sending out DocuSigns, following up with clients, preparing contracts and consulting agreements, and handling the admin side of closing deals.

- **Copywriting** -- Drafting copy for consulting proposals, client-facing
s, social media posts, and other communications as needed.

- **Product & market research** -- Researching competitors, market positioning, and user needs for new applications I'm building. You'll be my thought partner on this, not just a data gatherer.

- **AI tools & marketing research** -- Staying on top of new AI tools and marketing strategies. Identifying what we should be using and how to implement them.

- **Content summarization** -- Summarizing articles, reports, and content I haven't had time to read. We'll build an AI-assisted workflow for this together.



### What Makes You Stand Out



**You're a systematizer.** The first time you do something, you document it. You create SOPs, checklists, and templates so it never has to be figured out twice. You think in systems, not one-off tasks.



**You're proactive and direct.** You don't wait to be told what to do next. You see what needs doing and you flag it. You're comfortable being frank with me -- if something is falling behind, you say so.



**You're organized and trustworthy.** You manage details without dropping balls. You handle sensitive information (finances, personal accounts) with discretion.



**You can think independently.** When I give you a goal, you figure out the steps. You don't need every decision made for you.



### Required Skills



- Strong English communication (written and verbal)

- Google Workspace (Drive, Docs, Sheets, Calendar)

- Notion (or similar project management/knowledge base tools)

- Comfortable with video calls and async communication



### Nice to Have



- Experience with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) -- I'm happy to teach this if you're a fast learner

- Ability to set up Slack integrations and automations

- Experience with travel booking and points/miles optimization

- Previous experience as a personal or executive assistant

- Bookkeeping or basic financial organization experience



### Schedule & Compensation



- **Starting at 10 hours/week** with the opportunity to scale to full-time as we build trust and the workload grows

- **$300/month retainer** to start

- Flexible hours -- I care about output, not when you're online

- Long-term role -- I'm looking for someone to grow with, not a short-term hire



### How to Apply



Please include in your application:



1. A brief intro about yourself and your experience as a VA

2. Tell me about a time you created a system or process that made your client's life easier

3. What AI tools do you currently use, if any? (It's okay if the answer is none -- I value honesty over a padded resume)

4. Your availability and preferred working hours



I'll be doing a 30-minute video interview with shortlisted candidates, followed by a small paid test task so we can both see if the fit is right.

title: Freelance Shopify Developer (Ongoing Support Partner)
description:
We are looking for a reliable, experienced freelance Shopify developer to support our e-commerce store on an ongoing, as-needed basis.



This is a long-term working relationship, not a full-time hire. We want to build a trusted partnership with one or two developers we can consistently rely on for website improvements, troubleshooting, and custom development work.



Remote candidates are preferred.



About the Role



We regularly need technical Shopify support for tasks that go beyond what our internal team can complete, including:



Theme edits and customizations



Coding support and bug fixing



App integrations and troubleshooting



Performance improvements and technical clean-up



Rather than working with agencies or rotating freelancers, we want a dependable developer who understands our store over time and can provide consistent support when needed.



Key Responsibilities



Shopify theme editing and customization



Working with Liquid (Shopify templating language)



Front-end development using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript



App integrations, troubleshooting, and resolving conflicts



Fixing bugs, layout issues, and mobile responsiveness problems



Performance optimization and site speed improvements



Supporting ongoing site enhancements and feature requests



What We’re Looking For



We are looking for someone who is:



Highly experienced with Shopify development (not just basic setup)



Strong in Liquid, theme architecture, and front-end implementation



Comfortable diagnosing issues and proposing solutions



Reliable, responsive, and able to meet reasonable turnaround times



A clear communicator who can work well with a remote team



Experienced supporting mid- to high-AOV e-commerce brands (preferred)



Preferred Candidate Profile



Priority will be given to developers based in regions with strong technical talent and reasonable pricing, such as:



Eastern Europe



Southeast Asia



South America



We generally avoid high-cost regions (UK/US) unless exceptional value is demonstrated.



Screening Questions (Required in Application)



Please include answers to the following:



What Shopify stores or projects have you worked on recently? (Links/examples preferred)



What is your experience with Liquid and custom theme development?



Are you comfortable troubleshooting app conflicts and complex store setups?



What is your typical availability and turnaround time for small fixes?



Do you work hourly, project-based, or both? Please share your rate range.



What time zone are you in, and are you comfortable working asynchronously?



Engagement Structure



Ongoing freelance support



Work assigned on an as-needed basis (small edits to larger custom tasks)



Potential to become our long-term go-to Shopify partner



How to Apply



Please apply with:



A short introduction



Relevant Shopify experience



Examples of past work



Answers to the screening questions above



We are reviewing candidates on a rolling basis and will shortlist for a quick interview/chat.



Thank you — we look forward to finding a strong long-term development partner.

title: Accountant/Bookkeeper
description:
Bookkeeper/Administrative Assistant



Location: Canada (West Coast)



Company Overview:

We are a growing company which specializes in high-end glazing supply and installation, focused on single family modern homes.



Position Overview:

We are seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented individual to fill the role of Accountant/Bookkeeper/Administrative Assistant. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing various financial tasks including vendor invoice entry, payroll processing, accounts receivable, and maintaining accurate records. Additionally, this position involves administrative duties to support the efficient operation of the organization.



The position will start part time, with the opportunity to move to full time after a few months.



Responsibilities:

1. Financial Management:

• Enter vendor invoices into both BuilderTrend (BT) and QuickBooks (QB) systems.

• Update purchase order (PO) payments in QB and BT platforms.

• Mark wire payments for POs as paid and ensure accurate documentation.

• Handle quarterly GST and PST filings and payments.

• Manage TDFX purchases and wire payments.

• Create and update Schedule of Values (SOV) as needed.



2. Accounts Receivable and Payroll:

• Generate and send invoices using BT and QB platforms.

• Enter and update accounts receivable information in both systems.

• Process payroll accurately and on time.

• Remit payroll deductions and manage electronic fund transfers (EFTs) for payments.

• Conduct cheque runs and ensure timely payments.



3. Financial Administration:

• Create purchase orders (POs) and maintain records.

• Organize and maintain filing cabinet binders for documentation.

• Perform monthly reconciliations of bank and credit card statements.

• Handle banking transactions and maintain accurate records.

• Assist in financial forecasting to support decision-making processes.



4. BuilderTrend Software Management:

• Manage invoices and payments within the BuilderTrend project management software.



Qualifications:

• Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field preferred.

• CPA is required. 

• Proven experience in bookkeeping, accounting, or financial administration.

• Proficiency in QuickBooks and BuilderTrend software.

• Strong understanding of GST, PST, and other tax filing requirements.

• Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and record-keeping.

• Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.

• Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).

• Able to work on Pacific Standard Time (PST)



Benefits:

Work from home, annual performance bonus, 2-week vacation after a year of employment.



How to Apply:

Serious candidates are invited to apply with a brief video introducing themselves and explaining why they are an excellent fit for the Project Manager position. Please submit your video application along with your resume. Applications without a video introduction will not be considered.



Start will be immediate once hired.

description:
Job Role: Senior Short-Form Video Editor

Compensation range: $1800 - $2200 AUD / Monthly. This could be done via EOR (employer of record) or independent contractor agreement depending on the terms we agree upon.



**Note: While we are looking to fill a full-time role as the primary objective, we are also looking for contract/freelance video editors as well to assist with overflow work as well. Please state which applies to you in your application.



Work Schedule: This role is expected to align with the AU business hours (approx. 9 AM - 5 PM, Monday to Friday) for collaboration, but as a contractor, you’ll have flexibility in how you manage your time.



We are looking for an experience short-form video editor to join our team. You will be working closely with our Social Media Management team to produce high quality, short form reels which engage, educate, entertain and inspire.



A deep understanding of social media content, pacing, hooks and retention techniques as well as overall creativity will be paramount in this role. You will need to be able to follow a brief and client guidelines as well as know when it's ok to do something a little different in order to get the best results.



You will also be somewhat of a "Creative Director" in that we will also be relying on you to set the standards for creativity for each client, by understanding their brand and seeing it as what it could be and provide new ideas.



Please see some examples of the type of work we do and what you will be working on: 



A bit about us: 



A dynamic creative marketing agency located in Brisbane, that focuses on crafting compelling content, producing videos, managing social media, and developing brand strategies to help businesses communicate their message. Built on the idea that thoughtful storytelling creates real impact, the team emphasizes creativity, innovation, and a collaborative, supportive workplace culture.



Role Overview: 



We're looking for a Senior Short-Form Video Editor to join this Brisbane-based creative agency specialising in content creation and social media management for B2B and service-based businesses.



In this role, you'll transform raw footage into scroll-stopping Instagram Reels, TikToks, YouTube Shorts, and LinkedIn videos. You'll work across multiple client brands, delivering high-volume, high-quality content that drives real engagement and results.



You'll report to the Social Media Manager and collaborate closely with our Social Media Coordinator, Senior Video Editor, and Videographer. We provide all software, storage, and systems — you bring the talent and your own editing workstation.



What Success Looks Like:



Consistently producing platform-native video content that looks like it belongs on each client's feed — not like it came from a template factory. You nail the hook in the first 3 seconds, maintain energy throughout, and deliver clean endings that leave viewers satisfied.



You hit deadlines reliably, flag issues early, and require minimal revisions because you've internalised each client's brand guidelines. Your 18th video of the week looks as sharp as your 1st.



This role suits editors who bring creative flair while thriving within defined processes. You're not just executing — you're injecting energy, personality, and storytelling craft into every edit.



What You'll Do:



- Edit short-form videos (30-90 seconds) from raw footage including podcasts, interviews, events, and B2B content

- Apply retention editing techniques: pattern interrupts, dynamic pacing, strategic zooms, visual hooks

- Create burnt-in captions with accurate timing, spelling, and brand-consistent styling

- Build motion graphics elements: lower thirds, callouts, kinetic text, animated transitions

- Export multiple versions per video (9:16, 1:1, 4:5) and custom thumbnails as required

- Maintain brand consistency across high-volume batch production

- Follow established workflows using ClickUp (project management) and Dropbox (footage & review)



Requirements:



- 3+ years professional video editing experience

- Expert proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and/or DaVinci Resolve

- Strong proficiency in Adobe After Effects

- Intermediate to expert motion graphics skills (lower thirds, kinetic text, animated elements)

- Proven portfolio showcasing short-form social video content (Reels, TikToks, Shorts)

- Strong understanding of retention editing and platform-specific pacing

- Caption creation expertise with excellent spelling and grammar

- Audio editing fundamentals (levels, EQ, noise reduction)

- Basic colour correction skills

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Own workstation suitable for video editing (multi-core processor, 16GB+ RAM, dedicated GPU, SSD storage)

- Reliable high-speed internet connection



Nice to Have:



-Advanced colour grading capabilities



What We Offer:



- Full-time, stable position with an established creative agency

- All software provided (Adobe Creative Cloud, DaVinci Resolve, etc.)

- Storage drives provided - Initially we will need you to provide your own hard drives etc however long term we would deliver you a NAS.

- Work across diverse client brands in property, professional services, hospitality, trades, allied health and more

- Clear processes and brand guidelines — no guesswork

- Supportive team environment with weekly check-ins



Work Arrangement & Expectations:



- This is a remote role that will be set up via an Employer of Record (EOR) service.

- To ensure alignment and transparency, successful candidates will be expected to:



- Be available for meetings and collaboration during core [AEST] business hours

- Disclose any existing ongoing roles or client work

- Reflect this engagement on their LinkedIn profile

title: Pixel Artist - Military Strategy Game Assets
description:
Create a complete, cohesive pixel art asset pack for "Soldiers of Wealth" - a turn-based strategy game combining military tactics with financial markets. Need professional-quality assets that avoid placeholder aesthetics and maintain visual consistency across all game elements.



Art Style Requirements



Pixel Art: 16x16 to 64x64 sprites, clean pixel-perfect artwork

Aesthetic: Military command center meets Wall Street trading floor

Palette: Professional color scheme with military blues, gold accents, financial greens/reds

Consistency: Unified style across all assets (same resolution, outline style, lighting)



Required Asset List

Characters (15-20 assets)



1 Player commander sprite (idle animation, 4 frames)

6 Bot commander portraits (static busts, 48x48px)

1 Generic soldier sprite (walk cycle, 4 frames)

Soldier recolors for different factions (6 variants)



UI Elements (25-30 assets)



Button states: normal/hover/pressed/disabled (4 variants)

Panel frames and card backgrounds

Market icons: stocks/real estate/crypto/business (4 icons)

Status icons: soldiers, week counter, economy states (8 icons)

Progress bars and sliders



Backgrounds (3-4 assets)



Main battlefield scene (1280x720 base resolution)

Economy state variants (tinted overlays for boom/stable/downturn/crisis)

Optional: Command center interior background



Effects & Animations (10-15 assets)



Number pop-ups (+50 soldiers, profit/loss indicators)

Simple particle effects for market activities

Loading/processing animations

Transition effects between screens



Technical Specifications



Resolution: Scalable pixel art (base 16px grid)

Format: PNG with transparency

Naming: Consistent file naming convention

Organization: Organized folder structure by category

Atlas Ready: Spritesheets for Animations and UI elements



What We Provide



Screen mockups and layout references

Asset naming and organization requirements



Required Skills



3+ years pixel art experience

Game asset creation portfolio

UI design for games or applications

Character design and animation

Asset optimization and technical delivery



Preferred Experience



Strategy game asset creation

Military/tactical game aesthetics

Financial/business app UI design

Steam game asset experience

Sprite animation and effects



Portfolio Requirements

Please provide examples of:



Complete game asset packages you've created

UI element libraries with consistent theming

Character sprites with animations

Pixel art style range showing versatility within constraints

title: Unlock Your Creativity: Join Arispheris as a Graphic Designer for a Dynamic 3-Month Project
description:
Arispheris is looking for a highly skilled and innovative Graphic Designer to join our team for a 3-month full-time project term, with potential for extension. This is a remote position, but we require a designer who can work independently, take initiative, and bring fresh, original creativity to the table—no AI-generated designs will be accepted.



If you thrive in an environment that values creative autonomy, attention to detail, and hands-on design skills, we’d love to hear from you.



Company Overview

Arispheris is a staffing firm that provides authentic and connective staffing solutions for small business owners. We take pride in our in-depth recruiting process, ensuring that every professional we bring on board has the skills and drive to succeed.



We are actively expanding our design team and are looking for a Graphic Designer who excels at crafting compelling visuals that enhance brand presence and engage audiences. If you want to be part of a team that values true creative expertise, this is the perfect opportunity for you!



Key Responsibilities

Design on-brand graphics for both Arispheris and its clients, including but not limited to:

Logos, brand kits, media and promo materials

Social media banners, headers, and marketing posts

Website vector images, multimedia thumbnails, and digital ads

Newsletter and
 marketing templates

eBook and print book covers

Presentation decks, invitations, and website wireframes

Ensure all final graphics are visually appealing, 100% original (no AI-generated work), and meet client brand guidelines.

Collaborate with tea
mbers and clients to conceptualize social media campaigns and marketing materials.

Present design drafts, revise based on feedback, and ensure timely project completion.

Keep a well-organized directory of design assets for efficient access.

Stay up to date with design trends and continuously refine skills to maintain top-tier creative output.



Requirements & Qualifications

A degree in Graphic Design, Digital Arts, Creative Multimedia, Marketing, or a related field.

At least 2 years of professional experience in digital design, branding, or marketing.

Must be highly proficient in both Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop) and Canva—you will be tested during the interview.

Strong sense of design composition, color theory, and typography.

Ability to create content quickly and efficiently while maintaining a high standard of design quality.

Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with clients and teams.

Detail-oriented and capable of handling multiple projects at once while meeting deadlines.

Familiarity with tools like Google Workspace, Slack, and Asana is a plus.

Absolutely no AI-generated designs or portfolios will be considered.



Compensation & Benefits

Full-time remote position (3-month term, potential for extension based on performance)

Competitive compensation based on experience and skills

Bi-monthly pay via money transfer

Paid career training relevant to the role

Performance-based bonuses

Work-life balance and flexible hours



How to Apply

We will be holding interviews on Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday this week for immediate hiring, contingent on your skills and company fit.



To Apply, Follow These Steps:

Reply with your Name and Position in the subject line. Example: "John Doe – Graphic Designer"

Define a staging area (this is part of your application process).



Submit the following:

Your resume (CV)

Portfolio links showcasing your original design work (no AI-generated content)

Websites you have designed (if applicable)



Once we receive your application, we will send you a scheduler to book your interview slot. You will be required to demonstrate proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite and Canva during the interview.



If you’re ready to bring your creativity to a team that values real design expertise, we look forward to your application!

title: Real Estate & Interior Design Assistant (Admin, Marketing & Lead Support) - 20260213

(Note that you would not be doing all these on daily basis.  But need openness and flexiblity to cover these tasks when needed.)

- Process automation using Maker or Zapier

- Lead generation, lead management, & cold calling

- Administrative & Coordination

- Coordinate with clients, contractors, designers, and other stakeholders

- Track timelines, deliverables, and next steps for active projects

Qualifications & Skills

- Must be familiar with Zapier or Make and WordPress

- Strong organizational and time-management skills

- Excellent written and verbal communication

- Comfortable with cold calling and client-facing communication

- Detail-oriented, reliable, and self-motivated

- Tech and AI savy and interested to learn new tools

- Real estate, interior design, or marketing experience

- CRM, MLS, Canva, or social media management experience

- Interior or architectual design experienc and skills to use AutoCad, SketchUp, and D5 a plus



When applying, include:

1. Are you able to work from 5PM-9PM PST, 8 hours a day, 5 days a week Thursday to Monday (including Saturday and Sunday)?

2. Your monthly part time pay expectation? (no hourly)

3. Include your cover letter, resume, and marketing portfolio

4. Do you have VPN? (do not apply if do not have VPN)

5. Are you comfortable with verbal english communication and working together as a team via video conference calls throughouot the day?

6. What is your experience with Maker or Zapier?

7.  What is your experience with WordPress?

8. What is your experience with AI?

9.  Do have experienc with interior design or archictual design software?

title: Video Editor – Aviation & Travel YouTube Channel
description:
We're looking for a skilled video editor to join the team behind a major aviation and travel YouTube channel with over 1 million subscribers. This is a full-time remote position with consistent, recurring work.



You'll be editing long-form YouTube videos covering airline reviews, hotel reviews, and aviation content. This includes working with multi-cam footage, narration, b-roll, and screen recordings, cutting to pace for strong audience retention, adding graphics, text overlays, and music, and managing file organization and project delivery on deadline.



Requirements: 

- Proficiency in Final Cut Pro (non-negotiable). 

- Demonstrated experience editing for other YouTube creators, ideally channels with 100K+ subscribers. 

- A genuine knowledge of aviation — you must be able to identify aircraft types (e.g., A350 vs. 787, A380 vs. 747) from footage. This will be tested during the interview. 

- Understanding of YouTube best practices including pacing, retention, and chapter structure. 

- Reliable communication and ability to meet deadlines across time zones.



Nice to have: 

- Interest in travel and airlines.

- Experience with motion graphics. 

- Familiarity with YouTube analytics and how editing choices affect retention.



To apply, send a brief intro about yourself and your aviation knowledge, links to 2–3 YouTube videos you've edited, and your availability.

title: Amazon Marketplace Manager – Set Up & Run Our Entire Amazon Store
description:
About the Role



Ironway is a fast-growing U.S. DTC brand selling rugged, military-inspired field watches. We are looking for a highly skilled Amazon Marketplace Manager who can set up, launch, and manage our Amazon presence from scratch.

This is currently a part-time role with huge growth potential inside the company.



Your Responsibilities: You will fully own the Amazon channel

- Keyword research (SEO keywords, ranking strategy)

- Write or optimize titles, bullets, descriptions & A+ content

- Ensure images follow Amazon guidelines (you will coordinate with our design team)



Daily Account Management



- Monitor account health, messages, feedback & compliance

- Manage inventory levels & coordinate FBA shipments

- Track sales, ACOS/TACOS, keyword performance

- Report daily and weekly numbers



Amazon PPC Advertising



- Set up Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, and other campaigns

- Create campaign structure, bids, and testing plans

- Optimize ACOS/TACOS

- Launch A/B tests

- Scale winning ads



Growth & Optimization



- Rank our main products for key keywords

- Monitor competitors

- Implement new experiments

- Coordinate with our store manager, creative team, and founder



Requirements



- 2+ years Amazon Seller Central experience

- Experience managing FBA, PPC ads, listings, and store health

- Strong English communicating skills

- Excellent attention to detail

- Reliable, independent worker

- Strong understanding of keyword research & PPC optimization

- Able to work during EU time zones



Salary & Benefits



- Salary range: $4-7/hour (depending on experience)

- Long-term, stable position

- Growth opportunities into Amazon Team Lead as we expand the channel

- Work directly with the founder (fast decisions, zero bureaucracy)

How to apply?



All candidates must apply ONLY through this Typeform: 
/to/Ve2uemJD



Applications sent through OnlineJobs messages will NOT be reviewed.

title: Excellent Motion Graphics Video Editor (Short Form + Long Form)
description:
Can you make this style of content?





We are Pro-Active Performance: U.S.-based golf performance and biomechanics company looking to hire a full-time Motion Graphics Video Editor. We help golfers improve their swing with personalized fitness and rehab exercises. 



We’re looking for someone who:

-Has strong competency in Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro, including masking, keyframing, and basic motion tracking for overlays

-Can create clean, engaging edits with pacing, zooms, captions, and visual emphasis that improve retention

-Is comfortable building 2D/3D overlays and motion graphics (sports/anatomy style content)

-Has experience using Canva or similar tools to create visually impressive static graphics or thumbnails

-Wants consistent full-time work (6+ hours/day) with ONE company instead of juggling multiple clients.

-Is interested in long-term, stable work and growing with a single brand.

-Takes feedback well and enjoys refining content to improve performance

-Has strong attention to detail and takes pride in making content look premium



What You’ll Do:



1) Short Form Content 

-Edit Instagram/
/ TikTok reels 

-Add captions and pattern interrupts (zooms, transitions, audio effects)

-Track and overlay anatomical muscles in 2D and 3D

-Pause video to highlight specific muscle overlays, then resume motion 

-Make and add motion graphics/ infographic elements to drive engagement



2) Long Form Youtube (10-20mins long)

-Visual hooks and motion graphics in the first 10 seconds. 

-Remove filler words and pauses to tighten pacing 

-Add animated text, charts and motion graphics at strategic times in the video 

-Insert B-roll and custom visual elements provided to you 

-Basic light color correction and audio cleanup 

-Overlays in Adobe 



3) Additional Tasks (Occasionally)

Required Skills:

-Adobe After Effects (overlays, motion tracking, masking, keyframing) 

-Adobe Premiere Pro

-Proficient English comprehension (reading, writing and communication) 

-Ability to manage your time effectively and meet deadlines consistently



Bonus (Not required but preferred)

Position Details:

-Long term role (6+mos minimum)

title: Digital Marketing  Online Marketing Specialist
description:
?? ??? ???? ??, ?? ??? ? ??? ??? ??? ??? ??? ? ? ?? ???? ???? ?? ?? ?????. ???? ???? ???? ??? ????? ??????.



JOB TITLE

All-in-One Digital Marketing & Growth Expert (K-Medical)



TYPE OF EMPLOYMENT

Remote (Work from Home) / Flexible



JOB DESCRIPTION

We are looking for a versatile Digital Marketing Expert who can lead our global growth through any and all effective online channels. We don't limit your methods—whether it's Reddit, SNS, SEO, Influencer Marketing, or any innovative digital strategy, we value your ability to drive results for a premier Korean Plastic Surgery & Dermatology clinic.



Key Responsibilities:



Full-Spectrum Digital Marketing: Execute marketing across any platform you deem effective (Reddit, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Forums, etc.) to reach English-speaking patients.

title: Customer Operations Agent (Fintech)
description:

As a Customer Operations Agent, you’ll be the friendly, trusted face of our brand—supporting customers with empathy and clarity whether they’re managing payments, reporting fraud, or simply need guidance. You’ll be a founding member of the Customer Service team and will play an increasingly important role as it grows.



This role is ideal for someone who started their career as a customer service agent and progressed into a leadership or management position, gaining hands-on experience while helping teams scale. Experience working with or within major financial institutions or fintechs such as Wells Fargo, JP Morgan, Starling Bank, or similar organizations is highly valued. We’re looking for someone who can bring both frontline expertise and leadership mindset to help shape our customer operations from the ground up.

* Opportunity to grow into a Team Lead/Manager position (with a raise) as the support team expands



Benefits:

* 100% Remote - work from anywhere in the Philippines.

* 15 days paid leave

* Bi-weekly salary payouts

* Paid time off and Philippine public holiday, listed here

* Supportive, startup-style culture where your ideas matter

* Clear growth path and strong learning opportunities in fintech



Working Hours:

* Training and Onboarding - Monday - Friday: 10 AM – 5 PM UK time (6:00 PM – 1:00 AM PH time)

* Normal shift schedule will be determined after training and onboarding

* Must be comfortable working during the weekends with weekdays rest days

* This is a full time role only (40 hours per week)



Core Responsibilities

* Deliver exceptional multi-channel support (chat,
, and phone) with a focus on first-contact resolution and high customer satisfaction.

* Uphold brand standards by communicating clearly, consistently, and professionally in all interactions.

* Actively manage brand reputation by professionally responding to all customer reviews and public feedback.

* Handle and resolve customer complaints with empathy and efficiency, knowing when and how to appropriately escalate complex issues.

* Oversee customer repayments and collections by assisting with payment management, rescheduling, and account oversight with professionalism and care.

* Protect the business by proactively identifying, investigating, and escalating suspicious activity and potential fraud cases.

* Leverage AI-driven tools to streamline workflows, optimize response times, and enhance the quality of support delivered.

* Drive continuous improvement by gathering and sharing actionable customer insights with product and internal teams to enhance offerings and processes.



You’re Perfect for This Role If You

* Have proven experience in customer service, ideally within fintech, payments, or * lending (BNPL experience a plus).

* Understand fraud detection, repayments, and collections, with empathy for customers’ financial situations.

* Communicate effectively across chat,
, and phone, adapting tone and approach to each channel.

* Are tech-savvy and comfortable using AI tools and automation to streamline work.

* Thrive in a fast-paced, customer-first startup environment where priorities shift quickly.

* Are an empathetic problem solver with strong attention to detail, professionalism, and integrity.



How to Apply:

* Click the link below to submit your application and let's get started:

title: Creative YouTube Editor (From Twitch VODs) - Paid Per Video, Long-Term
description:
Kamusta!!

I’m looking for a sharp, independent video editor to turn my Twitch streams into high-retention YouTube videos (roughly 8–15+ minutes).



This is not basic clip cutting.

You’ll review full VODs, identify strong 
nts, and shape them into videos with good pacing and retention.



My content is calm, conversational, and dense (fitness, mindset, lifestyle). I’m looking for someone who understands why a 
nt works; not just how to cut it.



Workflow (Designed to Stay Hands-Off for Me):

 - You pull directly from my Twitch VODs (no files sent)

– You identify 1 strong segment or theme per video

– You send timestamps + a 1-sentence hook for quick approval

– You edit the full video + create a CTR-focused thumbnail

– You send a draft (Drive link); max 1 feedback round

– Final delivery ? I upload

– Target: 1–3 videos per week

As trust builds, approval friction drops. The goal is autonomy.



What You’re Responsible For:

– Watch long VODs (2–4 hours)

– Identify 
nts worth turning into full YouTube videos

– Edit for pacing, structure, and viewer retention

– Create clean, clickable thumbnails

– Work independently and meet deadlines



Requirements:

– Experience editing long-form YouTube videos (Big plus if you have successful work with other YouTubers: share links)

– Understanding of hooks and retention (not just transitions)

– Good English reading comprehension

– Reliable internet + ability to work async

– Tools: Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve; Canva or Photoshop



Livestream, gaming, or fitness content experience is a plus.



Pay (Per Video):

• $18–30 USD per long-form YouTube video (8–15 min)

• Paid trial video

• Performance bonuses for strong CTR & retention

• Rates increase with trust, autonomy, and results



Bonuses & Growth:

– Long-term collaboration for editors who show judgment and taste

– Opportunity to expand into lifestyle / IRL content over time

– Potential path to full channel autonomy as output scales



How to Apply (Top Applicants Only):

1. Please share 2–3 links to long-form YouTube videos you've edited.

2. Answer this: “From a 3-hour Twitch VOD, what 
nt would you turn into a YouTube video — and why?”

3. One sentence on why you're the best fit for this role.



Applications without examples or answers will be ignored.

Shortlisted applicants will receive a paid trial video.



Salamat! Usap tayo.

title: Graphic Designer (Junior–Mid Level Welcome) — Print Production & Layout Systems
description:
Remote Graphic Designer — Print Production & Layout Systems ($3.50/hr Trial $3.75–$4.00/hr Long-Term)



I’m building a structured, scalable print production environment across multiple brands and looking for a graphic designer who enjoys creating designs that go directly into real-world printing and production.



This role combines creative design with production-ready layout work. Your designs will move directly from Adobe Creative Cloud into print, so understanding print setup such as bleed, crop marks, safe margins, and layout preparation is important.



We are looking for someone who enjoys both design and structured workflow systems, helping build templates and repeatable processes that make production faster and more efficient.



This is a stable, long-term role for someone who wants consistent work inside a structured environment.



This is not a one-off freelance project, this is a long-term internal operational role.



All business workflows and infrastructure details will be shared after NDA and hiring.



What You’ll Be Doing (Examples Only — Not Limited To):



• Create graphic designs for print products (business cards, flyers, postcards, signage, etc.)

• Deliver print-ready files with proper bleed, crop marks, safe margins, and correct sizing

• Understand and work with standard sheet sizes (8.5x11, 11x17, 12x18, 13x19, etc.)

• Build multi-up layouts (step & repeat / imposition layouts when required)

• Create and maintain reusable production templates

• Export production-ready PDFs optimized for printing

• Maintain organized file naming and folder structure

• Support fast-turnaround print production workflow



You’re a Good Fit If:



• Strong experience with Adobe Creative Cloud (Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop)

• Experience preparing files for print production

• Understand bleed, trim, gutters, crop marks, and safe zones

• Comfortable creating layouts that are immediately ready for printing

• Enjoy structured workflows and repeatable systems

• Fast responder and organized communicator

• Experience working in a print shop or production environment is a major plus



Junior–mid level candidates welcome if you are reliable and committed to learning structured workflows.



Work Style & Communication Expectations:



• Fast response communication during working hours is required

• Work inside structured workflows and template-based systems

• Reliability, speed, and consistency are prioritized over creative experimentation

• Daily workflow visibility and responsiveness are essential



Privacy & NDA Terms



• Signed NDA required before access

• Internal operational role (not client-facing)

• Trusted with private workflows and infrastructure

• No agencies or subcontracting



Minimum Requirements — Do Not Apply If:



• You primarily use Canva or beginner design tools

• You do not understand print-ready file setup

• You want short-term freelance projects only

• You require daily step-by-step supervision



Pay & Commitment:



• $3.50/hr — trial period

• Increase to $3.50–$4.00/hr based on speed, consistency, and ownership after trial

• Paid weekly initially ? bi-weekly after onboarding

• Long-term growth opportunity as production systems expand



Schedule (REQUIRED):



• Monday – Friday

• Work hours between 9:30 AM – 4:00 PM PST

• Approximately 25–35 hours per week

• This is a dedicated working schedule — not flexible freelance hours



HOW TO APPLY:

Copy and paste:



“Graphic Designer — [Your First Name]”



Include:

• Resume (required)

• Short introduction (2–5 sentences)

• Weekly availability + timezone

• Confirmation you accept rate + NDA

• Confirmation you can work within required schedule window

• Portfolio showing PRINT-READY design work (REQUIRED)

• One example where you prepared a file for printing



Applications missing required information will not be reviewed.



If you’re reliable, structured, and understand both design and print production — let’s build.



Blue River Management

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexible Work Schedule
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Lead Social Media Manager – Build With a Public Figure
description:

Ohhh we’re not hiring an employee… we’re hiring a **brand driver**. Let’s make this feel magnetic. If you love fast-paced environments, bold brands, viral 
nts, and turning content into conversations — this is your role.  We’re looking for a **high-energy, creative powerhouse** to become the Lead Social Media Manager for a U.S.-based public figure. This is not a “clock in, clock out” job. This is a build-something-big role.

ntum)

 This Role Is Fast, Fun, and High-Expectation

Requirements

 • Calm, professional, and solution-oriented mindset

 • Strong attention to detail and ability to follow brand tone guidelines

 • Basic understanding of customer service, refunds, and online reputation management

 • Must be reliable, organized, and responsive

title: Social Media Manager - Job Description
description:
IMPORTANT: To apply, you must submit a video introduction as your first step in the application process.

Position Overview



We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Social Media Manager to manage the social media presence of a prominent public figure. This is a fast-paced, demanding role that requires excellent energy, a strong work ethic, and the ability to thrive in a high-visibility environment.

Key Responsibilities



Content Management: Post 2-3 times daily across all social media platforms, maintaining consistent brand voice and messaging

Engagement: Actively engage with followers, respond to comments and messages, and build community relationships

Content Scheduling: Develop, organize, and maintain a comprehensive content calendar to ensure consistent posting and strategic timing

Analytics & Insights: Monitor, analyze, and report on social media metrics and insights to optimize performance and growth

Strategy Leadership: Serve as the lead social media strategist, making data-driven decisions to maximize reach and engagement

Trend Monitoring: Stay current on social media trends, platform updates, and best practices to keep content fresh and relevant



Required Qualifications



Proven experience managing social media accounts for public figures, brands, or high-profile clients

Deep understanding of all major social media platforms (Instagram,
/X,
, TikTok, LinkedIn, etc.)

Excellent Canva skills - must be proficient in creating professional, engaging graphics and visual content

Must know ChatGPT - experience using AI tools for content creation, brainstorming, and efficiency

Strong ability to read, interpret, and act on social media analytics and insights

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Exceptional organizational and time management abilities

Creative mindset with an eye for engaging content

High energy and positive attitude

Outstanding work ethic and reliability

Ability to work independently and make quick decisions

Comfortable working in a fast-paced, demanding environment



Personal Attributes



Proactive and self-motivated

Detail-oriented with strong multitasking abilities

Adaptable and quick to respond to real-time opportunities

Professional with excellent judgment

Passionate about social media and digital content



Application Requirements

You must submit a video introduction explaining:



Your relevant experience

Why you're the right fit for this role

Your approach to managing a public figure's social media presence

Examples of past successes (if applicable)
