title: Part-Time Bookkeeper + Cash Flow / Finance Manager (Remote)
description:
TITLE:

Part-Time Bookkeeper + Cash Flow / Finance Manager (QuickBooks Online) - Remote



HOURS:

Part-time to start (20-25 hrs/week), with opportunity to grow into full-time

Must overlap 2-3 hours with Vancouver, Canada (PST)



START:

ASAP



PAY:

Competitive and based on experience. We pay for quality.



ABOUT US:

We are a Vancouver, Canada-based high-end residential construction supplier and installer (project-based). We work on luxury custom homes and manage large project invoices, deposits, progress payments, and job costs.



This is a serious role. We are not looking for a generic VA. We are looking for a real accounting professional who can take ownership of our bookkeeping and help manage the overall financial health of the company.



We are looking for someone long-term. If you are looking for short-term work, freelancing, or multiple clients, this role is not a good fit. We want someone who will become part of the company for years, grow with us, and be treated like part of the team.



ROLE SUMMARY:

You will be responsible for keeping our accounting clean and accurate in QuickBooks Online, ensuring reconciliations are done properly, tracking job profitability, and maintaining cash flow visibility for the owner.



Our transaction volume is not huge, but our invoices are large and accuracy is extremely important.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

QuickBooks Online bookkeeping and cleanup.

Bank and credit card reconciliations.

Accounts payable and accounts receivable.

Transaction categorization and proper coding.

Maintaining a clean chart of accounts and organized records.

Tracking income and costs by job/project (job costing).

Tracking deposits and progress payments correctly.

Monitoring job profitability while projects are active.

Maintaining a cash flow statement and identifying cash flow risks early.

Providing a simple monthly financial health summary to the owner.

Monthly reporting including Profit and Loss, Balance Sheet, AR Aging, cash summary, and basic job margin snapshot.

Preparing clean year-end records for our external accountant.

Supporting GST/PST preparation (Canada). Guidance will be provided.



REQUIREMENTS (STRICT):

Strong QuickBooks Online experience.

Strong reconciliation skills.

Month-end close experience.

Experience preparing financial reports.

Strong English communication (written and spoken).

High attention to detail and strong follow-through.

Professionalism and confidentiality.



PREFERRED (STRONGLY):

Construction or project-based accounting experience.

Job costing experience.

Audit, controller, or accounting manager experience.

Buildertrend or similar software experience



BENEFITS:

Long-term stable role.

Part-time to start with growth to full-time.

Two weeks paid vacation per year (once full-time).

Respectful, professional working environment.

Clear expectations and communication.



IMPORTANT: HOW TO APPLY (READ CAREFULLY)

Applications that do not follow instructions will be ignored. We are using this process to filter applicants who are serious and detail-oriented.



STEP 1:

Write this at the top of your application:

I READ THE INSTRUCTIONS



STEP 2:

Answer these questions in writing:



Explain step-by-step how you reconcile a bank account in QuickBooks Online.



How do you create and maintain a cash flow statement for a business?



Have you tracked profit per job/project before? If yes, explain how.



Expected salary for part-time (20-25 hrs/week) and full-time (40 hrs/week) in CAD.



What is one common mistake you see in QuickBooks files, and how do you fix it?



STEP 3:

Submit ONE short video (60-90 seconds):

In the video, include your name and current role.

Explain your QuickBooks experience.

Explain your month-end close process in checklist style.



Video can be Loom, Google Drive, or YouTube unlisted.



OPTIONAL BONUS:

Attach a screenshot of a bank reconciliation screen you personally completed in QuickBooks Online.

Blur all confidential information.



FINAL NOTE:

If your profile includes unrelated services such as social media, graphic design, video editing, or lead generation, we will assume accounting is not your main skill.

We are looking for an accounting professional who takes this role seriously.

title: Sales Associate that will call warm leads
description:
**TO APPLY YOU MUST CREATE A SHORT VIDEO INTRODUCING YOURSELF AND WHY YOU WILL BE THE PEFERCT CANIDADTE FOR THIS POSITION.



 Sales Associate – Digital Product Training (75+ Calls Daily)



Position: Full-Time Sales Closer

Industry: Digital Products / Online Education

Location: Remote

Compensation: Base + Commission (High Earning Potential)



About Us



We are a fast-growing digital education company that helps entrepreneurs create and sell digital products. We host live trainings and sell an all-in-one Digital Products Creators Sales & Marketing System.



We are NOT looking for someone who “likes sales.”

We are looking for someone who lives and breathes closing.



Your Role: You will be responsible for calling warm leads daily from paid ads and a free training we conducted to:



* Sell tickets to our Digital Product Creators Mentorship Training

* Close sales for our Digital Product Creators Sales & Marketing System

* Follow up with prospects consistently

* Overcome objections confidently

* Hit daily call and revenue targets



You will be on the phone ALL DAY. This is a performance-driven role.



Daily Requirements



* Minimum 75-100 outbound calls per day

* Consistent follow-up via phone & SMS

* Daily reporting of:



Calls made

Conversations

Sales closed

Revenue generated

Comfortable handling objections and pushing for the close



Who We’re Looking For



You MUST have:



* Minimum **2+ years of phone sales experience**

* Strong closing skills

* Aggressive, confident, and results-driven personality

* Thick skin (you will hear “no” often)

* Ability to build urgency and create excitement

* High energy and professional tone on calls

* Reliable internet and quiet workspace



This is NOT for beginners.

This is for closers who want to win.



Compensation



* Competitive base pay

* Commission on every sale

* Performance bonuses for hitting targets

* High income potential for top performers



If you cannot handle rejection, high call volume, or aggressive targets — this role is not for you.



???? To Apply



Send:



1. A short video (2–3 minutes) introducing yourself and why you will be the perfect canidate for this position

2. Your sales experience (include metrics if possible)

3. Your average daily call volume in past roles

4. Why you believe you are a closer and not just a salesperson



Only serious closers apply.

description:
??? ??(Native/Near-native)??? ??? ????, ??? ?? ??? ??? ??? ?? ?? ??? ???? ?? ??? ????. ?? ??? ???? ??? ??????.



JOB TITLE

Global Marketing Specialist (K-Plastic Surgery & Dermatology)

JOB DESCRIPTION

We are looking for a results-driven Social Media Marketing Specialist to lead our global outreach for a premier Korean Plastic Surgery & Dermatology clinic. This role is focused on attracting and engaging patients from English-speaking countries (USA, UK, Canada, etc.) through strategic viral marketing.



Key Responsibilities:



Targeted Viral Marketing: Execute organic and viral campaigns on Reddit, Instagram, and TikTok specifically tailored to the aesthetic interests of the English-speaking market.



Community Engagement: Build brand awareness within medical tourism and beauty subreddits and manage the clinic's online reputation.



Trend Seizing: Leverage trending K-Beauty topics to create high-converting content (Before/After showcases, procedural explainers).



Lead Generation: Successfully convert social media engagement into inquiries from international patients.



What We Offer (Top-tier Rewards for Results):



Performance-Based Bonuses: Exceptional results will be met with exceptional financial rewards. We offer a highly attractive bonus structure tied to your marketing success.



Elite Treatment for Proven Talent: If you can demonstrate your ability to deliver high-impact results, we guarantee top-tier compensation that matches your expertise.



100% Remote & Flexible: Work from anywhere. We value high-quality output and efficiency over fixed office hours.



Qualifications:



Proven track record of success in Reddit and SNS marketing (Instagram, TikTok).



Strong understanding of Western beauty trends and the medical tourism market.



Self-motivated, result-oriented, and able to work independently.

title: Social Media & Customer Support VA (E-commerce)
description:
Hi there! I’m an e-commerce business owner, managing several social media pages across different product niches. I’m hiring a reliable VA to handle content publishing across our accounts and assist with basic customer support. I’m looking for someone detail-oriented, fast to learn, and able to follow clear instructions long-term.



Main tasks



 1. Content Publishing (core task)



 • You will take ready-made videos + ready-made captions/hashtags and save them as drafts on each platform.

 • Publish daily based on my schedule.

 • You will work with multiple accounts across different niches on Instagram,
, TikTok, and YouTube.

 • You will post using remote access to my devices (you don’t need to buy anything).



 2. Basic Page Management



 • Post Stories daily (I provide the text + links; you just publish).

 • Reply to comments under videos with simple replies (mostly directing people to our website).



 3. Customer Support 
)



 • Reply to customers via Zoho
 (training provided).

 • Check order details in Shopify (training provided).

 • You will use ChatGPT Plus (provided by me) with ready prompts/templates (training provided).



 4. Account Growth + Product Research



 • Help grow new IG/FB pages using my simple system (training provided).

 • Product research: find viral products/videos (training provided).



Tools



Instagram,
, TikTok, YouTube, Zoho, Shopify, ChatGPT, Notion,
, Trello, Google Drive, and remote control to work on my devices.

All accounts, logins, links, and access will be provided by me — everything will be set up and ready. You will also receive clear training and instructions on how to use everything.



Requirements

 • English B1–B2 (preferably B2): you must understand English content and instructions.

 • Very stable internet (critical for remote work on devices).

 • Comfortable using all 4 social platforms.

 • Fast learner, flexible, detail-oriented, and okay with frequent changes/testing.



TEST TASK (PAID)

Before hiring, shortlisted candidates will complete a paid test task. It will take no more than 1 hour, and I will pay for your time.

The test will include:

 • Choosing which video looks more “viral”.

 • Picking the best video for a specific niche page.

 • Writing short replies for 3 customer support scenarios.

 • A quick attention-to-detail check (spot differences in similar screenshots).



PAY & SCHEDULE

 • Pay: up to $550/month (based on skills and interview). Please include your desired pay.

 • Trial: 15-day paid trial. If everything is good, we continue long-term.

 • Schedule: Mon–Fri, 6–8 hours/day. Final daily hours will be agreed during the interview, and once set, we will stick to that schedule consistently.

 • Growth: In the future, as the business expands, there may be an opportunity for career growth — you can become a Senior VA as I hire additional tea
mbers.



If this sounds like you, please apply below. In your application, start the first line with “PINEAPPLE” so I know you read the full job description.



Kind regards,

Vladyslav

title: Full-Time Remote Bookkeeper – Australian Supermarket Group (Xero Required)
description:
We are an Australian-owned independent supermarket group based in Melbourne seeking a full-time remote bookkeeper to work directly with the business owner.



We operate:



• Two Foodworks supermarkets

• A central production kitchen supplying both stores

• A wholesale fresh produce division (purchasing from wholesale markets and supplying internally to our stores)

• High daily transaction volume across multiple business units



This is a long-term, stable position for someone experienced with Australian bookkeeping, Xero, and multi-entity reporting.



Key Responsibilities



• Daily bank reconciliations in Xero

• Accounts payable & supplier reconciliations

• Managing wholesale produce purchases and internal transfers

• Tracking cost of goods between wholesale buisness and the stores

• Payroll processing (including superannuation)

• GST coding & BAS preparation support

• Weekly wage % reporting (ex-GST sales)

• Separate reporting for:

– Store 1

– Store 2 then combined sales (all on templates already)

– Production kitchen

– Wholesale produce division

• Department sales tracking (produce, florist, juice, etc.)

• Monthly P&L preparation by division
salary: Competitive monthly salary based on expe

title: Property Manager & Executive Assistant
description:
I’m a real estate entrepreneur based in Dallas, Texas, running two connected businesses: a real estate sales team that helps buyers and sellers, and a property management company that operates furnished co-living rentals. We use ClickUp for task and project management and Google Drive as our primary file system. We also use Buildium as our main property management tool.



I’m looking for a full-time Property Manager who becomes the operational hub for the property management side of the business — overseeing day-to-day execution, tenant and vendor coordination, and ensuring our systems and processes are followed accurately and consistently as we continue to scale.



WHAT YOU’LL DO

- Serve as a primary point of contact for tenants, vendors, and taskers (escalating issues as needed)

- Coordinate furnishing installs, turns, maintenance requests, and vendor schedules

- Coordinate closely with the Property Management Department Lead to align priorities and next steps

- Review applications and move qualified leads through the leasing pipeline daily

- Execute workflows in ClickUp and Buildium (statuses, due dates, tags, notes, and documentation)

- Manage day-to-day conversations with tenants and vendors to keep items moving

- Help create and document SOPs for recurring workflows

- Maintain and update SOPs/process documentation as changes are made, ensuring the team is working off the latest version

- Ensure follow-up and closure on every open item — nothing falls through the cracks



YOU’D BE A GREAT FIT IF

- You have property management experience

- You follow instructions exactly and don’t cut corners

- You write and speak clearly in English

- You stay calm managing many moving parts

- You take ownership and don’t need hand-holding

- You take initiative: you spot issues early, investigate, and propose next steps/solutions

- You use good judgment and can prioritize without being told every step

- You thrive in a fast-paced environment and can adapt quickly as priorities shift

- Tools experience preferred: Buildium, ClickUp, Google Workspace (we will train — instruction-following matters more than expertise)



ROLE DETAILS

- Full-time, remote

- Schedule: Mon–Fri, aligned with CST

- Pay: $4-6 USD/hour, based on experience

- Long-term role with growth and bonuses



HOW TO APPLY (READ CAREFULLY)

We do not review platfor
ssages.

Applications that don’t follow instructions are disqualified.



STEP 1 —

1. Send an
 to 

2. Subject line: Property Manager – [Full Name]

3.
 body must include only:

- A short greeting

- A Google Drive folder link

- Your answer to the Detail Check (see Step 3)



STEP 2 — GOOGLE DRIVE FOLDER

1. Create a folder named: [Your Full Name] — Property Manager Application

2. Set sharing to “Anyone with the link can view.”

3. You can organize the folder however you think is best. I will be looking at both what you submit and how you organize it.

4. Include the following:

a. Resume (PDF)

b. Tech and Setup

   - Include a screenshot of your internet speed showing download and upload speeds. 

   - Include a screenshot of your computer specs showing RAM, processor, and OS.

   - Include one photo of your current workspace (desk and computer).

c. Written Answers (one Google Doc)

   - Property Management Experience

      - Describe one property management role or company you worked with. Include:

      - Number of properties/units

      - Your day-to-day responsibilities

      - Tools you used (Buildium, AppFolio, ClickUp, spreadsheets, etc.)

   - Taking Ownership

      - We already have SOPs and systems, but they’re still improving.

      - What would you focus on in your first 2 weeks to keep operations running smoothly without needing constant supervision?

d. Systems Proof (2–4 screenshots)

   - At least 1 “HQ” or home base view you’ve built (for a founder/team)

      Example: a dashboard, control panel, or main view in ClickUp, Asana, Notion, etc.

   - At least 1 project management board or folder structure you created

      Example: a tool for maintenance tracking, tenant or leasing pipeline, or vendor coordination

   - For each screenshot, add a short caption (this can be in a small Google Doc or directly on the image as text), including:

      - What the system is used for

      - Which tool it’s in (ClickUp, Asana, Google Drive, Notion, etc.)

      - What part you personally designed or organized

   - If you cannot share screenshots from a previous client because of confidentiality, you may recreate a similar structure in a fresh workspace (with fake data) and take screenshots of that instead.

e. Video Introduction (2–4 minutes)

   - Who you are and where you’re based

   - Your property management experience

   - Example of handling multiple stakeholders at once

   - How you personally stay organized



STEP 3 — DETAIL CHECK

At the very bottom of your
 (under the Drive link), write only the price per square foot for this property:



3384 P Avenue, Plano, TX 75074 – Sold for 255,555 USD.



Just include the final price per square foot number, with no explanation.



WHAT HAPPENS NEXT

-
 application screen

- Systems portfolio review

- Paid sample task (1-2 hours)

- Interview

- Hire

title: Senior Google Ads Media Buyer – eCommerce
description:
Type of Contract: Independent Contractor

Working Hours: CET Business Hours, Monday to Friday



About the Client:

A specialized advertising agency based in Munich, Germany, focused exclusively on performance marketing for e-commerce brands. They help ambitious online shops scale to 7- or 8-figure revenues in the DACH market (Germany, Austria, Switzerland). Their goal is to grow e-commerce businesses through data-driven Google Ads campaigns while building in-house knowledge and reducing dependency on external partners.



About the Role:

We’re looking for a hands-on Senior Google Ads Media Buyer to join their team. This is not a management role—you’ll execute campaigns yourself, optimize for performance, and create internal training videos (Loom) to explain strategies and processes.



Core Focus:

- Plan, execute, and optimize Google Ads campaigns for multiple e-commerce brands.

- Record Loom videos explaining your strategies, processes, and optimizations.

- Optionally run German-language campaigns with AI assistance and propose solutions for overcoming the language barrier.

- Rapidly test, iterate, and scale campaigns based on results.

- Collaborate with the team to develop playbooks, but execute campaigns hands-on yourself.

- Focus on measurable results and performance over perfection.



You’re a strong fit if you:

- Have solid experience running Google Ads for e-commerce brands.

- Can communicate campaign strategies clearly through video.

- Think like a performance marketer and execute hands-on campaigns.

- Have experience with high-spend accounts or performance-focused teams.

- Are proactive and able to creatively solve challenges like language barriers.



Nice-to-Have:

- Experience running Google Ads in German or other non-native languages.

- Familiarity with e-commerce funnels, promotions, and international campaigns.

- Experience creating internal training resources or documentation.



To Apply:

Kindly fill out this form

title: Virtual Operations Assistant (Creator Management & CRM)
description:
Role Overview



This role supports day-to-day operations with a focus on creator coordination, data tracking, and execution oversight. You will be responsible for keeping systems clean, communications tight, and performance visible. This is an execution-heavy role with room to scale into full-time as operations expand.



Key Responsibilities



* Manage and maintain communication with content creators to ensure deliverables, timelines, and expectations are met

* Log, update, and manage creator data using a CRM or structured tracking system (accounts, videos posted, views, performance metrics)

* Monitor creator output consistently and track backend performance data

* Verify reposting activity is completed correctly and on schedule

* Maintain accurate records and reports for internal review

* Needs to be responsive and ready to act act between 6pm - 10am PH time, you wont be expected to be working all of that time but be ready to receive tasks and do them ASAP

* Works 7 days a week

* Handle miscellaneous operational and administrative tasks as needed as the role evolves



Requirements



* Strong written communication skills (English)

* High attention to detail and ability to follow systems and processes

* Experience with CRMs, spreadsheets, or data tracking tools (or fast learner)

* Organized, reliable, and proactive

* Comfortable working independently in a remote environment

* Willingness to scale responsibilities as the role grows



Nice to Have



* Experience working with creators, influencers, or social media accounts

* Familiarity with content performance metrics (views, engagement, posting schedules)



Growth Opportunity



This role is designed to scale. Strong performance can lead to increased responsibility, hours, and long-term placement as operations move toward full-time support.



To Apply:

Include a brief summary of your experience with admin work, CRMs, or creator management, and confirm your availability and internet reliability.

title: Full-Time Video Editor (Content Team, Retainer Role)
description:
We’re looking for a reliable, efficient Video Editor to join our content team on a monthly retainer. This is not a freelance, one-off gig, we want someone long-term who can grow with us, learn our systems, and help us push out consistent high-performing content across short-form and long-form platforms.



Experience is NOT mandatory. Efficiency, communication, and strong English skills are. We will help train you on our editing style, workflow, and expectations.



What You’ll Be Doing:



Editing short-form content (Reels, TikTok, Meta Ads, YouTube Shorts)



Editing long-form videos (YouTube, VSLs, podcasts, educational content)



Following structured editing guidelines, templates, and brand style



Implementing subtitles, cuts, pacing, zooms, and basic motion graphics



Organizing project files and maintaining a clean workflow



Working closely with our team to revise and improve content quickly



Requirements:



Strong English communication, both written and spoken



Fast turnaround and ability to follow systems



Reliable internet and ability to communicate daily



Coachable mindset, open to feedback and learning



Ability to manage multiple projects efficiently



Nice to Have (Not Required):



CapCut, Premiere Pro, or Final Cut experience



Understanding of social media pacing and attention hooks



Experience with short-form content or ads



Compensation:



$500/month retainer



Long-term opportunity with growth potential as the team scales



How to Apply:

Send a short message introducing yourself, your timezone, and examples of any editing work (if available). If you don’t have experience, explain why you believe you can learn fast and stay consistent.



IMPORTANT: Make the subject line of your application "TWIX EDIT TWIX"

title: E-Commerce Growth Manager (Full-Time, High-Performance Role)
description:
About Us



We’re a Canadian manufacturer established in 1990, now entering an exciting new growth phase.



Our brands — Plastair (innovative watering products), DeeVa (personal wellness & therapeutic devices), and PlastairFyre (outdoor fireplaces) — are Made in Canada and distributed across North America.



We’ve dominated brick-and-mortar retail for years. Now we’re scaling our Direct-to-Consumer (B2C) division to millions in annual sales.



We’re looking for a leader who’s ready to take ownership of that transformation.



The Role



This is not a VA position — this is a management-level role with room to grow into Director of E-Commerce.



You will:



Build and lead a small team (ads, creatives, and content support).



Develop and execute strategies across Amazon US/CA/UK/EU/Asia, Shopify, 
, and Wayfair.



Manage ad budgets, track performance, and ensure ROI targets are met.



Coordinate promotions, influencer partnerships, and content creation.



Report directly to ownership and take responsibility for results.



This role is ideal for a self-driven e-commerce professional in their late 20s to early 30s who’s ready to step up and run a division, not just accounts.



Your Responsibilities



Create a comprehensive global e-commerce strategy and action plan.



Hire, train, and manage 2–4 tea
mbers (VA or specialized roles).



Manage Amazon and Meta ad campaigns and continuously optimize ROI.



Oversee product listings, images, and A + content for all marketplaces.



Coordinate with our graphics, photo, and video team to improve digital assets.



Build influencer and affiliate relationships.



Analyze weekly reports, identify growth opportunities, and make fast, data-driven decisions.



Own results — think and act like it’s your business line.



Key Performance Targets



Amazon ACOS < 15 %



Meta ROAS > 6 ×



Launch 
 and Wayfair within 3 months.



Expand into 2 new Amazon markets within 6 months.



Achieve a 400 % increase in B2C revenue by 2026 while maintaining gross margins > 30 %.



You’ll Succeed If You



Have 3 + years of e-commerce experience, including team or campaign management.



Have launched or managed multiple Amazon or Shopify brands.



Are comfortable hiring and leading others.



Communicate fluently in English and can coordinate with North American teams.



Are entrepreneurial, analytical, and thrive on responsibility.



Can overlap 2–3 hours daily with Eastern Time.



Are ready to work full-time and fully commit to one company’s success.



How to Apply



Send:

1?? Your résumé showing your e-commerce and leadership experience.

2?? A detailed 200-word action plan outlining how you would grow Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre online within your first 90 days.

We expect candidates to research our existing brands, products, and current online presence before writing their plan. Generic or copy-paste responses will not be considered.

3?? Links to brands or campaigns you’ve managed + specific results.

title: Head of Digital Revenue, Marketplaces and DTC
description:
About Us



We are a Canadian manufacturer established in 1990. Our brands, Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre, are built on differentiated products, strong margins, and when appropriate, utility patents or design patents. We manufacture in Canada, or source electronics overseas, then protect and position them properly.



We have dominated brick and mortar retail for decades. Now we are building a serious digital revenue engine. Our online presence is underdeveloped relative to our product strength, and we want fast, measurable improvement without the owner being the day to day operator.



The Role



This is a full time leadership role for a true owner operator. You will own digital revenue results across Amazon Seller, Shopify DTC, and additional marketplaces including Walmart, Wayfair, and digital B2B platforms such as Faire and Grainger.



This is not a VA role, not a coordinator role, not a task manager role. Your job is to build the machine, lead people, make decisions, and remove work from ownership’s plate.



You will manage and leverage our existing Amazon operations resource, Arnel, and you will rebuild our creative production function to improve speed, accuracy, and quality.



What Success Looks Like



Within 60 to 90 days, ownership should experience a real reduction in day to day decisions, fewer errors, faster execution, clearer reporting, and visible 
ntum across listings, creative, ads, and channel expansion.



If you do not remove work from the owner’s plate, you are not a fit.



Core Responsibilities

Digital revenue ownership and execution cadence



Own the digital revenue plan, priorities, and weekly execution cadence across all digital channels



Make decisions, do not push decisions upward unless budget risk or strategy change is required



Implement a simple weekly reporting system showing revenue, margin, conversion, TACOS, ACOS, ROAS, inventory health, and next actions



Marketplaces and Shopify DTC



Own Amazon Seller growth, SKU focus, pricing strategy, merchandising, promotions, and catalog health



Own Shopify DTC fundamentals, conversion rate improvement, product page quality, offers, and traffic plans



Launch and scale Walmart and Wayfair with correct catalog setup, content requirements, compliance, and fulfillment workflows



Plan and execute international Amazon expansion when unit economics and operational readiness support it



Digital B2B marketplaces



Own digital B2B marketplace performance including platforms such as Faire and Grainger



Ensure pricing, content, and inventory strategy align with brand positioning and avoid channel conflict



Coordinate onboarding, catalog setup, and ongoing optimization for digital wholesale platforms



Paid media strategy and performance



Own paid media strategy and budget allocation across Amazon ads and Meta, plus other channels as appropriate



You may execute ads yourself or manage a specialist, but you are accountable for outcomes



Build repeatable testing systems for keywords, creative, offers, and landing pages, not random changes



Creative, content, and influencer systems



Rebuild our creative production to improve speed, accuracy, and taste



Create a repeatable workflow for product images, video, A plus content, storefronts, and ad creative



Build an influencer and UGC pipeline that produces usable assets and measurable performance, not vanity metrics



Team leadership and accountability



Manage Arnel as Amazon Operations Lead, inventory, listings execution, and operational hygiene



Hire and manage the minimum team needed to win, typically 2 to 4 people across ads execution and creative production



Build SOPs so performance does not depend on any one person



What We Already Have



Strong product differentiation, IP strategy, and manufacturing capability



Existing Amazon operations support, currently part time



Clear need to rebuild creative production due to speed and error issues



Required Experience and Traits



Proven ownership of ecommerce growth and results, not just tasks



Experience managing Amazon Seller Central and at least two of the following, Shopify DTC, Walmart, Wayfair, Faire, Grainger



Demonstrated leadership, hiring, training, accountability, and building repeatable systems



Strong analytical thinking, comfortable with margin math and channel tradeoffs



High urgency, fast execution, high quality, low error tolerance



Fluent English, able to overlap 2 to 3 hours daily with Eastern Time



Full time commitment to one company and long term mindset



Performance Targets



Targets will be confirmed after your initial audit, but you should expect accountability for:



Meaningful growth from the current Amazon baseline while protecting contribution margin



Clean scalable paid media performance with controlled ACOS and improving TACOS over time



Walmart and Wayfair live with correct catalog, operational workflows, and launch plan



Clear improvement in listing quality, creative quality, and production speed



Digital B2B marketplace launches and optimization without channel conflict



International expansion roadmap for at least one additional Amazon region when economics support it



How to Apply, Required



Submit all items or you will be rejected.



Your resume



A 200 word plan for your first 90 days, specific to Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre, generic plans will be rejected



Links to brands, stores, or campaigns you directly managed, include specific results such as revenue impact, ACOS, TACOS, ROAS, conversion, growth rate

Optional, a 2 to 3 minute Loom video introducing yourself and explaining one case study win



Screening Note



We prioritize candidates who demonstrate ownership, decision making, and evidence of removing work from founders, not candidates who list tools and tasks.

title: Operations Support Assistant
description:
Compensation & Schedule



Hours: ~5–10 hours/week

Rate: $6–9/hr (based on experience)

Location: Remote

Reports to: Founder

Schedule: Flexible, mostly project-based



About the Role



We’re seeking a highly organized, tech-savvy Operations Support Assistant to support a growing consulting business with backend systems and foundational brand assets.



This role begins with a setup phase focused on CRM organization and branding, then transitions into light, ongoing support once systems and materials are established. This is a behind-the-scenes implementation role, not a client-facing executive assistant position.



Primary Focus (First 30–60 Days)



You’ll take ownership of setting up core operational and brand systems to give the founder clarity, consistency, and reliable workflows. This includes:



Organize and configure a GoHighLevel CRM (contacts, pipelines, calendars, basic workflows)

Clean and import existing contacts

Set up simple automations (intake forms, follow-ups, reminders)

Support contract and invoicing tool setup

Organize brand assets and files

Translating founder-provided vision and content into cohesive brand materials



Ongoing Support (As Needed)



Once systems are established, ongoing work may include:



Maintain CRM accuracy and organization

Create simple SOPs and internal documentation

Create visuals, materials, and presentations using the branding package and founder content

Support setup of client-facing accounts and workflows (based on founder input)

Assist with basic website updates or development

Organize files, content, and priorities for the founder



Skills & Experience



Required:



Experience supporting a small business, founder, or consultant

Hands-on experience with CRMs (GoHighLevel strongly preferred)

Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

Comfortable working independently with clear deliverables

Excellent written English communication



Nice to Have (Not Required):



Canva or basic design experience

Experience creating one-pagers or presentations

Familiarity with automations, e-signature tools, or websites



 

To apply, kindly fill out the form using this link:

title: Environmental Data Anaylst - Dallas, TX (Remote)
description:
Remote Virtual Assistant – Data Analyst (Dallas, TX Market)

Company: MSE Environmental

Location: Remote (Serving the Dallas, TX Market)

Schedule: Night Shift (Dallas CDT) — 8:00 AM to 6:30 PM CDT

Type: Independent Contractor

Industry: Environmental Consulting & Industrial Hygiene

About Us

MSE Environmental is a rapidly growing environmental consulting firm recognized as a leader in environmental testing and industrial hygiene services. With operations across Texas, Nevada, and California, we specialize in asbestos, lead, mold, and bacteria assessments, as well as Phase I Environmental Site Assessments.



Our mission is simple: provide responsive, accurate, and compliant environmental solutions that protect our clients and communities.

Learn more about our culture and values here: 

Position Overview

We are seeking a Virtual Assistant – Data Analyst to support our Dallas, TX operations. This remote role requires exceptional attention to detail, professionalism, and communication skills. You will collaborate closely with Project Managers and Environmental Consultants to prepare laboratory reports, interpret data, manage client communications, and ensure timely delivery of accurate results.



This is an excellent opportunity for individuals interested in business operations, customer service, or environmental science, and who want to grow within a respected and expanding organization.

Key Responsibilities

• Prepare environmental laboratory reports for Asbestos, Lead, Mold, or Bacteria with precision and speed.

• Interpret laboratory data with Environmental Consultants and relay results to clients within 15 minutes or less after receipt.

• Assist Project Managers and Environmental Consultants in laboratory results preparation and client updates.

• Provide excellent customer service and phone/email communication to clients.

• Coordinate with field staff, vendors, and laboratories to ensure timely delivery of results.

• Respond to high-volume
 and phone inquiries professionally and efficiently.

• Utilize software platforms such as Google Workspace, Slack, Aircall, and CRM tools daily.

• Manage multiple assignments simultaneously while maintaining accuracy and organization.

Qualifications

• 2+ years of experience in customer service or administrative support.

• Excellent English communication (written and verbal) and phone etiquette — C1 level English proficiency preferred.

• Proficiency with Windows 7 or higher, Microsoft Word/Excel, Outlook, and Google Workspace.

• Typing speed: 50+ WPM (will be tested).

• Strong organizational and multitasking skills.

• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

• Prior experience in environmental services or industrial hygiene (preferred, not required).

• Must have a quiet, distraction-free home office setup with no animals or background noise, including:

• Reliable computer (8 GB RAM minimum)

• 25+ Mbps internet connection

• Noise-cancelling headset.

Schedule

Monday – Friday: 8:00 AM – 6:30 PM (Dallas CDT)

Must be flexible for occasional extended hours or urgent client needs.

Required Screening Questions

• What is your temperament type (Sanguine, Choleric, Melancholic, or Phlegmatic)?

• Do you work well with others?

• Do you have good English phone etiquette?

• Have you ever worked nights before?

• Do you agree to live and work by the MSE Environmental Foundations of Our Brand? (Yes/No)

Speaking Test Instructions

As part of your application, please complete a short English speaking test.



Record yourself reading the paragraph below using 
 or 
.

Once complete, include your recording link at the top of your cover letter or
 reply.

Speaking Test Paragraph

Hi Erik,

My name is [Your Name], and I’m excited to apply for the Virtual Assistant – Data Analyst position at MSE Environmental. I have strong English communication skills and a background in customer service, data reporting, and administrative support.

I take pride in being detail-oriented and reliable, and I understand the importance of accuracy and professionalism when communicating with clients.

I’m confident that my experience, work ethic, and commitment to providing excellent service align with the values of MSE Environmental.

Thank you for considering my application — I look forward to the opportunity to contribute to your team.

Compensation

This is a contractor position with competitive hourly pay, commensurate with experience and performance.

To Apply

Please send your resume, cover letter, and speaking test link to our hiring team.

Applications missing any required information will not be reviewed.

title: Virtual Assistant - Food & Bev Industry
description:
Role Summary



We’re looking for a reliable Administrative Virtual Assistant to handle invoicing, accounts receivable tracking, reconciliation prep, tax-summary prep, and organized documentation.



This is a strictly administrative role. No marketing, no strategy, no decision-making. The goal is to keep financial records clean, admin work off the founder’s plate, and partner materials easy to find and share.



Key Responsibilities

1. Weekly Invoicing & Accounts Receivable



Create and send weekly invoices



Update invoice and customer records



Track payments and reconcile AR by account



Prepare a simple AR summary (paid / outstanding / overdue)



Flag issues or discrepancies



2. Quarterly Accounting & HST Prep (Prep Only)



Match invoices to bank transactions



Pull together sales, expenses, and tax data



Create a clear HST summary table for the accountant

(You prepare; accountant files)



3. Content & Document Organization



Keep business documents organized and up to date



Create share-ready folders for:



Distributor and retailer forms



Promotions and demo materials



Product specs, UPCs, nutritionals, images



Make sure files are easy to find and quick to share



4. SOPs & Documentation



Write simple SOPs for admin tasks (invoicing, AR, reconciliation, content organization)



Keep SOPs updated for future reference and onboarding



5. Admin Updates



Short weekly status update



Prepare quarterly hand-off package for accountant



Tools You’ll Use



Xero, Square (invoicing & payments)



Google Suite (Sheets, Docs, Drive, Gmail)



WhatsApp (communication)



Canva (organizing approved assets only)



ChatGPT (summaries, SOP formatting, documentation help)



Time Commitment



8 hours per week



One 1-hour live work session per week (Google Meet)



Remaining hours completed independently



Out of Scope (Important)



Marketing or content creation



Social media or newsletters



Pricing or sales decisions



Customer negotiations or collections



Tax filing or legal decisions



Ideal Fit



Very organized and detail-oriented



Comfortable with numbers and spreadsheets



Follows instructions and boundaries



Communicates clearly and flags issues early

title: Healthcare Recruiter
description:
Job description:



We are a growing U.S.-based healthcare company seeking a Recruiter / Interview Specialist to support therapist hiring across multiple departments.



This role is call-heavy and interview-focused, with additional responsibility for coordinating hiring needs and tracking recruitment progress. Approximately 90% of your work will involve phone interviews with therapist candidates.



If you are not comfortable being on calls for most of your shift, this role is not a good fit.



Role Overview



• You will conduct daily phone interviews with licensed therapists (PT, OT, ST, PTA, COTA), coordinate with internal teams on hiring needs, and manage the recruitment pipeline from job posting through candidate handoff.

 • You are the first point of contact for candidates and a key link between departments, so professionalism, organization, and communication are essential.



Key Responsibilities



• Interviewing & Screening (Primary Focus)

• Conduct high-volume phone interviews daily with therapist candidates.

• Screen candidates for: Licensure and credentials, Experience and specialties, Availability and geographic coverage, 



Communication skills and professionalism

• Clearly explain roles, expectations, and next steps.

• Identify red flags and escalate concerns when necessary.

• Recruitment Coordination & Follow-Ups

• Follow up with candidates after interviews as needed.

• Coordinate with internal departments (staffing, operations, leadership) to understand current and upcoming hiring needs.

• Schedule next steps and hand off qualified candidates appropriately.

• Maintain timely and professional communication with candidates throughout the process.

• Job Posting & Process Tracking

• Post job openings on approved platforms as hiring needs change.

• Track candidates through each stage of the recruitment process.

• Keep recruitment trackers or ATS accurate and up to date.

• Provide basic updates on hiring progress when requested.



What We’re Looking For



• Comfortable being on the phone most of the workday.

• Clear, confident, professional speaking voice.

• Strong listening and judgment skills.

• Highly organized and detail-oriented.

• Able to manage follow-ups and coordination without losing 
ntum.



Qualifications



• 1–2+ years of experience in: Recruiting, Healthcare staffing, HR screening, Call center interviewing

• Excellent spoken and written English.

• Comfortable conducting multiple interviews per day.

• Familiar with Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs).

• Bonus: Experience recruiting healthcare professionals or independent contractors.



Requirements



• Reliable internet connection.

• Quiet, professional work environment for calls.

• Ability to work U.S. (PST) business hours.

• Part-time or full-time availability (to be discussed).



Job Type: Part-time



Benefits:



• Paid training

• Work from home



Experience:



• Recruiting: 2 years (Required)

• Healthcare Staffing: 1 year (Required)

• Work Location: Remote

title: Arabic Customer Service Agent
description:
JOB OVERVIEW

s using a provided script

Requirements

Experience in the creator economy / social media / UGC is a plus, but not required.

title: Web Developer Needed to Build a Mission-Driven Website for inara (Fintech / Community Platform)
description:
inara is a community savings platform that helps people access meaningful capital without relying on loans, interest, or predatory lenders. We’re building infrastructure around contribution-based savings systems that already exist in communities worldwide and bringing structure, transparency, and safeguards to them.



This is not a generic fintech project. This is mission-driven work focused on financial resilience, trust, and long-term impact.



What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for a skilled web developer who can build a clean, modern, trustworthy website that reflects inara’s values and credibility. This site will be used by community partners, institutions, philanthropies, and early users, so clarity, polish, and restraint matter more than flash.



You should be comfortable working from written concepts and collaborating closely to translate vision into a strong digital presence.



Scope of Work

• Design and build a responsive, modern marketing website

• Pages likely include: Home, How It Works, Why inara, Pilots & Partnerships, About, Contact

• Clean, accessible UI with a strong emphasis on trust and clarity

• Mobile-first and performance-conscious

• SEO-friendly structure

• Deployed and ready for real-world use



Tech Stack (Flexible)

We’re open to recommendations. You might use Webflow, Next.js, React, or another modern stack as long as the result is fast, secure, and maintainable. Please explain your choice.



Ideal Candidate

• Strong portfolio of real, live websites (not just templates)

• Experience building marketing or product websites for startups, fintech, or mission-driven orgs

• Good design judgment and attention to detail

• Clear communicator who asks thoughtful questions

• Comfortable taking ownership of a project end-to-end

• Values long-term collaboration over quick one-offs



Nice to Have

• Experience with fintech, SaaS, or regulated industries

• Familiarity with accessibility best practices

• Ability to suggest improvements rather than just execute instructions



Compensation

Paid, project-based. Please include your proposed rate or range and how you typically scope projects like this. There is potential for ongoing work as inara grows.



How to Apply

Please include:

• A short intro about you

• Links to 2–3 relevant websites you’ve built

• Your recommended tech stack for this project (and why)

• Your estimated timeline

• Your rate or project estimate



We care deeply about how inara shows up in the world. If you take pride in building thoughtful, well-crafted work and want to contribute to something meaningful, we’d love to hear from you.



We are open to increasing the budget for exceptional candidates who demonstrate strong portfolio quality and fast turnaround.

title: AFFILIATE MANAGER
description:
AFFILIATE MANAGER



NordStick



NordStick is a leading fitness brand founded in 2020 by a prominent physical therapist, dedicated to innovative home based workout solutions that help people overcome pain, prevent injuries, and achieve peak performance. Our flagship products, like the NordStick and NordBench Pro, are affordable, high quality, and multifunctional, empowering over 250,000 customers to build strength and improve mobility without a gym. As part of a fast growing DTC fitness ecosystem, we're committed to making health and wellness accessible. This is not a lifestyle brand. It is a long term company with high expectations around execution, ownership, and reliability.



The Role



We are hiring an Affiliate Manager to own and scale NordStick’s creator and affiliate partnerships.

This is not a passive “send a few
s and hope someone posts” role. You are responsible for building a real revenue channel through creators and partners.



You will identify the right people, reach out, close partnerships, manage deliverables, track performance, and make sure affiliates actually drive results.



If you need constant direction, this role will feel overwhelming. If you naturally spot opportunities, follow through, and treat outcomes like they’re your own business, you will thrive.



You will operate across marketing, ecommerce, and operations, working directly with the Founder and internal team to turn partnerships into consistent growth.



Core Responsibilities



1. Affiliate Strategy and Outreach

--> Lead creator research and qualification across Instagram,
, and YouTube, focusing on U.S. based influencers and affiliates who align with the brand

 --> Manage outbound and inbound creator outreach and prospecting

 --> Build and maintain a consistent pipeline of high quality partners

 --> Draft and manage partnership agreements and contracts



2. Partner Onboarding and Execution

--> Own partner onboarding including whitelisting setup, expectations alignment, and launch timelines

 --> Coordinate product seeding and create orders for affiliates

 --> Track and manage creator deliverables throughout each phase of the campaign

 --> Act as the primary point of contact for partners across the full lifecycle



3. Operations and Performance Management

--> Maintain and manage partnership workflows and tasks in Asana

 --> Generate and analyze performance reports for affiliate campaigns

 --> Track affiliate payouts and ensure timely and accurate compensation

 --> Identify what is working, what is not, and proactively optimize for better results



What Success Looks Like



Within 30 Days

--> Active pipeline of qualified creators and affiliates

 --> Outreach and onboarding systems clearly organized and repeatable

 --> First partnerships launched without hand holding



Within 90 Days

--> Affiliate channel driving consistent and measurable revenue

 --> Partners managed proactively with clear expectations and accountability

 --> Reporting is reliable, data driven, and used to guide decisions

 --> Founder is not chasing follow ups, payments, or missed deliverables



Requirements



You should not apply unless most of the following are true:

--> You have managed affiliate, influencer, or creator partnerships for ecommerce or DTC brands

 --> You are highly organized and comfortable juggling multiple relationships and timelines

 --> You are proactive and take ownership without waiting for instructions

 --> You communicate clearly and directly with partners and internal teams

 --> You are comfortable negotiating agreements and setting expectations

 --> You can analyze performance data and translate it into actions

 --> You have experience with tools like Asana, Shopify, Google Sheets, and affiliate or tracking platforms

 --> You understand how creators, paid media, and ecommerce work together to drive sales

 --> You can commit full time, working 40 hours per week



How to Apply



Send a message with:

--> Your resume

 --> A brief overview of why you are a strong fit for this role

 --> Any relevant experience managing affiliates, influencers, or creator campaigns

title: Executive Assistant (Transaction Coordinator) - Real Estate
description:
The Swick Real Estate Group & Downsize Allies | Centerville, OH



Our fast-growing real estate team is seeking a dependable and self-motivated Transaction Coordinator / Executive Assistant to support our CEO, agents and clients through the downsizing and transaction process. This virtual role is essential in providing organized, compassionate, and professional support to homeowners and families during an important life transition. This position works directly with the President and has the ability to organize and complete efficiently and effectively a variety of recurring and new assignments.  Someone that is solution oriented to complete projects.



We are a highly productive team working full 8-hour days in a fast-paced environment. This role requires strong focus, ownership, and attention to detail, with the goal of fully managing transaction and administrative responsibilities so the team can perform at a high level.



Key Responsibilities

? Manage daily calendars, meetings, and
 correspondence

? Oversee scheduling and customer service for Airbnb, Furnished Finders, and rental properties

? Coordinate with vendors and manage business-related purchases

? Perform daily reconciliation for property redevelopment projects

? Manage transaction timelines, deadlines, and related tasks efficiently

? Communicate clearly and professionally with clients, agents, vendors, and stakeholders

? Prepare, review, and submit transaction documents accurately and on time

? Coordinate inspections, repairs, and closing-related appointments

? Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records in the CRM/database

? Ensure file compliance, accuracy, and quality control

? Conduct daily check-ins on active listings, contracts, and assigned projects



Qualifications

? Real estate transaction or administrative experience preferred

? Strong organizational, communication, and time-management skills

? Detail-oriented, proactive, and solution-focused

? Project management knowledge (a plus)

? Construction background and familiarity with AI tools (Claude, HeyGen, Gamini, Nano, ChatGPT) (a plus)

? Coachable, dependable, and interested in long-term growth

? High proficiency in U.S. English



About Us:

With over 30 years of real estate experience, The Swick Real Estate Group & Downsize Allies provides an all-inclusive downsizing and estate transition service. Our mission is to remove stress and simplify the process through personalized, insight-driven solutions—while working hard, working smart, and enjoying what we do.



Compensation & Schedule:

$6.00–$10.00 per hour (USD)

Open to part-time or full-time, depending on fit.



How to Apply:

Send a 2–3 minute video sharing your skills, why this role matters to you, and your interest in a long-term career to:

title: Financial Operations Specialist (Remote)
description:
Remote Financial Operations Specialist (Full-Time VA – Philippines)

Own the Financial Engine at Property Rush



Be the Guardian of Our Numbers, Cash Flow, and Clarity

Are you an elite-level bookkeeper with CFO-level instincts? Do you thrive in building financial systems, forecasting cash flow, and producing clean, accurate books every single month? Are you the kind of person who finds errors before anyone else even sees the numbers?



If spreadsheets, reconciliations, and financial clarity are your love language — we want you.

We’re hiring a Full-Time Financial Operations Specialist (Remote) who will oversee the entire financial heartbeat of Property Rush. You’ll manage the books, own month-end close, produce financial statements, keep cash flow predictable, protect margins, and give leadership the clean data needed to make informed decisions.



This is a role for someone who is reliable, disciplined, detail-obsessed, and hungry for growth inside a fast-paced real estate company. This is not data-entry bookkeeping. This is high-ownership financial leadership!



__________________________________________________



???? Why You’ll Love This Role

Own the Financial Engine

You’ll run our entire financial workflow — from reconciliations to reporting to forecasting.



Be a Strategic Partner

You’ll work directly with the CEO and senior leadership team to ensure our numbers tell the truth and support growth.



Build the Systems That Scale Us

You’ll refine bookkeeping processes, automate workflows, and implement smarter financial controls.



Make a True Impact

When our numbers are tight, our business grows — and you’ll be at the center of that growth.



__________________________________________________



???? What You’ll Do

20% – BIG ROCKS (Critical Financial Responsibilities)

These are the highest-level, do-first, mission-critical responsibilities:

? Month-End Close (Complete Within 10 Days)

- Reconcile all accounts (cash, credit cards, loans, AR/AP, escrow, deposits).

- Generate accurate monthly financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow).

- Deliver clean, final books to leadership every month.



? Cash Flow Forecasting (12-Month Rolling)

- Maintain a real-time cash flow forecasting spreadsheet.

- Track all upcoming obligations and expected income.

- Keep forecast accuracy within 5% variance month over month.

- Plot all contractor invoices, recurring expenses, and property obligations before payment approval.



? Budgeting & Reporting

- Help build and maintain annual budget.

- Produce monthly variance reports (budget vs actual).

- Flag overspending, slow payers, or margin compression before it becomes a problem.



? Compliance & Tax Prep Support

- Maintain clean books for CPA review.

- Track 1099 vendors, reconcile receipts, and prepare files for tax season.

- Ensure real estate–specific compliance (security deposits, escrow tracking, PM fees, rehab costs).



? Process Improvement

- Build scalable bookkeeping systems.

- Automate workflows inside QuickBooks / Xero / Google Sheets.

- Improve accuracy and reduce manual entries.



__________________________________________________



80% – DAILY & WEEKLY FINANCIAL OPERATIONS

These are recurring tasks that keep our financial engine running:



?Accounts Payable

- Process vendor invoices.

- Verify job-cost accuracy for property rehabs.

- Ensure 100% on-time payments.



?Accounts Receivable

- Track incoming rents, investor payments, loan payments, and revenue.

- Follow up on late payments with professionalism.



?Payroll & Contractor Payments

- Prepare payroll reports for U.S. processor.

- Track hours, reimbursements, and recurring contractor fees.



?Property-Level Bookkeeping

- Track rehab budgets, cost overruns, and job costing by line item.

- Reconcile utility bills, rent rolls, deposits, escrows.



?Financial Organization

- Maintain organized digital filing for statements, invoices, and documents.

- Keep leadership’s financial dashboard updated weekly.



?Weekly/Monthly Reporting

- Weekly cash position update.

- Weekly AR/AP status.

- Weekly/Monthly KPI dashboard.



__________________________________________________



???? KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)

These metrics define success in this role:

???? Month-End Close Completed by Day 10

100% on-time delivery every month.



???? Financial Accuracy – Zero Material Errors

Books must tie out to the penny — consistently.



???? Cash Flow Forecast Accuracy

Maintain ? 5% variance between forecasted vs. actual cash flow.



???? 100% On-Time Vendor Payments

No late payments without prior approval



???? Clean Books for CPA Review

No major findings or issues during annual tax prep or audits.



???? Cost Savings Identified & Executed

Help us lower expenses and improve margins every single quarter.



__________________________________________________



? You’re a Fit If You…

- Are detail-obsessed and take pride in accuracy.

- Love creating order, clarity, and clean numbers.

- Work fast, independently, and don’t need daily supervision.

- Think like a controller, not a clerk — you see the big picture.

- Can manage multiple entities (LLCs, flips, rentals, PM).

- Understand real estate bookkeeping (ideal, but not required if you learn fast).

- Are hungry, humble, proactive, and solution-oriented.

- Want long-term, stable, full-time work.



__________________________________________________



???? Skills & Requirements

- 3+ years bookkeeping/accounting experience (real estate preferred).

- Strong QuickBooks Online or Xero experience.

- Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills (pivot tables, formulas, formatting).

- Experience with AP/AR, reconciliations, and financial reporting.

- Fluent English (written and verbal).

- Reliable computer + internet.

- Ability to work U.S. hours (EST preferred).

- Experience with multi-entity bookkeeping is a major plus.



__________________________________________________



???? Perks & Benefits

- Full-time, long-term remote role.

- Work directly with the CEO.

- Growth path toward Finance Manager / Controller.

- Paid time off + paid PH holidays.

- Access to training & development resources.

- Stable, meaningful role inside a mission-driven U.S. real estate company.



__________________________________________________



???? Why Join Property Rush?

We’re a fast-growing real estate investment and property management company focused on stewardship, integrity, and growth (S.I.G.). Our mission is to provide affordable, quality housing while building a thriving business and strong investment community.

If you want to join a team that values accuracy, excellence, and continuous improvement — you’ll feel at home here.



__________________________________________________



???? Ready to Lead Our Financial Systems?

If you’re a meticulous bookkeeper who can think strategically and deliver clean books every month, we’d love to meet you.

???? Apply now and help us scale with confidence.



__________________________________________________



As part of our pre-screening process, we kindly ask you to complete both the Culture Index and Personality Assessment provided below. Completing these assessments is required for us to move your application to the next stage. Only applicants who completed the assessments will be processed.



1. Culture Index Assessment

(Copy and paste this link into a new browser tab)





2. Personality Assessment

(Copy and paste this link into a new browser tab)

title: Wordpress SEO & Content Strategist
description:
About Scaliency:



Scaliency is a Phoenix, Arizona-based growth marketing agency that builds complete growth systems for service-based businesses -- websites, paid ads (Google & Meta), SEO, content, CRM automation, and AI-powered lead management. Our clients include home service companies, auto repair shops, contractors, and other service businesses across the US. We are quickly growing and are building our core team to support that growth.





Job Description:



You will be Scaliency's dedicated SEO Specialist -- the person responsible for making our clients findable online. You'll handle the full SEO cycle for each client: keyword research, content creation and publishing, on-page optimization, link building, citation management, and Google Business Profile management. Your work compounds over time and becomes the organic engine that drives long-term client growth alongside our paid advertising efforts.





Responsibilities:



- Conduct keyword research, competitor analysis, and build monthly content plans for each client using our premium SEO platform (Search Atlas -- training available).



- Create SEO-optimized content using Search Atlas and our AI tools (Gemini, Claude, ChatGPT), then edit every piece for human quality, accuracy, and brand voice.



- Publish content directly in WordPress using pre-built page templates.



- Apply on-page SEO in WordPress via RankMath -- meta tags, heading structure, internal linking, schema, alt text, clean URLs.



- Execute white-hat link building -- backlink outreach, editorial submissions, and guest post outreach using Search Atlas tools.



- Build and manage business citations across key directories (Google, Yelp, BBB, Bing Places, Apple Maps, and industry-specific).



- Optimize and manage Google Business Profiles -- descriptions, categories, photos, weekly posts, Q&A, review response drafts.



- Run monthly technical SEO audits and monitor Google Search Console for all client sites.



- Track keyword rankings weekly, monitor organic traffic, and report on SEO performance monthly.



- Coordinate with our Web Developer for site-level SEO needs and custom page builds.





Requirements: 



- 3+ years SEO experience (Technical, On-Page & Off-Page SEO).



- Experience with professional SEO platforms (Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz, or similar).



- Keyword research and content strategy.



- On-page SEO implementation in WordPress (RankMath or Yoast, heading structure, meta optimization, internal linking).



- Off-page SEO execution -- link building, outreach, and citation building with real results.



- Google Business Profile optimization and management experience.



- Google Search Console proficiency.



- Content editing skills -- can read AI-generated content, spot quality issues, and edit for natural readability.



- WordPress Expertise.



- Excellent written & spoken English.





Nice to have: Local SEO specialization, schema markup (JSON-LD) knowledge, HARO/digital PR experience, experience with service-based businesses, US local market understanding, technical SEO audit experience.





Tools You'll Use (All Provided):



- Search Atlas



- RankMathSEO Pro



- Google Search Console, Google Analytics 4, Google Business Profile



-Scaliency AI Content Tools Premium Subscriptions (Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT)



-WordPress



-Swydo (SEO Reporting)





What Working With Us Looks Like:



- Fully remote -- work from anywhere.



- Full-time, Monday-Friday, 40 hours/week.



- Minimum 4 hours overlap with 9am-5pm MST (Arizona time).



- Communication via Slack, Clickup and/or 
 / Whatsapp.



- Weekly video check-ins + ad-hoc video / audio calls as needed.



- Long-term position -- we invest in training and want you to grow with us.

title: Replo Landing Page & Conversion Specialist (Part-Time)
description:
Job Title: Replo Landing Page & Conversion Specialist (Part-Time)

Salary: $1,000 AUD / month

Type: Part-Time (AI-Native)

Website: 

The Mission

Your goal is to increase our store's conversion rate and AOV through high-velocity landing page testing. You will use Replo to build beautiful, fast-loading, and high-converting funnels. You aren't just a designer; you are a direct-response architect who understands the psychology of why women buy beauty products.

Your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Conversion Rate (CR): Improve the landing page CR for our "3-Pack Box" offer.

Average Order Value (AOV): Implement backend Shopify integrations and upsell modules to increase the dollar value of every click.

Build Velocity: Ability to turn a creative concept into a live Replo page in under 24 hours.

Mobile Optimization: Ensure 100% of pages are "Mobile-First" with sub-2-second load times.

Core Responsibilities

Funnel Architecture: Build high-converting Listicles (e.g., "5 Reasons Women are Swapping Night Creams for Mouth Tape"), Advertorials, and Long-form Sales Pages.

Replo Mastery: Fully manage the Replo environment, including global components, mobile styling, and dynamic Shopify integrations.

Backend Integration: Connect pages seamlessly to the Shopify checkout, ensuring all tracking (Pixels/GTM) and "Gifts with Purchase" are functioning perfectly.

AI-Speed: Use AI tools (like ChatGPT or Midjourney) to generate high-converting copy and custom imagery at 10x speed.

Swipe File Execution: Leverage your existing library of 7-8 figure e-commerce funnels to model winning structures for Beauty Sleep Club.

Who You Are

Direct Response Native: You understand the "Problem-Agitation-Solution" framework.

Replo Power-User: You know the platform inside and out and don't need a developer to help you.

Fast & Iterative: You thrive on feedback from the Media Buyer and move quickly to test new "Hooks" on the page.

title: Level 2 - IT Support Technician
description:
Working Schedule: Monday - Friday, Eastern Standard Time



Note: Although this position is classified as a Level 2 Technician, you will initially perform Level 1 tasks. This is to ensure you are fully acclimated to our tools, systems, and processes before transitioning to full Level 2 responsibilities.



About the Role

We’re looking for a remote Level 2 IT Support Technician who loves technology, takes initiative, and communicates clearly. You’ll provide day-to-day desktop and Microsoft 365 support to end users across multiple clients, working closely with engineers and the Service Desk Coordinator. This role requires someone with strong Level 2 experience, especially in creating structured SOPs and adapting quickly to new technologies.



Key Responsibilities

• Provide remote desktop, laptop, and mobile support via our ticketing and remote-access tools.

• Troubleshoot hardware, software, and network issues (Windows 10/11, macOS, VPN, DNS/DHCP).

• Administer Microsoft 365 and Azure AD (add/remove users, mailboxes, Teams, OneDrive).

• Manage Intune device enrollment and compliance policies.

• Document troubleshooting steps, SOPs, and resolutions clearly in SuperOps.

• Escalate complex issues to Tier 2/Tier 3 as needed while ensuring timely client updates.

• Maintain proactive monitoring, patching, and backup checks.

• Learn and adopt new technologies and tools as part of continuous improvement.

• Collaborate virtually with the NYC Service Desk team during Eastern Time business hours.



Required Experience & Skills

• 3+ years of IT support experience in a professional or corporate environment (financial sector a plus).

• Prior MSP experience is required — must have supported multi-client environments.

• Proven Level 2 technical experience, including troubleshooting advanced issues and creating operational SOPs.

• 2+ years of Microsoft 365 / Azure AD administration (MS-900 or equivalent preferred).

• Strong understanding of Windows OS, networking fundamentals, and security best practices.

• Ability to quickly learn new technologies, platforms, and tools.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills — able to explain technical concepts to non-technical users.

• Highly organized, proactive, and comfortable working independently.

title: AI Video Pipeline Developer (ComfyUI, Python, RunPod) — Full-Time or Project-Based
description:
We're a U.S.-based AI video production company looking for a skilled developer to build an automated video production pipeline. This is a real project with clear scope and a path to long-term ongoing work.

The Project:

We produce AI-generated marketing videos for real estate agents. Currently this involves manual editing and multiple AI platform subscriptions. We want to automate the pipeline so that a script + reference photos go in, and a near-finished video comes out — with human review at key checkpoints.

Three phases:



Script-to-storyboard engine with API-based image and video generation (~$2,000 / ?115,000)

Self-hosted generation on RunPod + ComfyUI — batch processing, avatar training, lip sync (~$5,000-$7,000 / ?285,000-?400,000)

Automated video assembly, templates, Premiere Pro integration (~$5,000-$8,000 / ?285,000-?460,000)



We have: Structured training data (342 video cuts in JSON), a partially built Next.js app, existing API integrations, clear technical specifications for each phase.

Skills Required:



Strong Python (async programming, API integration, queue systems)

ComfyUI experience (building workflows, using the API, custom nodes)

RunPod or GPU cloud deployment (Docker, persistent storage, model management)

FLUX / Stable Diffusion (ControlNet, IP-Adapter, LoRA training, AnimateDiff)

FFmpeg or MoviePy for programmatic video editing

Next.js / TypeScript (for extending the UI)



Big Plus:



Lip sync models (MuseTalk, SadTalker, Wav2Lip)

AI coding tools in your workflow (Claude Code, Cursor, Copilot)

Understanding of video production (editing concepts, timelines, transitions)



What we're looking for in a person:



Self-directed problem solver — we give you the spec, you figure out the implementation

Strong communicator — async updates, clear documentation, honest about blockers

Uses AI to work faster — we're an AI company, we expect our developer to leverage AI tools

Portfolio required — show us ComfyUI workflows, ML pipelines, or automation projects you've built



Compensation:



Phase 1: ?115,000 ($2,000 USD) fixed project

Full scope: ?690,000-?975,000 ($12,000-$17,000 USD) across all phases

If transitioning to ongoing: ?60,000-?120,000/month ($1,000-$2,000/month) depending on hours and skill level

Open to full-time or project-based — discuss in interview

title: Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)
description:
Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)



This is not customer service.

This is not inbound order-taking.



This is a phone-driven, outbound enrollment closer role for professionals who know how to control a consult, qualify fast, overcome objections, and close.



We are a U.S.-based online career school enrolling students into IT and Project Management certification programs (CompTIA, PMP, and related tracks). We provide warm leads. You bring the discipline, urgency, and closing skill.



What You’ll Be Doing (Daily Reality)



Make high-volume outbound calls to prospective students



Run structured, consultative enrollment calls (needs analysis ? recommendation ? close)



Control the call, set next steps, and ask for the enrollment



Handle objections around price, time, confidence, and urgency



Follow up relentlessly until the prospect converts or disqualifies



Log activity and outcomes accurately in CRM



Hit daily activity targets and monthly enrollment goals



Improve close rates through coaching, scripts, and call reviews



If you don’t like calling, this role will break you.



Who This Role Is For



Proven outbound / inside sales closers



Comfortable dialing daily and living on the phone



Strong command of English with clear U.S. cultural fluency



Confident asking direct questions and pushing for decisions



Competitive, coachable, metrics-driven



Organized and accountable without supervision



Experience selling education, training, coaching, or professional services is a major plus



Familiarity with certifications (CompTIA, PMP) helps—but closing ability matters more



Bachelor’s degree required



Who Should NOT Apply



Anyone who needs inbound-only leads



Anyone uncomfortable asking for money



Anyone who avoids objection handling



Anyone who wants a “soft” admissions role



Anyone who disappears when targets tighten



Schedule



Monday–Friday



10:00 AM – 6:30 PM EST



Compensation



Base pay: $1,200–$1,600 USD per month



Performance-based advancement and leadership path



Long-term role with stability and growth for performers



(Top performers move fast. Average performers don’t last.)



What You Get



Warm leads with real intent



Clear scripts, frameworks, and coaching



No gimmicks, no fake promises—just real programs that work



A sales culture that rewards results



Bottom Line



If you can:



Control a sales conversation



Build urgency without lying



Close consistently



Take coaching and improve



You will win here.



If not—this role will expose you quickly.
