title: Senior Executive Assistant
description:
**Apply here:** 



**Please note:** We only acknowledge applications submitted via this form.



---



Are you an organized, proactive, and detail-oriented professional who thrives in a fast-paced remote environment? If you have experience supporting executives, managing calendars, coordinating meetings, and handling confidential communications—this is your opportunity to join our growing team!



**Reasons to Join Our Team:**



We're committed to your development, stability, and well-being. Here's what you'll gain by being part of our team:



- 13th Month Pay every December

- Paid Philippine Holidays

- Paid Vacation and Sick Leaves

- HMO Coverage after passing the probationary period

- Long-Term Career Growth Opportunities – minimum 2?year commitment with salary increases based on performance

- Opportunities for Skill Development and Training



---



**About the Role:**



We are seeking a highly organized and dependable **Executive Assistant** to provide remote administrative support to senior management. The ideal candidate will manage complex calendars, handle sensitive communications with discretion, coordinate meetings and travel, and ensure day-to-day operations run smoothly. This role requires exceptional attention to detail, strong communication skills, and the ability to anticipate needs before they arise.



---



**Key Responsibilities**



**Calendar & Schedule Management:**

- Manage and optimize executive calendars across multiple time zones

- Schedule meetings, appointments, and calls with internal and external stakeholders

- Proactively resolve scheduling conflicts and prioritize time-sensitive requests

- Send meeting reminders and prepare executives for upcoming commitments



**Communication & Correspondence:**

- Manage
 inboxes, draft responses, and flag priority items

- Serve as the first point of contact for internal and external communications

- Handle confidential information with the utmost discretion and professionalism

- Prepare professional correspondence, memos, and reports



**Meeting Coordination:**

- Prepare meeting agendas, presentations, and briefing materials

- Take detailed meeting notes and distribute action items

- Follow up on deliverables and ensure timely completion of tasks



**Travel & Logistics:**

- Coordinate domestic and international travel arrangements (flights, hotels, transportation)

- Prepare detailed itineraries and manage last-minute changes

- Process expense reports and reimbursements



**Administrative Support:**

- Maintain organized digital filing systems and documentation

- Assist with special projects and research as needed

- Coordinate with other tea
mbers to ensure seamless operations



---



**Required Qualifications**

- Minimum 2 years of experience as an Executive Assistant, Personal Assistant, or Senior Administrative Assistant

- Proficiency in Google Workspace (Calendar, Docs, Sheets, Gmail) OR Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Word, Excel)

- Excellent written and verbal English communication skills (C1+ level)

- Experience managing executive calendars and coordinating travel arrangements

- Ability to handle confidential information with discretion

- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

- Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities simultaneously

- Reliable internet connection and professional home office setup



**Preferred Qualifications (Bonus):**

- Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related field

- Experience supporting C-level executives

- Experience with CRM systems (HubSpot, Salesforce, Go High Level)

- Familiarity with project management tools (Asana, 
, Trello, ClickUp)

- Experience with scheduling tools (Calendly, Doodle)



---



**Work Schedule:**

This role requires availability aligned with **8AM–5PM Eastern Standard Time (EST)**. Candidates must be comfortable working evening/night shifts in Philippine time.



---



**Important Note:**



To maintain a productive and transparent environment, we use a time tracking tool that includes screenshot monitoring during work hours. This helps ensure accountability and supports our commitment to high-quality, remote collaboration.



---



**Apply now and take the first step toward building a long-term career with us!**

title: Construction Estimator
description:
**Apply here:** 



**Please note:** We only acknowledge applications submitted via this form.



---



Are you a detail-oriented, analytical professional with experience in construction cost estimation and digital takeoff software? If you have a background in quantity surveying, construction estimating, or project costing—this is your opportunity to join our growing team!



**Reasons to Join Our Team:**



We're committed to your development, stability, and well-being. Here's what you'll gain by being part of our team:



- 13th Month Pay every December

- Paid Philippine Holidays

- Paid Vacation and Sick Leaves

- HMO Coverage after passing the probationary period

- Long-Term Career Growth Opportunities – minimum 2?year commitment with salary increases based on performance

- Opportunities for Skill Development and Training



---



**About the Role:**



We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented **Construction Estimator** with strong proficiency in digital takeoff software to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for preparing accurate and timely cost estimates for a wide range of residential and/or commercial construction projects. This role requires a deep understanding of construction drawings, materials, labor costs, and subcontractor pricing, as well as the ability to work collaboratively with project managers, engineers, and architects.



---



**Key Responsibilities**



**Estimate Development:**

- Analyze architectural plans, specifications, and other project documentation to prepare detailed cost estimates

- Use digital takeoff software (PlanSwift, Bluebeam, STACK, On-Screen Takeoff, or similar) to perform quantity surveys

- Develop budgets for materials, labor, equipment, and subcontractor services

- Review and compare subcontractor and supplier quotes for accuracy and completeness



**Collaboration & Communication:**

- Work with project managers, engineers, and design teams to clarify scope and resolve discrepancies

- Coordinate pre-bid meetings and site visits when necessary

- Provide value engineering options and cost-saving alternatives where applicable



**Proposal Preparation:**

- Compile and present final bid proposals with itemized cost breakdowns

- Support the sales or business development team with pricing information and clarifications

- Maintain documentation for bid decisions, assumptions, and scope inclusions/exclusions



**Post-Bid & Project Handoff:**

- Participate in project handoffs to the operations team

- Assist with change orders and project cost adjustments as needed



---



**Required Qualifications**

- Minimum 2 years of proven experience as a Construction Estimator, Quantity Surveyor, or Cost Estimator

- Proficiency with at least ONE digital takeoff software: PlanSwift, Bluebeam Revu, STACK, On-Screen Takeoff (OST), Procore, or ConEst

- Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and sequencing

- Ability to read and interpret blueprints, specifications, and technical documents

- Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, data analysis)

- High attention to detail, organizational skills, and analytical thinking

- Strong communication and interpersonal skills



**Preferred Qualifications (Bonus):**



- Experience with US residential or commercial construction projects

- Trade-specific estimating experience (electrical, plumbing, HVAC, concrete)

- Familiarity with RSMeans or Craftsman Book pricing data

- Understanding of US building codes (IRC, IBC)

- Value engineering experience



---



**Important Note:**



To maintain a productive and transparent environment, we use a time tracking tool that includes screenshot monitoring during work hours. This helps ensure accountability and supports our commitment to high-quality, remote collaboration.



---



**Apply now and take the first step toward building a long-term career with us!**

title: Senior Linux/Network Engineer
description:
We are hiring an experienced contractor to architect, build, and operate a high-scale proxy server testbed on Ubuntu 24 using Squid 7.4. This environment will function as a three-month pilot to validate performance, reliability, and operational requirements prior to scaling into a SaaS offering.



The contractor will be responsible for both the technical implementation and the networking strategy, including the ability to recommend and size a sufficiently large public IP pool and implement routing/egress strategies to support up to ~10,000 proxies (e.g., IP:port endpoints and/or high concurrency proxy identities depending on design).



Note: Detailed project requirements, target traffic profiles, and platform constraints will be shared after a successful initial interview.

title: Senior Bookkeeper *Superstar Only*
description:
We are looking for two experienced bookkeepers to join our finance team and take ownership of expense categorization, transaction reconciliation, accounts payable, and invoice processing across multiple legal entities.



The bookkeepers will work closely with the CFO, ensuring that all financial transactions are accurately recorded, categorized, and reconciled on a regular basis. This role is ideal for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable managing financial data across multiple platforms — including Xero, Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and our custom CRM.



Key Responsibilities

- Categorize all expenses and transactions in Xero, ensuring accurate classification for reporting and compliance

- Reconcile transactions across multiple payment platforms, including Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRM tools

- Manage accounts payable, ensuring all invoices are properly reviewed, recorded, and scheduled for payment

- Assist with invoice processing, ensuring all vendor invoices are accurately documented and match purchase orders where applicable

- Work closely with the CFO to provide up-to-date financial records for monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting

- Ensure all financial data is accurate and properly organized to support compliance across multiple jurisdictions

- Flag discrepancies or unusual transactions for review by the CFO



What We’re Looking For

- At least 5 years of experience in bookkeeping and expense reconciliation

- Strong proficiency in Xero

- Experience working with Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRMs

- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

- Experience handling multi-entity, multi-currency financial data preferred

- Comfortable working in a remote-first environment

- Fluent in English, both written and spoken



Requirements for Effective Remote Work

- Reliable computer or laptop capable of photo and video editing

- Stable high-speed internet connection

- Conducive work environment



Working Schedule

- Full-time opportunity

- Remote work setup (Philippines-based applicants only)



Benefits

- Competitive pay

- Training and growth opportunities

- Opportunity to work with a fast-growing content-driven company



Salary range

- Php 50, 000 - Php 70,000 (based on experience)



Application Instructions

Please go to the link below, review the questions carefully, and share the required information.






If you believe you meet our qualifications and requirements, we encourage you to apply now and become a valuable part of our rapidly expanding company.

About the position:

We are looking for a detail-oriented and customer-focused Technical Support Specialist to provide high-quality support to users across multiple communication channels. This role involves responding to inquiries, troubleshooting technical issues, and delivering clear, helpful, and accurate solutions.



The ideal candidate is personable, adaptable, and resourceful, with strong research and problem-solving skills. You should be comfortable understanding user needs and tailoring support based on context rather than relying on scripted responses.

• Create, update, and monitor support tickets using internal systems

• Take time to understand user needs to provide helpful and relevant support

• Document issues and solutions clearly for future reference

• Help improve internal guides and knowledge resources over time



Requirements:



• Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and familiarity with other programming languages 

• Excellent English communication skills (written, verbal, and reading)

• Strong attention to detail and problem-solving ability

• Customer-first mindset with strong empathy and professionalism

• Ability to work independently and collaborate with a team

• Comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment

• Familiarity with website platforms or online store tools

• Understanding of performance optimization or testing concepts



Nice to Have:

• Experience in technical or customer support roles

Work Schedule:

TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION, FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW:

***APPLICATIONS WITHOUT CVS/RESUMES WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED***

title: E-commerce Finance Officer & Cashflow Strategist
description:
Salary: $1,500 / month (Full-Time)

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Tools: Xero, Shopify, Google Sheets/Excel, Triple Whale (optional)

The Mission

Your goal is to provide the CEO with total financial clarity. You will manage the daily, monthly, and yearly financial health of 
. You aren't just a bookkeeper; you are a cashflow architect who ensures we have the liquidity to scale inventory and ad spend aggressively.

Your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Reporting Accuracy: 100% reconciliation of daily P&L statements.

Cash Efficiency: Maintain an optimized Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC) to prevent stockouts or liquidity crunches.

Compliance: On-time completion of monthly BAS statements and tax consolidations.

Cost Optimization: Identifying $2k - $5k in monthly "waste" (redundant software, shipping discrepancies, etc.).

Core Responsibilities

Daily P&L Tracking: Update the "CEO Metrics" sheet daily with COGS, Shipping, Ad Spend, and Net Profit.

Cashflow Forecasting: Provide a rolling 13-week cashflow forecast to predict inventory purchasing needs.

Xero Management: Handle all bank reconciliations, monthly P&Ls, and Balance Sheets.

Tax & Compliance: Complete monthly BAS statements and prepare all documents for year-end tax consolidation.

Inventory Liaison: Work with the Ops Manager to track "Value on Hand" and ensure deposit payments to suppliers are timed perfectly.

5 More Important Tasks for the Finance Officer

3PL & Shipping Audit: Weekly audit of ROBO3PL invoices to ensure we are actually being charged the $6.50 USD rate and spotting overcharges.

Ad Spend/Revenue Reconciliation: Cross-referencing Shopify "Net Sales" against Meta/Google "Attributed Sales" to find the "Truth" in data.

Payment Processor Optimization: Monitoring PayPal/Stripe/Shopify Pay holdbacks and fees to minimize "lost" percentage points on every transaction.

Unit Economics Stress-Testing: Running "What-If" scenarios (e.g., "If shipping increases 10%, how does that affect our $49 USD offer margin?").

Fixed Cost Management: Tracking the "Burn Rate" of our PH-based team and software stack to maintain a lean operation.

title: UGC Web Developer
description:
UGC Creator Portal – Airtable + Softr Build for Growth Agency

About Us

We run a UGC growth agency working with consumer tech brands. We manage multiple creators producing content daily for different clients. We're currently managing workflows manually and need a streamlined creator portal to scale our operations efficiently.

What We Need Built

The Problem We're Solving

Right now, our content submission, approval, and performance tracking processes are scattered across 
,
, and spreadsheets. We need a centralized system where:



Creators can see available jobs and submit content in one organized place

Our team can approve/deny submissions with clear feedback loops

Content automatically organizes into client-specific folders

We can track creator performance without manual data entry



What You'll Build

Creator-Facing Portal (Softr):



Secure login system (each creator has their own account)

Job board showing available campaigns with details (client, requirements, pay, deadline)

Content upload interface where creators submit videos with metadata (campaign name, concept, TikTok/IG links)

Submission history view (pending, approved, denied status)

Basic earnings/stats dashboard



Admin Portal (Softr):



Separate admin login for our team

Job posting interface (create new campaigns, assign to creators)

Content review queue (approve/deny with feedback notes)

Dashboard showing: pending submissions, approval rates, turnaround times by creator

Client overview (see all content by client)



Backend Database (Airtable):



Creators table (contact info, social handles, performance metrics, payment details)

Jobs/Campaigns table (client name, requirements, budget, deadline, status)

Content Submissions table (linked to creators and jobs, approval status, video URLs, view counts)

Clients table (contact info, active campaigns, content library)

Properly linked relational database structure



Automations (Zapier or 
):



When content is approved ? save video link to Google Drive in correct client folder

When content is uploaded ? notify assigned account manager

When content is denied ? notify creator with feedback

Weekly digest
 summarizing pending approvals



Must-Have Features



Mobile-responsive (creators will access from phones)

Clean, professional UI (represents our brand to creators)

Role-based permissions (creators see only their stuff, admins see everything)

File organization system that mirrors our Google Drive structure

Notification system (
 alerts for key actions)



Nice-to-Have Features



Bulk upload capability for multiple videos at once

Filtering/search functionality (by client, by creator, by date, by status)

Basic analytics dashboard (submission volume over time, top performers)

Integration with payment tracking (so we can log what we've paid creators)



What We're Looking For

Required Experience:



Proven experience building Airtable databases with relational structures

Experience building client portals or login systems using Softr

Comfortable with Zapier or 
 for workflow automation

Strong understanding of user experience (this needs to be intuitive for non-technical users)

Portfolio showing similar projects you've completed



Bonus Points:



Experience working with content creators or agencies

Understanding of Google Drive API integration

Experience with performance tracking dashboards

Knowledge of TikTok/Instagram API for pulling view counts (optional future phase)



Deliverables



Fully configured Airtable base with all tables, fields, views, and relationships

Softr portal (creator-facing + admin-facing) connected to Airtable

Zapier/Make automations set up and tested

Documentation explaining how to use the system (for our team)

Simple video walkthrough showing how to add jobs, review content, onboard new creators

30 days of post-launch support for bugs or adjustments



Timeline



Initial setup call to review requirements: Week 1

Build and testing: Weeks 2-3

Training and handoff: Week 4



We're ready to start immediately with the right person.

To Apply

Please include:



Links to 2-3 similar projects you've built (Airtable + Softr portals, login systems, or creator/client management tools)

Brief description of your approach to building this (tools you'd use, how you'd structure the database)

Estimated timeline for delivery

Your availability (hours per week you can commit)

Any clarifying questions you have about the scope



Note: We're looking for someone who can think through workflows and suggest improvements, not just follow instructions. If you see a better way to structure something, we want to hear it.

title: Real Estate Listing Coordinator
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Listing Coordinator to support our growing real estate team. The Listing Coordinator plays a critical role in managing the listing process from signed agreement through closing, ensuring a smooth, professional experience for both sellers and agents.



This position is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, enjoys managing timelines, and has at least 1 year of real estate transaction or listing coordination experience.



Key Responsibilities



Manage all listing files from signed listing agreement through closing

Enter and maintain listing data in MLS, CRM, and transaction management systems

Coordinate professional photography, staging, lockbox installation, and sign placement

Ensure all compliance documents are completed and properly submitted

Prepare and schedule “Coming Soon” and active listing marketing timelines

Communicate regularly with agents, sellers, photographers, title companies, and vendors

Track deadlines and ensure all listing tasks are completed on time

Maintain accurate listing checklists and status reports

Assist with marketing launch coordination and listing updates



Qualifications



Minimum 1 year experience as a Listing Coordinator, Transaction Coordinator, or similar real estate role

Familiarity with MLS systems and real estate contracts

Strong organizational and time-management skills

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to manage multiple listings and deadlines simultaneously

High attention to detail and accuracy

Proficiency with CRM systems (GHL, Constant contact preferred)

Positive, team-oriented, solution-focused mindset



Application Requirements

To be considered, applicants must submit:



1) Current Resume

2) Cover message summarizing listing coordination experience

3) At least two professional references (name, company,
, and phone number)

4) Must be able to work 9am-11am central time and 8pm-10pm central time 



Applications without references will not be considered.



Preferred Skills (Bonus)



Transaction management software experience (Open To Close, Dotloop, Paperless Pipeline, etc.)

Marketing coordination experience

As business picks up ability to increase hours if needed

title: WordPress Web Developer & Designer
description:
About Scaliency:



Scaliency is a Phoenix, Arizona-based growth marketing agency that builds complete growth systems for service-based businesses -- websites, paid ads (Google & Meta), SEO, content, CRM automation, and AI-powered lead management. Our clients include home service companies, auto repair shops, contractors, coaches, retail shops, and other service businesses across the US. We're growing quickly and are building our core team to support that growth.





Job Description:



You will be Scaliency's primary website builder and designer. You'll redesign outdated client websites into modern, conversion-focused sites (about 60% of projects), build brand-new WordPress websites from scratch (about 40%), create landing pages for ad campaigns, and maintain all client websites. Everything you build is what clients and prospects see first -- so it needs to be polished, mobile-responsive, and built to convert visitors into leads.





Responsibilities:



- Build and redesign WordPress websites using Elementor Pro -- from template selection to final QA and launch.



- Generate page content using our AI tools (Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT), then edit everything for natural readability and brand voice.



- Implement conversion elements across all sites -- forms, pop-ups, CTAs, click-to-call, chat widgets, booking calendars.



- Build dedicated landing pages for PPC campaigns.



- Create reusable Elementor page templates for our SEO Specialist to publish ongoing content.



- Configure on-page SEO technicals on builds (RankMath, heading hierarchy, alt text, clean URLs).



- Maintain all client WordPress sites -- plugin updates, speed optimization, security, content updates.



- Embed external forms and widgets (GoHighLevel, Gravity Forms, other CRM forms, review widgets, calendars).



- Coordinate with our SEO Specialist and Tracking Specialist to ensure sites support the full marketing system.





Requirements:



- 3+ years WordPress development with Elementor / Elementor Pro.



- Strong visual design sense -- your sites look custom and polished.



- Experience redesigning existing websites (template swaps, rebrands, page restructuring).



- Experience building WordPress websites from scratch.



- High-conversion page design understanding (CTA placement, mobile-first layout, user flow).



- Mobile-responsive design across all devices.



- Excellent written & spoken English



- Page speed optimization (image compression, lazy loading, efficient Elementor usage).



- On-page SEO Experience (RankMath or Yoast, heading structure, meta tags, alt text).





Nice to have: WooCommerce experience, CSS/HTML for custom tweaks, Envato Elements familiarity, SiteGround hosting knowledge, CRO understanding.





Tools You'll Use (All Provided):



- Elementor Pro



- Envato Elements



- Gravity Forms, RankMath SEO Pro, Imagify



- SiteGround Hosting



- Scaliency AI Content Tools Premium Subscriptions (Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT)



- WooCommerce





What Working With Us Looks Like:



- Fully remote -- work from anywhere.



- Full-time, Monday-Friday, 40 hours/week.



- Minimum 4 hours overlap with 9am-5pm MST (Arizona time).



- Communication via Slack, Clickup and/or 
 / Whatsapp.



- Weekly video check-ins + ad-hoc video / audio calls as needed.



- Long-term position -- we invest in training and want you to grow with us.

title: Commission Only Cold Call Rep ( Call Center Agents )
description:
Job Description

We are a U.S.-based roofing and exterior company and also marketing company looking for motivated cold callers to set appointments with homeowners.

This is a commission-only position for callers who are confident in their ability to generate appointments consistently.

You may:

Use your own dialer



OR



Use our auto dialer system (training and scripts provided)



This is not a
 Ads or marketing job.

All work is done by phone calling homeowners.

High performers can earn strong weekly income.

Responsibilities

Make outbound calls to homeowners

Speak with homeowners and offer inspections or estimates

Schedule qualified appointments

Enter accurate appointment details

Follow scripts and company guidelines

Pay



$50 per qualified appointment when using your own dialer

$40 per qualified appointment when using our dialer



A qualified appointment means:

Homeowner agrees to an inspection or estimate

Valid phone number and property address

Appointment date and time scheduled

Homeowner or decision maker

Appointments are verified before payment. Duplicate, fake, or unqualified appointments will not be paid.

Requirements

Good spoken English

Comfortable making cold calls

Reliable internet and headset

Positive attitude and persistence

Cold calling or appointment setting experience preferred

To Apply

Please include:

Any cold calling or appointment setting experience

A short voice recording introducing yourself

Whether you plan to use your own dialer or ours

title: TikTok Viral Video Editor – Paid Trial + Ongoing Program
description:
We are launching a consumer app and building a TikTok growth engine.



We are looking for short-form video editors who understand:

- Hooks

- Retention

- Native TikTok formats

- POV / relatable content

- Caption overlays

- Simple but engaging edits



This is a paid trial project (5 videos).



If performance is strong, you will be invited into our ongoing clipping program where you can earn performance-based payouts with breakout bonuses.



Trial Details:

- Create 5 short TikTok videos using our app screenshots.

- You will be given creative direction + examples.

- Videos must feel native to TikTok (no static slideshows).

- English content only.



We are testing:

- Hook strength

- Editing ability

- Retention instincts

- Understanding of viral structure



Compensation: 

Paid trial (fixed amount for 5 videos).

After trial, ongoing program pays:

- $1 per 1,000 views

- Breakout bonuses up to $1,000 per video

- Top performers can earn significantly more.



This is ideal if you:

- Already edit TikTok videos

- Understand viral pacing

- Can turn simple visuals into engaging content

- Want performance-based upside



This is NOT for:

- Corporate video editors

- Long-form YouTube editors

- Generic slideshow creators



To Apply



Send:

- Links to 3 TikTok videos you edited

- Your average view count

- Why you think you understand short-form hooks



We are hiring quickly and starting trials immediately.

title: Doc Drawer (US Mortgage Company | Full-Time | Night Shift | Remote)
description:
Work Setup: 100% Remote (Work From Home)

Schedule: Monday to Friday | Night Shift (U.S. Pacific Time)

Employment Type: Full-Time | Long-Term Position



About the Role



We are a U.S.-based mortgage company looking for a Doc Drawer to join our growing operations team.



Your main responsibility is to prepare and generate accurate loan documents before closing. This is a critical position — errors in documentation can delay loan closings, so we are looking for someone who is highly detail-oriented and reliable.



If you are organized, focused, and serious about building a long-term career in the U.S. mortgage industry, this role is for you.



Fresh graduates are welcome to apply. Applicants with 1–2 years of U.S. mortgage experience are strongly preferred.



Training will be provided to the right candidate.



Key Responsibilities:

> Prepare and generate initial and closing loan documents

> Review loan approvals prior to document generation

> Verify borrower information, loan terms, fees, and rates

> Ensure documents meet compliance and investor guidelines

> Coordinate with processors, underwriters, and closing team

> Maintain internal tracking and documentation accuracy

> Ensure loan packages are complete before release



Qualifications

> Extremely detail-oriented (this is non-negotiable)

> Strong organizational and time management skills

> Good written English communication

> Basic to intermediate skills in Google Workspace or Microsoft Office

> Stable internet connection and quiet home workspace

> Willing to work night shift (PST schedule)

> Able to work independently without constant supervision



Preferred but Not Required

> Experience in U.S. mortgage (doc drawing, processing, closing, underwriting)

> Familiarity with mortgage disclosures and closing documents

> Experience working in a remote setup



What We Offer

> Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)

> Stable, long-term position

> Monday–Friday work only (Weekends off)

> Growth opportunity in the U.S. mortgage industry

> Professional and supportive work environment



>> IMPORTANT APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (READ CAREFULLY)



To be considered:

1. Send your application through OnlineJobs.ph

2. Include a DIRECT LINK to your resume (Google Drive / OneDrive / Dropbox)

3. Make sure the link is set to “Anyone with the link can view”

4. Include the word “DOCREADY” at the top of your application message



Applications without a resume link

Applications without the keyword “DOCREADY”

Resume links that require permission



? Will be automatically rejected.



We only review applicants who follow instructions. Attention to detail starts with your application.

title: Bookkeeper (QuickBooks Online) – Remote / Long-Term
description:
Bookkeeper (QuickBooks Online) – Remote / Long-Term

Company: Ironbooks

Location: Remote (Philippines only)

Job Type: Full-time

Shift: Preferably aligned with North American business hours



About the Role

At Ironbooks, we believe clean books create calm businesses. Behind every confident business owner is someone quietly making sure the numbers tell the truth.

We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Bookkeeper who takes pride in accuracy and finds satisfaction in bringing order to financial data. This role focuses on bookkeeping, reconciliations, and month-end preparation in QuickBooks Online (QBO).

This is NOT a client-facing role. Instead, you will work behind the scenes with clear SOPs and the guidance of senior accounting staff. Your work will directly impact the stability and growth of the businesses we support.

Watch This Before Applying

To better understand who we are and what we value, please watch this short video:





WHY THIS WOULD BE THE RIGHT FIT FOR YOU - By Kedma Ough



Responsibilities

Record and categorize transactions in QuickBooks Online

Maintain clean, organized, and accurate books

Perform bank and credit card reconciliations

Review accounts for errors or inconsistencies and proactively flag issues

Prepare books for month-end close

Assist with historical cleanup and catch-up work

Follow internal processes and documentation standards

Communicate issues clearly and professionally to senior tea
mbers

Requirements (Must Have)

2+ years bookkeeping experience

Strong QuickBooks Online experience (REQUIRED)

Experience with bank & credit card reconciliations

Experience preparing books for month-end close

High attention to detail and commitment to accuracy

Good written English

Able to work independently and meet deadlines

Stable internet and quiet work environment



Nice to Have (Not Required)

Experience with North American clients

Accounting or bookkeeping firm background

Experience with tools like Dext, Hubdoc, Stripe, Gusto, or similar

Familiarity with SOP-driven teams



What We Offer

Long-term, stable remote work with a team that values consistency

Clear expectations and structured workflows so you can focus on doing great work

A supportive accounting team that respects your role and contributions

Growth opportunities for high performers who want to build a lasting career



Why This Role Matters

The work may be behind the scenes, but it is never invisible. Accurate books create trust. Trust creates growth. Your consistency and precision will help business owners sleep better at night.



To Apply





Please include:

Your QuickBooks Online experience (years + type of work)

Your most recent bookkeeping role

Your availability and preferred working hours

Applications without QBO experience will not be considered.

title: HR Assistant
description:
This role is responsible for sourcing, screening, and coordinating top talent for real estate positions. The ideal candidate has recruiting experience, understands real estate roles, and can manage multiple hiring pipelines efficiently in a remote environment.



Job Description:

1. Support full-cycle recruitment for real estate and administrative roles, including Agents, Transaction Coordinators, Property Managers, Leasing Agents, and Admin/VA positions.

2. Create, post, and manage job advertisements across relevant job platforms and social channels.

3. Proactively source candidates via job boards, LinkedIn, and internal/external databases.

4. Screen resumes and conduct initial candidate interviews to assess qualifications and cultural fit.

5. Coordinate interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring smooth scheduling and communication.

6. Maintain accurate candidate pipelines and recruitment trackers to support hiring decisions.

7. Communicate professionally and timely with candidates throughout the hiring process.

8. Assist with onboarding preparation and hiring documentation as needed.

9. Maintain organized recruitment records and ensure data accuracy.

10. Provide general HR administrative support and assist with other HR-related tasks as assigned.



Qualifications: 

1. Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, or related field

2. Experience as an HR Recruiter or Recruitment VA

3. Experience recruiting for real estate roles (preferred)

4. Strong English communication skills

5. Organized, detail-oriented, and reliable

6. Ability to work independently and remotely

7. Can work Pacific Standard Time (PST) hours

description:
POSITION OVERVIEW

 marketing campaigns

title: Business Development Representative
description:
Weekly Schedule:

back up data plan in the event internet connection is down

title: Creative Execution & Brand Delivery Assistant (Design Studio)
description:
Kamusta!!

We are a boutique design studio led by a Filipina founder who built the business through heart, taste, and genuine care for her clients.



This is not a corporate agency.

This is a growing, family-led studio.



Clients work with us because they trust the founder’s creative direction, communication, and integrity. As the studio grows, we are looking for someone to join us long-term and become part of the team behind the scenes.



We offer services including:

• Branding & Rebrands

• Packaging Design

• Web Design

• Social Media Systems

• Brand Strategy

• Illustration & Visual Assets

• Creative Direction



The founder leads all client communication and high-level creative decisions.



We are hiring a Creative Execution & Delivery Assistant whose role is to take already-started projects and bring them to completion — clean, polished, and ready for handoff.



You will not be starting concepts from scratch.

You will be refining, expanding, and preparing approved work.



Your role includes:



Refining & Completing Design Work

• Expanding approved logos into full logo systems

• Polishing typography, spacing, and layout

• Applying branding to packaging dielines

• Preparing web assets for developer handoff

• Creating social templates from approved brand systems

• Finalizing illustrations or supporting graphics based on direction



Preparing Production-Ready Files

• Setting up packaging files with proper bleed and CMYK

• Exporting complete logo packages (AI, EPS, SVG, PNG, JPG, PDF)

• Preparing optimized web and social assets

• Organizing website imagery and brand files



Organizing & Packaging Final Deliverables

• Cleaning and organizing working files

• Following clear naming conventions

• Building structured folder systems

• Creating simple brand guideline PDFs from templates

• Preparing professional delivery folders for clients



You will NOT:

• Speak directly with clients

• Join discovery calls

• Lead creative strategy

• Override creative direction



You will be trusted to take projects from 80% to 100%.



We are looking for someone who:

• Is strong in Adobe Illustrator (required)

• Understands packaging and basic print production

• Has strong attention to detail

• Can follow direction precisely

• Takes pride in clean files and organized systems

• Is looking for a stable, respectful, long-term working relationship



This is a family-led business.

We value loyalty, consistency, and mutual respect.

If you grow with us, there is long-term opportunity.



To apply, include:

1. The word “Precision” at the top of your application

2. A short explanation of how you would prepare a logo package for delivery

3. A link to relevant portfolio work

4. Your internet speed



Salamat!!

title: Client Experience Specialist
description:
Brilliant Brothers Services

Position: Client Experience Specialist (Full-Time Virtual Role)

Full Time Role - 40 Hours per Week. 8am to 430pm Pacific Time, Monday to Friday.

With Quarterly Reviews and Annual Raises.

Victoria, BC (Pacific Time)



8-Year, 15 Person Organization



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



?? PLEASE READ BEFORE APPLYING

This is a high-level client-facing phone role.



You will be the FIRST voice our clients hear.



Because we serve homeowners in Canada, this role requires:

- Neutral North American–style English pronunciation

- Extremely clear speech

- Warm, natural, conversational tone

- Strong emotional intelligence

- Ability to build trust within the first 10 seconds



If your speech is difficult to understand, heavily accented, robotic, monotone, or lacks natural conversational warmth, this role will not be a fit.



We WILL require a video or audio submission before interviews.



If you cannot confidently and clearly say:

“Thank you for calling Brilliant Brothers Services, this is [Name], how can I help you today?”

 in a warm, polished, natural tone, please do not apply!



We are looking for excellence, not average.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



About Us

Brilliant Brothers Services is a fast-growing exterior cleaning company based in Victoria, British Columbia.



We don’t just clean homes.



We deliver 5-star client experiences.



And the experience starts with YOU.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



The Role



You will:

- Answer inbound calls

- Book jobs

- Build estimates

- Respond to
s & texts

- Follow up with leads

- Support Sales & Production Managers

- Maintain 96%+ client satisfaction



This role is primarily phone-based.



You must enjoy speaking to people all day.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



What We’re Looking For

You MUST:

- Speak extremely clear, easy-to-understand English

- Have a neutral North American–friendly tone

- Sound confident (never unsure or casual like “yeah?”)

- Be emotionally intelligent and empathetic

- Be able to handle objections and help sell jobs

- Think quickly on your feet

- Work in a quiet space where you will not be bothered

- Take detailed notes within 2 minutes of every call

- Be extremely organized

- Work Monday–Friday, 8:00am–4:30pm Pacific Time

- Not be working another job



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



What This Role Is NOT

This is NOT:

- A passive data-entry job

- A quiet back-office role

- A script-reading position

- A place for someone uncomfortable on the phone

This is a high-performance client experience role.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Compensation & Benefits

- $600 USD paid every 2 weeks. ($1,200 USD per month)

- Paid bi-weekly

- Paid Days OFF during Canadian holidays (BC schedule)

- Long-term growth opportunity

- Supportive management team

- Performance-based advancement opportunities



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Tools & Experience Required

- Very Clear Accent & English Speaking (Non-negotiable)

- CRM experience (Jobber preferred)

- Google Workspace proficiency

- VOIP/dialer experience

- NOTICE: When you apply for this position through this hiring ad, please insert “PURPLEDRAGON88” at the beginning of your application message. (This shows attention to - detail. If you do not include this code, you will not be selected for this position.)

- Strong
 writing skills

- KPI tracking experience



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Required Work Setup

To do your best work, you’ll need a solid setup:

- Stable Internet (Minimum 50 Mbps)

- Computer or Laptop (nothing slow, please!)

- 2 Monitors (multitasking is a must)

- Webcam

- Headset with (good quality) mic

- Mouse & Keyboard

- Desk & Comfortable Chair

- Internet Router

- Backup Power Supply (UPS) – just in case

- Environment that you can talk loudly in



*** Other Must-Haves ***

- Very few (ideally no) power outages

- Can work Monday to Friday, 8:00am–4:30pm PST

- You are NOT working any other job right now

- Comfortable with:

- - - Speaking with customers on the phone (majority of the day)

- - - Basic IT troubleshooting

- - - Data entry & file organization



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

How to Apply!



Interested in this role? Awesome!



Please apply directly through this hiring ad.



- - -  PLEASE DO NOT
 US OR CALL US — we’re only reviewing applications submitted through this platform.



If you’re a great fit, we’ll be in touch soon to set up the next step.

We can’t wait to meet you!



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



If you are chosen and we reach back out to you, we will be asking you to submit the following:



A 60-second video introducing yourself and what you do for fun.



A 30-second audio sample saying this:

Hi there! My name is ___[YOUR NAME]___, and I work at Brilliant Brothers Services! We specialize in exterior home cleaning services here in Victoria BC. That includes window cleaning, gutter cleaning, roof moss treatment, siding soft washing, and pressure washing. If you’d like, I can ask a couple quick questions about your home and help guide you toward what would be most helpful.”



We will be specifically listening for:

- Warmth

- Clarity

- Confidence

- Natural tone

- Emotional connection

title: Vacation Rental Operations Assistant
description:
Operations Assistant: Elevate Vacation Homes | U.S.-Based (San Diego, CA)



Read this carefully before applying.



We are a small but growing vacation rental company based in U.S. (San Diego, CA) managing 40+ properties, with 90% located in San Diego, California.

Our team is lean by design:

- 1 CEO

- 1 COO

- 1 CFO

- 2 Operations Assistants



We are now hiring one more Operations Assistant — and this is an important role. We are not hiring in volume. We are hiring one person we can grow with as we scale to 80–100 properties. If you perform well and stay with us, this role will naturally grow into a higher position when we expand.



Important Context (Read This Carefully)

We have been hiring and letting people go over the last 6 months. Not because of pay. Not because of workload. But because we are very selective and have not yet found the right long-term fit.



This role requires:

- Strong communication

- Good judgment

- Ownership

- Reliability under pressure



If you’re confident in your ability, this is a rare opportunity to join early and grow with the company. If you’re unsure, this is not the role for you. This Role Is For One Type of Person Only



You are:

- Fluent in spoken and written English

- Comfortable speaking on the phone with:

- Guests

- Vendors

- Homeowners

- Calm, logical, and clear under pressure

- Able to manage multiple issues at once

- A strong problem solver

- Someone who finishes what they start



You are not:

- A task-only VA

- Someone who avoids calls

- Someone who needs constant direction

- Someone who panics under stress

- Someone who relies on AI to communicate



Communication Expectations (Very Important)

You should expect:

- 5–20 phone calls per day



Daily coordination with:

- Cleaning teams

- Maintenance vendors

- Internal staff



If you are not confident speaking English on calls, do not apply.



What You’ll Actually Be Doing: This is not a customer service role.

Approximate breakdown:

- 10% Guest communication

- 5% Cleaning reminders

- 5% Ordering supplies

- 80% Operations, coordination, and problem-solving



You will function as:

- A project manager

- A communicator between teams

- A problem-solver when things go wrong

- A key operations support role



Work Environment

- Small, fast-moving startup

- High accountability

- Clear expectations

- Real responsibility

- Direct communication with leadership

- Opportunity to grow as the company scales



Compensation & Benefits

- Up to $8.00 USD/hour (based on performance)

- 10 days paid time off per year

- 2 days off per week

- Long-term role with growth potential

- Promotion opportunity as we scale to 80–100 properties



Final Note: We are not looking to hire quickly. We are looking to hire correctly. If you believe your experience, communication skills, and work ethic make you a strong fit — apply. If you are unsure, this role is not for you.



How to Apply



If you believe you are a strong fit and meet all of the requirements above, apply using the link below.

https://api.leadconnectorhq.com/widget/form/u5D8ACly2LEOjvjiC88x



Important:

Applications that are dis-honest, incomplete, generic, or clearly copy-pasted will be ignored. We are only moving forward with candidates who demonstrate strong communication, attention to detail, and professionalism. If you’re confident in your abilities and want to grow with a serious team — apply now.

title: Tax Perpare
description:
Tax Preparer Job Description

Position Title: Tax Preparer

Department: Finance / Administration

Reports To: Owner / Office Manager / Accountant

Employment Type: Part-Time / Full-Time / Seasonal

Position Summary

The Tax Preparer is responsible for preparing and filing tax returns accurately and on time. This role includes collecting financial information, entering data into tax software, organizing client records, and ensuring compliance with federal and state tax regulations. The Tax Preparer must maintain confidentiality, work independently, and provide professional customer service.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Prepare individual and/or business tax returns

Enter financial and tax information into tax software (data entry)

Organize and file tax documents (digital and paper)

Maintain accurate client records

Communicate with clients to obtain required documentation

Conduct basic tax and compliance research when needed

Ensure timely electronic filing of returns

Maintain confidentiality of financial information

Assist with administrative filing tasks

Required Qualifications

Minimum 5 years of tax preparation experience

PTIN (Preparer Tax Identification Number) required

Experience using CrossLink tax software

Strong spreadsheet skills (Excel or Google Sheets)

Fluent in English

Ability to work evening hours (Eastern Time)

Strong data entry and filing skills

Self-starter with the ability to work independently

Strong organizational and research skills

High attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications

Experience preparing both individual and small business returns

Bookkeeping or accounting experience

Experience with electronic filing systems

Customer service experience.

title: Brand Visual Designer - CRO / Shopify
description:
We’re building a fast-growing Shopify DTC brand and are looking for a Brand Visual Designer who understands conversion, identity, and front-end performance.



This is not just graphic design.



You will own how the brand looks and converts across our website.



You will:



Design high-converting Shopify storefronts (colors, typography, layout, UI flow)



Improve product pages using CRO principles



Create on-brand visuals that increase trust and impulse buys



Optimize above-the-fold sections, PDP layouts, and mobile UX



Translate brand identity into a clear visual system



Analyze competitors and extract what actually works



Work closely with founder on brand direction



You must have:



Proven Shopify front-end design experience



Strong CRO knowledge (not just aesthetics)



Deep understanding of color psychology, hierarchy, and layout



Experience designing high-converting product pages



Figma + Adobe skills



Commercial mindset (design that sells)



Strong English communication



Not for you if:



You only make “pretty websites”



You don’t think about conversions



You can’t explain why a design choice increases sales



We want someone who designs with intent.



Long-term collaboration.



To apply:



Share 2–3 Shopify brands or product pages you designed



Explain one CRO improvement you made and its impact



Share your portfolio



Write READ at the top

title: Google Ads Manager
description:
Location: Remote (USA Based Accounts)



Requirements:

Fluent English Speaking

Platform Mastery: 2+ years of hands-on experience in the Google Ads interface (Search, Shopping, and Display).



Status: Full-Time



The Role: Google Ads Account manager

OxBow USA is seeking a critical-thinking, data-driven Google Ads Specialist to own the technical management of 10–15 client accounts.



Unlike traditional agency roles, this is NOT a client-facing position. You will not be on client calls or managing
s with business owners. Instead, you will work directly with our internal Account Managers and Founders to execute high-level strategies, manage budgets, and optimize for results on the Google Ad accounts that OxBow manages for other business'



What You’ll Be Doing:

Full Account Management: Take 100% ownership of the Google Ads interface for 10–15 diverse business accounts. All companies/accounts are part of the Outdoor industry.



Execution & Iteration: Build, launch, and relentlessly optimize Search, Display, and Video campaigns based on internal strategy briefs.



Budget Stewardship: Manage client budgets with extreme precision, ensuring we hit spend targets while maximizing ROI.



Critical Problem Solving: Don't just follow a checklist. Analyze "why" an account is fluctuating and propose technical solutions to fix it.



Internal Collaboration: Participate in weekly internal strategy syncs with OxBow managers to report on performance and plan upcoming technical moves.



Why This Role is Different:

Deep Work Environment: No client interruptions. No frantic "where is my ad?" phone calls. You are here to focus on the numbers and the creative.



Collaborative Support: Our Account Managers handle the "people stuff" and provide you with clear tasks and information from the client.



Training & Onboarding: We provide a 1-month paid training period to get you up to speed on the "OxBow Way" of managing accounts.



Critical Thinker: You look at a high CPC and don't just see a number; you see a landing page friction point or a keyword match-type error.



Budget Conscious: You treat the client's money as your own—maximizing efficiency and preventing waste.



Team-First Communicator: Ability to explain technical ad concepts clearly to internal tea
mbers during weekly calls.



Accountability: You are self-motivated and take pride in "owning" the performance of your assigned cohort of accounts.

title: Executive Search Recruiter and Research Analyst
description:
Summary

Job Title: Executive Search Research Analyst & Administrative Coordinator

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Part Time / Full-Time

Reports To: Founder & Managing Director



About Crimson Jay Executive Search Partners

Crimson Jay Executive Search Partners is a retained executive search firm based in the United States that partners with founder-led and investor-backed companies to recruit transformational financial and operational leaders. We specialize in acquiring top-tier talent across the C-suite and VP-level—particularly CFOs, COOs, and functional executives—who drive scalable growth and successful exits for high-growth businesses. Our clients are typically small to mid-market companies with revenues under $500M, most commonly between $1M and $200M, across industries like B2B services, software/SaaS, manufacturing, and financial services.



We are known for our white-glove, hands-on approach, our structured and transparent process, and our obsession with delivering results. We are now looking for a sharp, detail-oriented, and resourceful professional to join us in a critical research and administrative capacity.



Role Overview

The Executive Search Research Analyst & Administrative Coordinator will play a vital dual role supporting both candidate research and firm operations. This is a unique opportunity to work directly with the Founder in a high-touch executive search environment. You’ll be responsible for identifying talent, supporting active search engagements, and helping manage day-to-day operations that enable high-impact client delivery.



Key Responsibilities



Research & Candidate Identification



Build and maintain target lists, market maps, and org charts of executive leadership teams at relevant companies.



Conduct deep candidate sourcing using LinkedIn Recruiter, search strings, market intel, and research tools.



Monitor industry movement, executive transitions, and deal activity in private equity, venture capital, and M&A spaces to identify new opportunities and talent.



Compile and organize research briefs, company profiles, and competitor intelligence.



Candidate Process Support



Maintain detailed records in the firm’s CRM/ATS (Loxo) and keep search pipelines up to date.



Support the development of candidate scorecards, summaries, and job transition documentation.



Assist in scheduling candidate interviews and preparing interview guides and presentations for clients.



Help manage reference checks, background verifications, and candidate communications.



Administrative & Operational Coordination



Provide executive support to the Founder including scheduling, inbox management, and project tracking.



Create, edit, and format client-facing documents including job profiles, pitch decks, and candidate presentations.



Track deliverables, project timelines, invoices, and status updates to ensure smooth execution across all searches.



Help improve internal documentation, templates, and SOPs as the firm scales.



Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree required; preferred background in business, communications, or a research-intensive field.



2-5 years of experience in executive search, recruiting, research, or professional services preferred.



Exceptional attention to detail and organizational discipline.



Highly proficient with Google Workspace, LinkedIn Recruiter, and web-based research.



Familiarity with CRM/ATS platforms (e.g., Loxo) a plus.



Clear, concise writing and communication skills are essential.



Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.



Who You Are



A rigorous thinker with strong intellectual curiosity and follow-through.



A proactive contributor who thrives with autonomy and accountability.



A high-integrity professional who treats confidential information with discretion.



A behind-the-scenes operator who takes pride in enabling great work and building something meaningful.



Why Join Crimson Jay

You’ll be joining a founder-led firm in high-growth mode, working on mission-critical searches that shape the future of small and mid-sized companies. You’ll gain exposure to high-level executive leadership, private equity firms, and top-tier operators—while building search and business operations experience in a performance-driven but human, flexible culture.

title: US Bookkeeper
description:
We are a growing bookkeeping firm based on the US West Coast (PST), and we’re looking for a detail-oriented, proactive numbers enthusiast to join our team! We aren't just looking for someone to "input data." We want a partner who truly understands the "why" behind the numbers. If you love clean books, organized files, and helping small businesses thrive, we’d love to meet you!



Key Tasks:

* Daily coding of transactions to the correct Chart of Accounts

* Recording and applying customer payments against invoices accurately, ensuring we match them correctly and don't a
 double-count income.

* Managing AP/AR, liability reconciliations, and bank reconciliations

* Preparing monthly financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow) that give our clients total peace of mind.

* We follow SOPs, but we love it when you suggest a more efficient way to get things done!



Requirements:

* Accounting degree or certified bookkeeper preferred

* 2+ years of US-based bookkeeping experience. You should be comfortable handling multiple client files at once and have a deep understanding of clearing accounts.

* Expert-level skills in QuickBooks Online and Xero (certification preferred)

* Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

* Advanced written and spoken English required. You must be comfortable discussing bookkeeping topics on live video calls and writing clear, professional messages to US clients.

* Reliable internet connection and computer

* Bonus points if you have hands-on experience using Double (formerly Keeper.app), Shopify, Amazon, Square, Stripe, Toast, Clover, or Google Workspace in a bookkeeping environment.



Work Schedule

* This is a part-time position (20 hours per week)

* For the first 2–4 weeks, we will work together during US Pacific Time (PST) hours for live training and real-time feedback.

* After training, you may work Philippine Standard Time hours; however, we require at least 1 hour of daily overlap with PST (Monday–Thursday) to ensure smooth communication and workflow alignment.



How To Apply (Applications without these will be ignored)

Please include all of the following:

1. A brief introduction (2-3 paragraphs max)

2. Your Quickbooks Online Experience

3. The types of US clients you have supported (industry & size)

4. Your experience working for a bookkeeping or accounting firm

5. Include your favorite color in the heading line.

All the best,

title: Website Developer Needed (Google Ads Tracking + Ongoing WordPress Maintenance)
description:
Position Type: Part-Time / Long-Term

Location: Remote 

Websites: 2 WordPress websites (similar structure)

Industry: Real Estate



About the Role

We are seeking an experienced WordPress Website Developer to assist with an immediate technical project and then continue working with us on a monthly retainer basis for ongoing website maintenance and support.

This role is ideal for someone who enjoys troubleshooting, keeping websites running smoothly, and building long-term working relationships.



Phase 1: Immediate Project – Google Ads & Tracking Fixes

• Audit current tracking setup across both WordPress sites

• Diagnose and correct Google Ads conversion tracking issues

• Review and fix Google Tag Manager configuration

• Ensure Google Analytics (GA4) is properly connected and reporting accurately

• Verify conversions are firing correctly after fixes are complete



Phase 2: Ongoing Work – Monthly Retainer

• Perform monthly maintenance on 2 WordPress websites

• Monitor site health, performance, and functionality

• Update plugins, themes, and WordPress core as needed

• Troubleshoot and resolve errors or broken functionality

• Fix new issues that may arise on the sites

• Make minor site improvements when requested

• Proactively flag potential issues or opportunities for improvement



Experience & Skills Required

• 3+ years of professional experience with WordPress development and maintenance

• Strong experience with:

  -Google Ads conversion tracking

 -Google Tag Manager

 -Google Analytics (GA4)

• Ability to troubleshoot technical issues efficiently

• Clear and professional communication skills

• Ability to explain technical concepts in simple terms

• Dependable, detail-oriented, and responsive



Expectations & Work Style

• Clear communication and realistic timelines

• Documentation or brief summaries of work completed

• Transparency around hours worked and tasks performed

• Proactive problem-solving and recommendations

• Long-term mindset — we are looking for an ongoing partner, not a short-term contractor



Compensation

• Open to proposals

• Please include:

     -Your hourly rate and/or monthly retainer pricing

     -How you typically structure ongoing maintenance retainers

     -Any minimum monthly hours required

• We value reliability, experience, and quality of work over the lowest price



How to Apply

Please include the following in your application:

1. A brief summary of your WordPress experience

2. Examples of WordPress websites you currently maintain or have worked on

3. Specific experience with Google Ads tracking and Google Tag Manager

4. Your proposed hourly rate and/or retainer fee

5. Your typical availability and response time



To help us review applicants efficiently, please begin your application with the words:

“Tracking First.”

title: Service Desk Agent - Level1
description:

Work Arrangement: Fully Remote (Work From Home)



Duties and Responsibilities:



• Process i
 and requests via telephone and

title: GoHighLevel Automation Expert – Cold Email & SMS Strategy (Real Estate)
description:
This role is for advanced GoHighLevel automation experts only. Beginners and general VAs should not apply.



Job Overview



We are a real estate business seeking an advanced GoHighLevel (GHL) automation expert to design and build a cold
 and cold SMS outreach system entirely within GoHighLevel.

This is a one-time project where the selected candidate will be responsible for both:

1. Proposing the outreach strategy, and

2. Implementing the automation inside GoHighLevel

We are intentionally not prescribing a specific structure. We want to evaluate how experienced professionals design compliant, scalable cold outreach systems using GHL’s native tools.



Build a fully automated cold outreach system in GoHighLevel that:

• Uses cold
 and cold SMS

• Accepts cold lead lists via CSV upload

• Accounts for
 and SMS compliance (including A2P)

• Tracks engagement and replies

• Automatically updates CRM pipeline stages

• Notifies our team when a lead is interested or books a call

• Requires minimal manual management after launch



Responsibilities

GoHighLevel Automation & CRM

• Design and build cold
 workflows in GoHighLevel

• Design and build cold SMS workflows in GoHighLevel

• Create logic-based follow-ups (no reply, reply, booked call, etc.)

• Build CRM pipelines and automation triggers

• Apply tags, smart lists, and lead status updates

• Configure internal notifications for replies and booked appointments



Strategy & Compliance

• Propose a cold
 + SMS strategy appropriate for real estate outreach

• Account for
 compliance, SMS compliance, and A2P requirements

• Recommend sequencing logic 
 vs SMS timing)

• Design systems that protect sender reputation and engagement



Documentation & Handoff

• Provide a Loom walkthrough or brief documentation

• Ensure the system can be managed internally after handoff



Required Experience

• Advanced GoHighLevel experience (required)

• Proven experience building cold
 and SMS automations

• Strong understanding of
 and SMS compliance

• Experience with real estate or local service businesses preferred

• Ability to architect systems independently

• Comfortable proposing strategy, not just executing instructions



Ideal Candidate

• GoHighLevel power user (automation-focused)

• Thinks like a systems designer, not a task-based VA

• Comfortable making strategic recommendations

• Clear communicator

• Has overlap with U.S. business hours



Project Details

• Project Type: One-time setup

• Timeline: 2–4 weeks preferred

• Lead Source: CSV uploads

• Future Work: Additional automation projects possible



How to Apply (Required)

To be considered, please include:

1. Your experience level with GoHighLevel automations

2. Examples of cold
 and/or SMS systems you’ve built in GHL

3. A brief written outline of how YOU would approach cold
 + SMS outreach inside GoHighLevel (including compliance considerations)

4. A Loom walkthrough if available (preferred)

5. Your availability and U.S. time overlap

Applications that do not demonstrate real GoHighLevel expertise will not be considered.
