title: Backend Developer (TypeScript / Node.js) – AI Telephony & Webhook Integration
description:
About the Role



We are building a production AI-powered communications platform that handles:



Inbound phone calls (Twilio)



WhatsApp webhooks



Business-hours call routing logic



Background job scheduling



Compliance-sensitive request validation



We already have detailed technical specs and core logic defined.

Your role is to implement and integrate these utilities into our existing NestJS backend.



This is not a research role and not a frontend role.

This is structured backend integration work.



What You’ll Be Doing



Integrate TypeScript utilities into a NestJS backend



Implement Twilio webhook signature validation



Apply business-hours logic to outbound call routing



Add request guards and return proper HTTP 403 responses when needed



Write and run Jest tests



Debug edge cases (timezones, malformed payloads, webhook retries)



Follow written specifications precisely



You will not be redesigning the system architecture.



Required Skills



Strong TypeScript



Node.js experience



Experience with REST APIs and webhooks



Basic understanding of HMAC / request signing validation



Comfortable working in a structured codebase



Experience with testing (Jest or similar)



Nice to Have



NestJS experience



Twilio experience



Experience with queues (Redis / BullMQ)



Experience handling timezone logic



What This Role Is NOT



Not frontend/UI work



Not AI model training



Not chatbot prompt engineering



Not open-ended experimentation



This is backend systems execution.



Work Setup



Remote



Flexible hours (overlap with PST preferred but not required)



Task-based workflow



Clear written specs provided



Code reviewed before merge



To Apply



Please include:



Your years of experience with Node.js / TypeScript



A GitHub link (or code sample) showing backend work



A short explanation (2–3 sentences) of what a webhook is and why signature validation is important



Your expected hourly rate



Applications without code samples will not be considered.

title: Seo Specialist
description:
Job Title: SEO Specialist – Waste Management Industry



We are committed to providing innovative waste management solutions that promote sustainability and environmental responsibility. We are looking for a talented SEO Specialist to join our team and help elevate our online presence, drive organic traffic, and enhance our search engine rankings.



Job Description:

As an SEO Specialist, you will be responsible for developing and implementing effective SEO strategies tailored to our waste management website. Your goal will be to improve our visibility in search engine results, attract qualified leads, and ultimately drive conversions.



Key Responsibilities:



Conduct thorough keyword research to identify opportunities specific to the waste management sector.

Optimize website content, including on-page SEO elements such as meta tags, headers, and internal linking.

Analyze website performance using tools like Google Analytics, SEMrush, or Ahrefs, and provide actionable insights.

Develop and execute link-building strategies to increase domain authority and improve rankings.

Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends, algorithm changes, and best practices in SEO.

Collaborate with content creators to ensure alignment between SEO strategy and content development.

Monitor and report on SEO performance metrics, adjusting strategies as needed to meet goals.

Conduct competitor analysis to identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities.



Qualifications:



Proven experience in SEO, preferably within the waste management or environmental sector.

Strong understanding of SEO tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Moz).

Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and website management systems (e.g., WordPress).

Familiarity with local SEO practices and techniques.

Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail.

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.



Preferred Qualifications:



Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Environmental Science, or a related field.

Experience with content marketing and social media strategies.

Knowledge of PPC and digital marketing trends.



What We Offer:



Competitive salary and benefits package.

Flexible working hours and the option for remote work.

Opportunities for professional development and growth.

A supportive and collaborative work environment.



How to Apply:

If you are passionate about SEO and making a positive impact in the waste management industry, we would love to hear from you! Please send your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and successes in SEO.



Join us in our mission to create a cleaner, greener future through effective waste management solutions!

title: Full-Time AI Video Producer & Editor — Permanent Role with U.S. Company (All AI Tools Provided)
description:
About Us

We are a U.S.-based AI video production company located in Rhode Island. We serve clients in real estate, insurance, brand storytelling, and character-driven animation. We've been in video production since 2019 and have worked with high-profile clients across multiple industries.

This is a permanent, salaried position with daily work. We have long-term client partnerships that guarantee consistent production year-round. We are building a team — not cycling through freelancers.

About the salary range: We listed a wide range because we're open to different experience levels. If you're a strong traditional editor who's eager to grow into AI video, we'll start you at a fair rate and invest in your development. If you're already producing broadcast-quality AI video and can hit the ground running, we'll pay accordingly — up to $3,500/month for the right person. We believe in paying well for excellent work.



Why This Job Is Different

We provide ALL AI tools and software subscriptions. You will not need to pay for any AI video platforms out of pocket. Once you're part of the team, we give you full access to the tools you need — including platforms like Sora, VEO, Kling, Runway, Pika, HeyGen, and others as needed. We also provide Adobe Creative Cloud if required.

We know these tools are expensive. We invest in our team so you can focus on doing great work instead of worrying about subscription costs.

What else we offer:



Monthly salary starting at $500/month for promising candidates, scaling up to $3,500/month for top performers — we pay for results and commitment, not just hours

Salary paid consistently (weekly during your first 2 months, then bi-monthly)

13th month bonus in December

All AI tool subscriptions and software covered by us

Training on our specific workflows and client standards

Real career growth — we promote from within and reward strong performers with raises and leadership opportunities

Payment via Wise, PayPal, or your preferred method





What You'll Be Doing

Your day-to-day work will include:



Creating AI-generated video content using multiple platforms — selecting the right tool for each creative challenge

Building and animating realistic digital avatars with accurate lip sync, natural facial expressions, and believable body language

Editing and polishing final videos in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, or DaVinci Resolve — including transitions, motion graphics, captions, color correction, and audio mixing

Translating scripts and client briefs into visual content across corporate, cinematic, and commercial styles

Quality-checking every deliverable for consistency in character appearance, lighting, pacing, and overall professional standard





Who We're Looking For

We need someone who treats AI as a creative tool, not a shortcut. The right person has three qualities:

1. High standards for quality. You notice artifacts, background warping, unnatural blinking, and lip sync issues before anyone else. Color correction and lighting continuity are part of your process from the start — not finishing touches.

2. Understanding of AI video tools. You don't need to own subscriptions to every platform, but you should understand what different AI video tools can do and how they compare. If you've used free tiers, watched breakdowns, experimented during trials, or studied these tools closely — that counts. We will give you full access once you're on the team.

3. Strong post-production skills. Creating the AI clip is only half the job. Editing, pacing, sound design, compositing, and storytelling are the other half. You should be comfortable and confident in Premiere Pro, After Effects, or DaVinci Resolve.



Technical Requirements



Hands-on experience or demonstrated knowledge of 2 or more AI video platforms (HeyGen, Kling, VEO, Runway, Midjourney, Pika, Sora, etc.)

Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects (or DaVinci Resolve)

Portfolio showing strong visual storytelling, pacing, and compositional sense

Clear English communication — you'll interpret creative briefs and collaborate directly with our team

Reliable internet connection and a computer capable of running video editing software smoothly





How to Apply — Please Read Carefully

We review every application personally. To help us find the right person, please include the following in your application:

1. Show us your work. Share 2-3 video samples. We are looking for:



AI-generated video work if you have it (even free-tier or watermarked samples are fine — we understand tool access is limited)

Polished post-production work (editing, color, motion graphics, sound design)

Avatar-focused or character-driven examples will put you at the top of the list

If you don't have AI video samples, show us your strongest traditional editing work AND explain which AI video tools you've studied or experimented with and what you know about their strengths and limitations



2. Tell us why this role fits you. In a few sentences (not a copy-paste cover letter), explain what about this position matches where you are in your career and why you're looking for something permanent.

3. Include the word "Storyboard" at the beginning of your application so we know you read the full post.

Important: Applications without any work samples will not be reviewed. You don't need a perfect portfolio — but we need to see evidence of your skills and your eye for quality.

title: CFO / Head of Finance — Shopify + Subscription (MRR) Business
description:
We’re building a fast-growing Shopify brand with subscriptions at its core.

This is NOT bookkeeping.



We’re looking for a hands-on CFO / Head of Finance to own the full financial operating system.



You understand:

- Shopify + subscriptions

- eCommerce cashflow

- MRR / churn / cohorts

- Contribution margin

- Payment processors

- Scaling with financial control



YOUR ROLE

- You turn raw data into clarity and action.



You’ll handle:

- Weekly MRR reporting

- Monthly close (P&L, cashflow, balance sheet)

- Contribution margin by SKU/channel

- Stripe + Shopify reconciliation

- Refunds + chargebacks

- 90-day cash forecasting

- Churn, cohorts, LTV, retention

- Financial models + scaling scenarios



You don’t just report numbers — you explain what to do next.



YOU MUST HAVE

- CFO / Senior FP&A experience in Shopify or DTC eCommerce

- Real subscription/MRR experience

- Strong Sheets/Excel modeling

- Stripe + Shopify payout experience

- Unit economics understanding

- Ownership mindset



NOT FOR YOU IF

- You only do bookkeeping

- No MRR experience

- No eCommerce unit economics

- You avoid ownership



We want builders.



ENGAGEMENT

- Long-term

- Part-time to full-time

- Strategic seat at the table



APPLICATION



Send:



- Your Shopify + subscription experience

- How you track MRR/churn/margin

- One dashboard or model you built

- Your monthly close process



Write HONOR at the top.

description:
USA Agency Assistant Manager — Creative & Paid Ads Support

THIS ASSISTANT MUST BE A STRONG LEADER WHO CAN MANAGE THE WHOLE TEAM, HAS A STRONG PERSONALITY, AND ENSURES TASKS ARE COMPLETED ON TIME.**



We are hiring a detail-oriented Assistant Manager to support our Manager and help oversee daily operations for our Creative and Paid Ads team. This role requires someone organized, proactive, and able to manage multiple tasks while keeping projects on track in Trello. The first two weeks will be a performance evaluation period before moving into a full-time position.



You will be responsible for directing Canva video ad production for local service clients, creating simple videos and images in Canva when needed, providing clear creative direction to designers, organizing client assets in Google Drive and Canva brand folders, gathering photos and videos from client social channels such as
, Instagram, Google My Business, and YouTube, reviewing ad creatives and copy for accuracy and quality control, tracking live ads through screenshots in Google Sheets, and supporting deadlines, data tasks, and internal team coordination. Strong skills in team management, Canva creative direction, proofreading, organization, and Google Drive file management are essential for success in this role.



Candidates must have prior experience working with U.S. paid ads agencies in local service niches, strong attention to detail, excellent proofreading ability, the ability to work independently while thinking like a manager, and a highly organized and proactive work style. You must also be comfortable handling frequent file transfers and managing digital assets.



We are looking for someone who catches mistakes before clients see them, keeps teams organized, and helps projects move quickly without constant supervision. If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.

title: YouTube Video Editor
description:
We are building a serious YouTube media brand. 
_



This is not a casual vlog.



We are a family building resorts around the world, and raising 4 kids unconventionally, and documenting business, adventure, faith, and growth.



We need a sharp editor who understands:



• Hook psychology

• Retention pacing

• Emotional storytelling

• Modern YouTube rhythm

• Clean sound design



You will not just trim clips.



You will shape stories.



What You’ll Do:



- Edit 1 long-form YouTube video per week (8–12 min)



- Create 3 short cutdowns from each video



- Design thumbnails



- Package titles/descriptions for upload



- Add music, light motion graphics (like maps, & overlays)



- Improve our story structure, not just execute instructions



- We will send a short voice memo explaining story direction. You are expected to ask any clarifying questions you need answered, and then elevate it.



This Is NOT For You If:



- You need step-by-step instructions for every cut



- You edit chronologically without tension



- You rely on slow pacing (or fast pacing) on every video



- You only copy what other creators do



- You can’t take direct feedback



This IS For You If:



- You think in hooks and curiosity loops



- You cut aggressively for pacing



- You understand YouTube retention graphs



- You care about audience psychology



- You want to grow with a long-term brand



Required Skills:



- Advanced Premiere Pro



- Strong English comprehension & communication



- Experience editing 8–30 min YouTube videos



- Good internet for large file transfers



Bonus:



- Thumbnail design



- Basic motion graphics



- Understanding of YouTube analytics



How To Apply (Read Carefully)



Most applicants will be ignored.



To be considered, send the following and ONLY the following:



- 2 long-form YouTube videos you edited (8+ minutes)



- A 3–5 sentence breakdown of how you improved retention in the two videos you send



- A rewritten hook for this imaginary title: “We Moved Our Family to the Jungle… Here’s What Happened”



- Your expected monthly rate for 1 long-form and 3 cut downs per week



- Tell me how you would improve the hook, pacing and retention on this video: 



- One paragraph on why you want to work on this channel and why I should hire you



If you do not include all 6 items, your application will not be reviewed. If you include additional links or information, your application will not be reviewed.



Growth Opportunity



This is a long-term role.



If you prove exceptional:



- Compensation will increase



- Responsibility can grow



- Potential full-time role



We are serious about building this channel.



If you are too, please apply.

PRODUCTION COORDINATOR

-Tracking approvals, revisions, timelines, and deadlines

-Understanding MOQs, lead times, and production limitations



SALES ASSOCIATE



-Direct communication with sorority & fraternity clients

-Handling quotes, follow-ups, and order confirmations

-Managing multiple chapters at once without dropping the ball

-Experience selling or supporting Greek apparel orders



GRAPHIC DESIGNER



-Creating Greek-life apparel mockups

-Designing for hoodies, sweatpants, tees, tanks, embroidery, screen print, etc.

-Strong understanding of Greek aesthetics, trends, and standards

-Comfortable with revisions and rush timelines



REQUIREMENTS:

-Direct experience in Greek custom apparel (required)

-Strong communication skills

-High attention to detail

-Ability to work under tight deadlines

-Comfortable in a fast-moving, high-expectation environment

-Reliable internet and availability during U.S. business hours (or overlap)



Why Work With Us:



-Long-term role with a growing premium Greek apparel brand

-Clear systems and structured workflows

-Real opportunity to grow into leadership roles

-Work directly with a U.S.-based ownership team

-Competitive pay based on experience



HOW TO APPLY:



Please include:



-Your role experience (Operations, Sales, Design — or multiple)

-Specific sorority/fraternity experience

-Samples of past work (mockups, brands, or role descriptions)

-Your availability and expected monthly compensation



?? We are only reviewing candidates with real Greek-life custom apparel experience.

title: ASSISTANT US TAX PREPARER (PH ACCOUNTANT)
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

We are seeking an experienced (4+ years) and detail-oriented US Tax Preparer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have strong knowledge of federal and state tax regulations and experience preparing individual and/or business tax returns.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

• Prepare and file federal and state tax returns (1040, 1120, 1120S, 1065, etc.)

• Review financial records such as income statements and documentation of expenditures

• Identify potential tax credits and liabilities and ensure accurate tax compliance

• Stay current with changes in US tax laws and regulations

• Maintain confidentiality of sensitive financial information



QUALIFICATIONS

• CPA preferred

• Proven experience as a US Tax Preparer (4+ years)

• Strong knowledge of IRS tax regulations and filing requirements

• Experience with tax software (ATX, TaxDome, QuickBooks, etc.)

• Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills

• Strong communication and customer service skills

• Ability to meet deadlines, especially during tax season



WHAT WE OFFER

• Competitive compensation

• Flexible work schedule

• Opportunities for professional growth

• Supportive and collaborative team culture

title: Looking For A Researcher (GOLDEN JOB)
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented and reliable Researcher to assist with YouTube content and recent/current events research.



Responsibilities:



Conduct accurate and up-to-date research on trending topics and recent events



Gather supporting data, sources, and references for YouTube content



Verify facts and ensure information is credible



Organize findings clearly and efficiently



Requirements:



Must have a VPN



Strong communication skills



Reliable high-speed internet and a good working computer



Intermediate-level research experience



Ability to meet deadlines



To apply, please send your portfolio along with examples of previous research work.



Flat rate compensation will be discussed with selected candidates. Bonus pay may be added depending on performance.



Also, we've had issues with bot applications lately. To help us filter, please start your message with a fruit that's yellow when ripe — and if you enjoy baking, feel free to share a quick recipe for something tropical (we're always looking for snack ideas for the team).

title: Meta Ads Manager - Shopify Ecommerce
description:
We are an Australian Shopify Eyewear brand.  We run Meta Adavantage + and retargeting campaigns. 



We are looking for a part time Meta Ads Manager (25 hours per week) to 

-Manage existing campaigns

-Build new campaigns as needed

-Test creatives

-Optimise CPA

-Improve retargeting

-Provide weekly performance reports. 



Experience required;

-Strong experience running Advantage+ Shopping campaigns

-Experience working with Meta’s AI-driven optimisation (broad targeting, minimal audience layering)

-Focus on creative testing and performance-based scaling

-Understanding of blended ROAS and contribution margin

-Experience scaling campaigns using budget increases (not constant rebuilding)

-Ability to monitor CPA,ROAS,CTR, CPM and optimise accordingly. 

-Must provide examples of eCommerce campaigns managed and ROAS achieved. 

-Experience setting up and monitoring CAPI/pixel tracking.

title: VA Accountant
description:
We are looking for a VA Accountant with experience in U.S. tax accounting to prepare and review individual and business tax returns, ensure IRS compliance, and support tax planning and financial reporting. The role requires strong knowledge of QuickBooks and SAGE Intacct, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently in a remote setting while collaborating with the finance team during PST business hours.



Responsibilities:

-Prepare and review tax returns for individuals and businesses.

-Ensure all filings meet U.S. tax regulations and requirements.

-Assist in tax strategy development to boost financial efficiency.

-Stay on top of tax law changes and conduct research as needed.

-Support financial reporting for audits and tax-related documentation.

-Collaborate with the finance team to manage inquiries and ensure smooth operations.

-Keep accurate and organized financial records.



Qualifications:

-Proficiency in QuickBooks and SAGE Intacct is a must; CPA certification is a big plus.

-Solid experience in U.S. tax accounting (corporate & individual).

-Familiarity with tax software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAGE).

-Strong knowledge of IRS regulations and tax compliance.

-Detail-oriented, with excellent problem-solving skills.

-Strong communication skills (written & verbal).

-Ability to work independently and meet deadlines in a remote setting.

-3-5 years of relevant experience in tax accounting (preferred)

title: Junior Customer Support Assistant
description:
We are looking for a Junior Customer Support Assistant to join our growing team on a part-time basis.



We are an international e-commerce company that designs, produces, and ships our own clothing worldwide. Our main markets include the USA, UAE, and several countries across Europe. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a young, ambitious individual who wants to learn, grow, and build real skills inside a fast-paced online business.



Who We Are Looking For



- Maximum age: 25 years old

- Ambitious and eager to learn

- Strong communication skills

- Responsible and organized

- Comfortable working independently

- Not afraid to take initiative and share ideas



This is a junior role, so extensive experience in e-commerce or customer service is not required. However, you must understand the basics of how online stores operate and how customer service works. Most importantly, you must have the right mindset and a strong willingness to grow.



If you are motivated and show commitment, you will be rewarded for your effort and development.



What You Will Do



You will receive training to become responsible for customer communication and support. Your tasks will include:



- Responding to customer
s

- Handling customer questions via WhatsApp

- Managing social media messages

- Supporting the current customer service team

- Assisting with light administrative tasks

- Learning how to operate as a Virtual Assistant within an international e-commerce company



Over time, this role can grow into a full-time position with broader responsibilities.



What We Offer:



- Flexible working hours

- Remote work

- Training in customer service and e-commerce operations

- Real experience inside a growing international fashion brand

- Opportunity to grow into a larger role



As long as the work is completed properly and on time, you have achieved your goal. We value responsibility over micromanagement.



Important!

Please only apply if you are 25 years old or younger. This is specifically a junior, part-time development role.

If you are ready to grow, learn fast, and build real skills in international e-commerce, we would love to hear from you.

title: Client Success Manager
description:
JOB OVERVIEW



Sell More Homes | Tech Specialist | Full-Time



Sell More Homes is a 7-figure marketing and coaching company that helps real estate agents across North America systemize their businesses, and close more deals using Meta/YouTube ads, HighLevel CRM, AI, and virtual assistants.



We’re looking for a Tech Specialist to join our winning team! If you're a pro at marketing tech, CRM systems, and love helping others succeed, this role might be for you.



What You’ll Do:



Onboard New Clients:

Serve as the first tech touchpoint for new clients. You'll walk them through onboarding sessions, help them set up or connect their Meta 
) ad accounts and HighLevel CRM.



CRM Setup:

Set up and customize HighLevel CRM accounts for new clients – including pipelines, automations, integrations, workflows, and more.



Support & Troubleshooting:

Provide tech guidance, answer client questions about tools and integrations, and troubleshoot setup issues as needed.



---



What We’re Looking For:



* Proven experience with marketing platforms (especially Meta Ads and GoHighLevel CRM)

* Comfortable guiding non-technical clients through tech setup

* Excellent communication, organization, and follow-through

* A proactive team player who can manage multiple onboarding clients at once

* Detail-oriented and process-driven

* Fast learner who thrives in a fast-paced, evolving environment

* Bonus: experience in real estate, digital marketing, or SaaS onboarding



---



Why Join Sell More Homes?



* Play a vital role in a fast-growing, impact-driven company

* Learn directly from a high-performing team and visionary founder

* Be part of a real estate marketing agency that recently earned HighLevel Gold SaaS status (2024) – and we’re aiming for Platinum in 2025

* Opportunity to grow into operations, client success, or product roles

* Work with passionate real estate professionals across North America

* 100% remote



---



Apply now and help shape the future of real estate in North America



Apply Here: 
/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdLG1ic-xk8zUwvdo_7nAUMQczMJLDx1n3uucnv24cKV_taZw/viewform?usp=header

title: Social Media Creative Producer
description:
This is a full-time position as a social media creative producer. You will work directly with the lead media buyer to create social media ads & videos to be published on organic/paid social platforms. Mostly Meta.



You need to understand why ads work. 

Understanding of direct response principles for service businesses.



-Problem ? agitation ? solution.

-Pain-led hooks, not brand fluff.

-Clear offer, clear CTA.

-Ability to think in angles, not just ideas.

-Emotional angles (fear, relief, hope, identity).

-Logical angles (cost, time, outcomes, alternatives).

-Awareness of platforms like Meta, TikTok, YouTube Shorts.

-Knows what works in-feed vs polished ads.

-Understands thumb-stop patterns.



Storyboarding & Creative Direction

-Turn an idea into a clear shot-by-shot plan.

-Specify, visuals, on-screen text, voiceover, b-roll ideas, all for AI asset creation. 

-Design ads that can be assembled from existing footage or created by AI. 

-Simple & clear structures. 



Editing

-Short-form editing for ads. Fast pacing, jump cuts, captions that get read. 

-Knows how to cut dead air, add pattern interrupts, optimize for mobile viewing. 



Testing

-Comfortable with testing, iterations, rapid feedback loops. 

-The goal is learning velocity.



Other

-Strong communication skills. 

-Flexible creative style, willingness to try new ideas. 

-Punctual and honest. 

-Strong work ethic. 



Note: This is a full-time position. Moonlighting or having another job or contract will not be acceptable. Do not apply if you fall under these conditions. 



To apply, please link 2-3 examples of your video work for service-based businesses and/or SAAS.

title: Part-Time WordPress + SEO VA (Web Developer / SEO Specialist)
description:
Job Overview



We’re hiring a part-time WordPress + SEO VA to help maintain and improve our website, publish/optimize content, and grow organic traffic through clean technical SEO and on-page best practices.



This is an ongoing role (not a one-time project). You’ll work directly with the owner and help implement web updates quickly, keep things organized, and track improvements over time.



Responsibilities



WordPress / Website

 • Update and maintain WordPress pages (Elementor or Gutenberg—tell us what you use)

 • Create new pages/landing pages from provided copy and structure

 • Improve page speed, mobile responsiveness, and basic UX

 • Add tracking pixels / scripts when needed (GA4, Meta, etc.)

 • Troubleshoot common plugin/theme issues and site errors

 • Basic security + backups coordination (plugin-based)



SEO (On-Page + Technical + Local)

 • On-page SEO for service pages + blog posts (titles, headings, internal linking, image alt text, schema where appropriate)

 • Technical SEO checks (indexing, sitemaps, redirects, broken links, canonical tags)

 • Keyword research for local service SEO (Seattle/King County focus)

 • Optimize Google Business Profile basics (as needed)

 • Create simple monthly reporting: rankings, traffic, top pages, wins + next actions



Required Skills

 • Strong WordPress experience (you can build/edit pages confidently)

 • Solid SEO fundamentals + execution (not just theory)

 • Familiar with tools like: Google Search Console, GA4, PageSpeed Insights, Ahrefs/Ubersuggest/SEMrush (any is fine)

 • Comfortable documenting work + following SOPs/checklists

 • Great written English for SEO edits and page formatting



Nice-to-Haves

 • Elementor experience

 • Local SEO experience (service-area businesses)

 • Basic graphic editing (Canva) for web images

 • Experience with schema (LocalBusiness/Service/FAQ) and SEO plugins (Rank Math / Yoast)



Work Hours + Pay

 • Part-time: 10–20 hours/week to start

 • Schedule: Flexible, but must overlap at least 2 hours/week for communication

 • Please include your hourly rate and your typical weekly availability

 • Long-term opportunity for the right fit

How We Work

 • Time tracking: Clockify (accurate time logs + notes on what was completed)

 • Communication: Pumble (quick, real-time collaboration + updates)

 • Task management: Plaky (clear tasks, priorities, due dates, and status tracking)

title: Content Manager - Full Time - 20+ Benefits & Bonuses
description:
As a content manager, you will lead our team in creating, editing, and publishing high-quality content across our website, ensuring all material aligns with company standards for accuracy, relevance, and style. You will optimize content for search engines to enhance organic traffic and engagement, leveraging your expertise to drive interest and elevate our digital marketing efforts.



Key Responsibilities:

-Develop, edit, and update content.

-Manage and update the content calendar.

-Oversee the publication of blogs, articles, and web content.

-Ensure consistency and alignment with the company’s voice, editorial standards, and formatting guidelines.

-Ensure all published content meets the company’s standards for journalistic integrity and production quality.

-Review and refine copies for accuracy, grammar, and punctuation.



Qualifications And Skills:

-Degree in Journalism or a related field or equivalent work-related experience

-Prior experience as a content manager

-Minimum 2 to 3 years experience in content writing

-Exceptional oral and written communication skills

-Expertise in writing stories for the web and other digital platforms

-Highly motivated, with the ability to work independently as part of a collaborative team

-Ability to prioritize assignments, manage deadlines, and handle multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced environment

-Proficiency in content management systems (CMS), specifically WordPress

-Knowledge of SEO tools, such as Semrush and Ahrefs

-In-depth understanding of SEO principles and techniques to enhance content visibility and performance



Basic Requirements:

-Device Specifications: Intel i5 processor or higher with a minimum of 8GB RAM

-Equipment: Webcam, speakers, and a microphone or headphones

-Internet Speed: Minimum of 100Mbps with a backup connection for outages



Work Details:

Working Hours: Monday to Friday, 8 AM to 5:30 PM Pacific Standard Time | Tuesday to Saturday, 12 AM to 8:30 AM Manila Time

Location: Anywhere in the Philippines



Why Join Us?

-Stable employment

-Competitive salary

-Bi-monthly salary

-A-Z benefits, including bonuses and annual raises

-Work-life balance

-Work-from-home opportunity



*** The company uses a time tracker and maintains a virtual office setup via Google Meet.





For interested applicants kindly send your CV to

title: Expert SEO Specialist •  High-Impact Campaigns •  20+ Benefits & Bonuses
description:
Our prominent injury law firm in California is looking for an SEO Specialist. Would you be interested?



We’re seeking an SEO Coordinator to join our dynamic team in the legal industry. The ideal candidate will be passionate about utilizing search engine optimization techniques to improve conversions, traffic, and brand revenue. You will work closely with our content marketing and development teams to implement the organic strategy and play a key role in identifying new opportunities to improve organic performance. This position requires excellent organizational and problem-solving skills, a curiosity to learn, and solid communication, interpersonal, and collaboration skills.



-Develop optimization strategies that increase the company’s website search engine results from rankings.

-Execute tests, collect and analyze data and results, and identify trends and insights to achieve maximum ROI.

-Closely collaborate with the web development team to ensure SEO best practices are followed adequately throughout the website content.

-Work with editorial and marketing teams to drive SEO in content creation and marketing.

-Take responsibility for page optimization for search engine marketing.

-Perform ongoing keyword research, discovery, and optimization for new relevant keywords to use throughout the company website and marketing materials.

-Research and implement search engine optimization recommendations

-Create and execute a link-building strategy.

-Change website architecture, content, linking, and other factors to improve SEO positions for target keywords

-Determine measurable goals that demonstrate improvement in marketing efforts.

-Monitor daily performance metrics with SEO tools like Google Analytics to understand SEO strategy performance.

-Collaborate with others within the marketing department to manage SEO strategy.

-Write compelling and high-quality website content, including blog posts and page descriptions, to improve website search results.



*** The company uses a time tracker and maintains a virtual office setup via Google Meet.



We offer:

-Graveyard shift (From Tuesday to Saturday | 12:00 AM-8:30 AM Manila Time)

-Competitive and bi-weekly salary

-15+ company benefits, including annual raises and bonuses.



For interested applicants kindly send your CV to 



(Note: DO NOT SEND YOUR APPLICATION through our websites or social media platforms. FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THIS INSTRUCTION may result in DISQUALIFICATION)

title: Skilled Senior Content Writer || 20+ Perks || Full-Time
description:
As a Senior Content Writer, you will be instrumental in shaping our digital presence and refining our communication strategies. You will be responsible for creating compelling, accurate, and impactful content that helps injured victims understand their legal rights and options. This role requires a creative thinker who can turn complex ideas into clear, reader-accessible content.



Key Responsibilities:

-Develop and produce high-quality content for landing pages, blogs, news articles, and other web-based formats.

-Conduct thorough research to ensure the accuracy and relevance of content.

-Edit and proofread content to maintain high grammar, punctuation, and style standards.

-Ensure all content reflects the firm's voice, tone, and brand guidelines.

-Apply SEO best practices to boost content visibility and search engine rankings.

-Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure content meets the firm’s objectives and audience needs.



Qualifications And Skills:

-Minimum of 2 years of experience in content writing, preferably in the legal, healthcare, or real estate industries

-Exceptional writing and editing skills, with a keen attention to detail

-Passion for creating content that resonates with our audience

-Strong portfolio of published works demonstrating writing and editing capabilities

-Proven capability to break down complex information into clear, concise, and engaging content

-Ability to adapt writing style to suit different purposes

-Excellent verbal and written communication skills

-Ability to collaborate effectively with tea
mbers

-Demonstrated ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and thrive under tight deadlines in a dynamic environment

-Proficient in Microsoft Office and Google Workspace

title: Sales & Tech Representative
description:
We’re Hiring!



Are you a skilled salesperson with a background in gas plumbing and/or electrical work? Do you enjoy helping customers find the right solution while using your technical knowledge? Join our growing team and work with a US online home goods retailer that values expertise, professionalism, and customer satisfaction.





Position:

Sales & Tech Representative – Technical Products (Gas & Electrical Focus)

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)

Schedule: Monday-Friday, 11:00 AM to 7:00 PM EST (40 hours/week)

Salary: Competitive + Performance Bonuses





About the Role:

As a Salesperson, you will assist customers with product selection, provide technical support during the sales process, and close sales with confidence. You’ll work with gas fireplaces, heaters, stoves, and other appliances, so previous hands-on experience or technical knowledge of gas or electrical systems is a MUST.





Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Receive incoming phone calls and live chats from potential customers (prospects) who indicated that they need shopping assistance. This does not include calls and chats from existing customers that need help with their orders (that’s a job for a different department)

Help customers choose the right gas or electric heating appliance for their needs

Makes follow-up calls, writes follow-up
s, and text messages to potential buyers. We try to follow up 5x with each person that contacted us (unless they indicate that they are no longer interested). We don’t do cold calling. Only reaching out to prospects who interacted with our online store and left their contact information.

After each interaction with a prospect/customer, writes notes & comments in our CRM (Asana)

Communicate efficiently and build rapport with potential customers

Assists prospects in their shopping journey and helps make the purchase decision

Ensures that all prospects’ questions and objections are addressed

Leads every interaction to a close sale, which means an order is placed on our online store

Prepares custom quotes, price matches competitors if necessary, and offers custom discounts. This requires calculating margins & ensuring profitability.

Answering questions about the products we offer, including technical questions. Learns the specifications, features and benefits of our bestsellers. Over time, becomes an expert in the industry.

Explain technical specifications and installation requirements in simple terms

If not able to answer product-specific questions, conducts research in the materials provided by the supplier, or reaches out to the supplier to get the information

Confirms stock availability and lead times when offering products to prospects

Documents standard procedures and best practices in a written form, so that other tea
mbers can learn from them





Requirements:

Sales Experience – 2+ years, preferably with B2C or B2B technical products

Gas Plumbing or Electrical Experience – Formal training or work experience (installer, technician, or similar roles preferred)

Excellent English – Both written and spoken

Confident Communicator – Can explain complex concepts to non-technical customers

Tech-Savvy – Comfortable using CRMs,
 platforms, order tools, etc.

Reliable and Proactive – Takes initiative and works independently

Home Office Setup – Stable internet, noise-free environment, backup power is a plus





Preferred but Not Required:

Knowledge of venting, HVAC, or hearth appliances

US product or code familiarity

Experience in the construction or home improvement industry





Why Join Us?

Sales commission: 8% of gross profit from all orders closed. Gross profit means the sale amount minus the product and shipping cost. Paid monthly. No upper limit. Monthly commission payouts range between $1,200 (the guaranteed minimum) and as high as $3,000 (for the top performer). The average monthly payout is $1,465 (average from the last 2 years).

$1,200/month minimum guaranteed pay

15 days paid days off per year (also convertible to min. guaranteed commission)

Paid training on all aspects of the role

Opportunities for professional development

Friendly atmosphere

Online Interview process

Fully remote position





How to Apply:

Apply through OnlineJobs.ph with the subject line: "Sales Pro - [Your Name]"

title: Order Entry Specialist (VA/WFH/Remote)
description:
IMPORTANT: We are looking for a candidate with at least 2 years of Customer Service or Order Entry experience in a B2B manufacturing environment. The ideal candidate must have hands-on experience using an ERP system and demonstrate strong attention to detail, accuracy, and organizational skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Teams is REQUIRED. Please DO NOT apply if you do not meet these qualifications. 



THIS IS A FULL TIME WORK FROM HOME JOB. NIGHT SHIFT. (PST TIMEZONE). PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ARE STILL WITH ANOTHER COMPANY. YOU MUST HAVE YOUR OWN LAPTOP/DESKTOP AND A WORKING HEADSET FOR THE JOB.



////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////



We are looking for an Order Entry Specialist to join our team! The ideal candidate will play a key role in managing and processing B2B orders with accuracy and efficiency. This role requires a strong understanding of purchase orders, ERP systems, and manufacturing processes to ensure timely order fulfillment and outstanding customer satisfaction. We’re seeking someone who is detail-oriented, proactive, and able to coordinate effectively with multiple departments in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. 



ESSENTIAL DUTIES & JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: 



Duties and Responsibilities: 

? Thorough understanding of B2B purchase orders. 

? Process orders with a high level of accuracy. 

? Order verification to ensure all necessary details are present and correct. 

? Understanding our pricing guide and customer pricing set up. 

? Sending customer reports and price sheets. 

? Order tracking to ensure fulfilment of delivery. 

? Coordinating customer requirements with internal departments. 

? Order modifications as requested by customers. 

? Accurately create new customer parts. Meticulously ensuring part information is correct. 

? Updating customer and part data to reflect current information. 

? Becoming an expert in order information on our ERP system. 

? Understanding our customer and departmental lead times. 

? Working with Quality department to process corrective actions. 

? Entering and closing RMA orders for material returns. 

? Invoicing die charges and credits. 

? Review and monitor ongoing priority orders. 

? Verify customer credit information. 

? Review packaging drawings as needed. 

? Document management to maintain up to date order and customer records. 

? Adhere to company’s policies and procedures. 

? Other duties, as assigned. 



Required Qualifications: 

? Minimum 2+ years of order entry experience in a B2B manufacturing company. 

? Minimum 2+ years using an ERP system in a manufacturing environment. 

? Strong computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel and Teams. 

? Meet deadlines, follow up and report if there are delays. 

? Ability to solve problems and prioritize in an environment with multiple changing priorities. 

? Identify issues and generate solutions. 

? Add value by being a strong team player. 

? Outstanding verbal and written communication skills. 

? Flexibility and adaptability based on customer requirements. 

? Strong analytical and mathematical skills. 

? Excellent organizational skills. Being able to prioritize is key. 

? Exceptional accuracy and attention to detail. 

? Ability to embrace new technologies and systems, yet capable of following existing procedures. 

? Exceptional
 etiquette. 

? Must be able to exercise a moderate amount of independent judgement. 

? Be reliable, motivated, organized and be able to work in a dynamic fast-paced team-driven 

? positive environment. An ability to learn quickly, be proactive and adapt to changing 

? requirements. 

? Strong work ethic, dependable and reliable.

title: Amazon Store Manager (Account Infrastructure & Compliance Focus)
description:
We are looking for an experienced Amazon Store Manager to help manage and protect our Amazon Seller Central account and Brand Registry.



We are currently facing a structural issue where there is confusion between who created our Seller Central account versus who set up our Brand Registry and trademark. We need someone who understands Amazon account ownership, admin permissions, and backend control to investigate and resolve this properly.



This is not just a listing management role. This is an account health, infrastructure, and compliance role.



???? Immediate Priority



• Audit our Seller Central account setup

• Confirm original account creation details

• Review primary admin, user permissions, and account ownership

• Review Brand Registry ownership and relationship to Seller Central

• Identify any external parties with access

• Secure and clean up account structure if needed

• Communicate directly with Amazon support when required



???? Ongoing Responsibilities



Account Health & Compliance



Monitor Account Health dashboard



Manage performance notifications



Prevent listing deactivations



Maintain compliance documentation (COAs, trademarks, etc.)



Brand Registry Management

title: Content Strategist / Marketing Specialist
description:
Department: Marketing

Reports to: Founder (CEO)

Hours: 5–10 hours per week



Company Overview: Fireproof CPR & Medical Testing is a CPR training organization dedicated to equipping everyday heroes with the confidence and skills to act in emergencies. We don’t just certify instructors. We help them think like business owners.



Our mission is to equip individuals, organizations, and communities with lifesaving skills that prepare people to act confidently in emergencies—through exceptional CPR and First Aid training and education. As we expand nationally, we are building systems, programs, and leadership pathways that support instructors beyond certification—into entrepreneurship, ownership, and community impact.



Role Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled Content Strategist / Marketing Specialist to support business growth by creating content, executing lead generation, organic marketing, outreach, and
 campaigns. This role focuses on consistency, follow-up, and relationship-based marketing to increase class registrations, event attendance, and inbound inquiries.



The Content Strategist / Marketing Specialist is responsible for owning the business’s content ecosystem—ensuring that what we publish is intentional, consistent, aligned with revenue goals, and reflective of the founder’s voice. This role exists to remove the founder as the daily content bottleneck while still preserving authenticity, authority, and strategic clarity.



Core Responsibilities:



1. Content Strategy & Positioning - Translate business goals (classes, programs, launches) into content direction and align messaging across platforms (social,
, LinkedIn)



2. Content Planning & Execution - Build and maintain a rolling content calendar, create content briefs and outlines for execution, ensure deadlines are met and content actually goes live, and ensure content is repurposed efficiently across channels



3. Event & Class Marketing - Promote upcoming CPR classes and events and support partnerships or community outreach initiatives



4.
 Marketing - Design
 marketing campaigns, schedule
 broadcasts, and assist with basic
 sequences (welcome, reminders, promotions). Maintain
 list segments and track and report open and click rates



5. Lead Generation & Outreach - Research and build targeted lead lists, conduct LinkedIn outreach and follow-ups, and track leads and responses in the designated system





Required Skills & Experience



Must-Haves

* Proven experience in content strategy (not just posting)

* Strong written communication and ability to translate abstract ideas into clear messaging

*
 marketing design, flow and automations

* Strategic thinking paired with execution follow-through

* Experience with LinkedIn as a professional platform

* Comfortable with outreach and follow-ups

* Experience with social media scheduling tools

* Organized and detail-oriented



Nice-to-Haves

* Graphic Design skills (a huge plus)

* Event promotion experience

* Experience with service-based or online education businesses

* Community or thought-leadership content experience



Ideal Candidate Profile



This role is ideal for someone who:

* Thinks in systems, not one-off posts

* Enjoys shaping ideas more than chasing trends

* Is comfortable owning direction

* Can balance creativity, strategy and practicality

* Understands that consistency beats creativity without structure



Success Metrics (High-Level)

1. Content is published consistently without founder micromanagement

2. Messaging feels aligned, intentional, and cohesive

3. Founder spends less time thinking about content

4. Content supports lead generation, classes, and offers

5. Clear content calendar exists at all times



Hourly Rate: $6-8 per hour 



Time Commitment: 5-10 hours per week to start, with room for both hourly pay and number of hours to grow as the business grows

title: Virtual Operations & Client Support Assistant
description:

Remote Philippines Based

Australian Business Hours (AEST)



Breezon Pty Ltd is an Australian company that has worked successfully with virtual tea
mbers in the Philippines for almost 10 years. We value initiative, reliability, and long term working relationships.



We are seeking a high level Virtual Operations & Client Support Coordinator to support the day to day operations of two Australian businesses.



This is not an entry level role. We are looking for someone capable, proactive, and confident who can manage responsibilities independently and support business operations without constant direction.



Hours and Pay

 • Exact hours to be discussed with the right person

 • Paid monthly

 • + 13th month pay

 • Long term role for the right candidate

The Businesses You Will Support

 • An established Australian horse riding and trail riding tourism business, supporting customer enquiries, bookings, and daily operations

       • A breakthrough strategy and personal transformation business, supporting admin, communication, and internal workflows



What matters most is your ability to learn quickly, think clearly, and take initiative.

Customer Service and Operations

s and messages

Owner and Team Support

 • Asana

This Role Is For You If

title: Virtual Assistant – Short-Term Rental Operations
description:
Guest Communication & Support

Respond promptly to all guest inquiries across booking platforms (Airbnb, Vrbo, 
, direct bookings,Hospitable).

Provide accurate check-in/check-out instructions and resolve common guest questions.

Monitor guest reviews and flag feedback for improvement.

Escalate complex or unresolved issues to the Operations Manager when necessary.



Guest Issues & Troubleshooting

Serve as the first line of support for guest-reported problems (Wi-Fi, TV, appliances, access issues, etc.).

Proactively research solutions using Google, YouTube, ChatGPT, or vendor manuals before escalating.

Call guests directly (when needed) to walk them through troubleshooting steps.

Document all attempted solutions and outcomes in the task log.

Escalate only if:

The issue cannot be solved remotely after troubleshooting, OR

It poses a safety/security risk (e.g., water leak, broken lock, electrical hazard).



Reservation & Calendar Management

Confirm all bookings, cancellations, and modifications are properly updated in PMS/channel manager.

Ensure calendars remain accurate across all platforms.

Track and communicate special requests (early check-in, late check-out, amenities).



Cleaner Communication & Oversight

Send daily turnover schedules and instructions to cleaners at least 24 hours in advance.

Confirm cleaner acknowledgment for every scheduled job.

Review photos/videos after turnovers:

Confirm staging, linens, and supplies reset according to SOPs.

Flag any damages or missing items immediately to the Ops Manager.

Ensure same-day reporting of damages or cleanliness issues.

Maintain an up-to-date roster of cleaners and escalate no-shows/failures immediately.



Vendor & Maintenance Communication

Log all maintenance issues reported by guests or cleaners.

For minor issues, call vendors directly to explain the problem and check availability.

Collect multiple quotes or timing options (when time allows) and report to the Ops Manager.

Coordinate appointments, confirm access codes or guest permissions, and ensure vendor arrival.

Request before/after photos and completion notes from vendors.

Document vendor reliability and escalate issues with no-shows, delays, or cost overruns.



Supply & Inventory Monitoring

Review cleaner checklists and supply reports for each turnover.

Flag low stock, damages, or missing items to the Ops Manager.

Maintain updated digital inventory logs for each unit.



Administrative Support

Maintain digital property binders (unit SOPs, vendor lists, guest instructions).

Log expenses, invoices, and vendor receipts daily.

Update SOPs and checklists when processes change.



Qualifications

Prior VA in Short Term Rental market is required 2+ years experience with 20+ properties.

Strong written and spoken English communication skills.

Ability to multitask in fast-paced environments with high attention to detail.

Comfortable with STR tools (PMS, channel managers, Airbnb/VRBO dashboards).

Proactive problem solver who takes ownership of tasks.

Airbnb claims experience with claim documentation highly preferred open to additional compensation for skill. 



Technology & Work Environment Requirements

Stable high-speed internet with at least one backup option (pocket Wi-Fi, hotspot, etc.).

Consistent electricity supply with backup power solution (UPS, generator, or similar).

Dedicated workspace free from distractions.

Equipment requirements:

Laptop or desktop with minimum specs (i5 processor or equivalent, 16GB RAM).

At least one additional monitor for multitasking.

Updated headset and webcam for clear communication.

Cell phone with WiFi capabilities (for calling guests/owners when needed)

Maintain system security and confidentiality (no shared accounts; VPN when required).

Let me know what you favorite food is in the first line of your response.

title: HubSpot Data & Reporting Specialist
description:
Ironslate Inc. is a production intelligence and vendor strategy firm built for high-volume studios. We help streamline physical production by saving time, cutting costs, and providing real-time data that supports smarter decision-making for film and television projects. Our team works closely with studio executives and line producers to bring clarity and insight to complex production workflows.



We are looking for a detail-obsessed HubSpot expert who loves clean data, clear reports, and organized systems. This is a full-time, long-term role for someone who is confident in HubSpot, comfortable with data, and excited to support a growing team in the film/entertainment space.



-

[ Role Overview ]



Title: HubSpot Specialist (with Virtual Assistant responsibilities)



Schedule: Full-time role, with at least 3 hours of overlap between 2 PM–5 PM Pacific Time (PST/PDT). The rest of your schedule is flexible as long as it’s consistent, Monday–Friday.



Compensation: Depending on experience



Works Closely With: EA/Sales Admin



In this role, about 80% of your time will be spent inside HubSpot and related tools, managing data, reports, and enrichment. The remaining 20% will be general virtual assistant and operations support with a need for quick turnaround on those types of tasks.



-

[ A Day in the Life ]



On a typical day, you will:



1. Start your shift by checking Slack and
 for new tasks, updates, and priorities.



2. Review and update tasks in Asana so nothing falls through the cracks.



3. Log into HubSpot to:

a. Generate, update, and share reports and dashboards for sales and studio intelligence.

b. Enrich contact and company records with accurate details.

c. Clean up and standardize studios, companies, and contact roles.



4. Import and export data between our software Iron Intel (our proprietary lead-scraping / production intel tool) and HubSpot as needed.



5. Support the team with ad hoc admin/VA tasks that need fast, reliable follow-through.



This is a role for someone who enjoys structured work, takes pride in accurate data, and likes being the “source of truth” for information.



-

[ Key Responsibilities ]

 

> 1. HubSpot Data, Reporting, and Enrichment (? 80%)

a. Keep our HubSpot CRM clean, accurate, and up to date.



b. Create, maintain, and improve HubSpot reports and dashboards for:

- Sales pipeline visibility

- Studio and vendor tracking

- Meeting and outreach activity



c. Perform regular contact and company enrichment, including:

- Adding LinkedIn profile URLs

- Ensuring first name, last name,
, phone number, and role are correctly filled wherever possible

- Tagging and categorizing studios/companies in a consistent way (e.g. film vs series)



d. Clean up Studios & Contacts in HubSpot:

- Reduce duplicate or confusing company entries

- Align studios under simplified company names

- Make sure each contact has a clear role and relationship to the studio/company



e. Work with Ways of Working (WoW) documents (our SOPs) to follow and improve our data processes over time.



> 2. Iron Intel & Lead Management

a. Import leads from Iron Intel into HubSpot and ensure fields are mapped correctly.



b. Export data from HubSpot/Iron Intel for reporting and sharing with clients when needed.



c. Add locations and other key metadata into Iron Intel and keep it structured.



> 3. Research & Pre-Meeting Briefs

a. When there is an upcoming meeting, research the studio and key contacts.



b. Prepare a concise 1-page brief with:

- Recent projects and credits

- Notable accolades or awards

- Recent news or press (fresh information, not outdated)



c. Deliver this brief in time to prepare our Sales team ahead of important meetings.



> 4. Virtual Assistant & Operations Support (? 20%)

a. Support our EA/Sales Admin  and the team with quick-turn administrative tasks such as:

- Creating and sending documents from templates.

- Updating tasks in Asana and ensuring follow-through.

- Light coordination support via Google Calendar and
.



b. Help keep our internal systems organized (Drive folders, simple tracking sheets, notes, etc.).



c. Use tools like Slack, Google Workspace, Asana, Canva, HubSpot, and Iron Intel as part of your daily workflow.



-

[ Tools You’ll Use ]

You don’t need to be an expert in everything on day one, but you should be very strong in HubSpot and comfortable learning other tools.



- HubSpot CRM (reports, lists, workflows, data imports/exports)

- Iron Intel (our internal lead/production intel software – we will train you)

- Slack (day-to-day team communication)

- Google Workspace (Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Docs, Sheets, Slides)

- Asana (task and project tracking)

- Canva (simple visual assets or basic layouts as needed)

- Other tools from time to time as our stack evolves



-

[ The Kind of Person Who Will Thrive Here ]



We’re looking for someone who:

- Is highly detail-oriented and takes pride in clean, accurate data.

- Enjoys structured work, checklists, and clearly defined processes (and also notices when a process can be improved).

- Is proactive and self-directed: you ask clarifying questions, follow through on tasks, and anticipate needs rather than waiting to be told every step.

- Communicates clearly in written English (for notes, briefs, task descriptions, and async updates).

- Is comfortable working in a remote, startup-style environment where priorities can shift.

- Is respectful, collaborative, and comfortable working closely with a small US-based team.

- Is curious about the film/TV production world (experience is a plus, but not required) and likes the idea of supporting studios and production teams with better data.

- If you are someone who naturally spots inconsistencies in spreadsheets, enjoys making dashboards more useful, and loves the feeling of a well-organized CRM, you’ll likely be a great fit.



-

[ Requirements ]



Must-have:

a. Able to work full-time.



b. Consistent availability Monday-Friday with required overlap of 2 PM–5 PM Pacific Time (PST/PDT).



c. Strong, hands-on experience with HubSpot CRM, especially:

- Managing contacts, companies, and deals

- Running and customizing reports and dashboards

- Importing/exporting data and performing data clean-ups



d. Experience with at least some of: Asana, Google Workspace, Slack, or similar remote tools.



e. Comfortable following and creating documentation (SOPs / WoW) and updating processes.



f. Excellent written communication in English and solid reading comprehension.



Technical & logistical:

a. Reliable primary internet connection (we will ask for a recent speed test).



b. A backup internet option (e.g., mobile data, hotspot, pocket WiFi) in case of outages.



c. A practical plan for dealing with power interruptions (charged laptop, power bank, generator, or alternative work location).



d. Access to a reliable computer and a dedicated workspace suitable for focused remote work.



Nice-to-have (bonus):

a. Experience with other CRMs or sales tools.



b. Experience in the film/TV, media, or entertainment space.



c. Prior experience supporting a US-based startup or remote team.



d. Experience creating simple visualizations (charts in Sheets, basic dashboards, or simple layouts in Canva).



-

[ How to Apply ]

We’re moving quickly and would like to hire by the end of next week (or sooner if we find the right person).



To apply, please follow these steps carefully:



1. Reply to this job posting with your interest. 



2. Complete our application form

- You will answer a set of questions about your experience, availability, and work style.

- You will also provide details about your internet connection, backup plans, and work setup.



3. Record a short Loom or video (2–3 minutes)

- Introduce yourself.

- Briefly describe your experience with HubSpot (what have you actually done inside HubSpot?).

- Share one example of a report, dashboard, or data-cleanup project you’ve handled and what impact it had.

- Tell us why you’re interested in working with Ironslate and supporting studios/production teams.



4. Share the following in the form:

- Link to your OnlineJobs.ph profile.

- Your expected monthly salary (in USD) for a full-time role.

- A screenshot or link to a recent internet speed test.



Applications that follow these instructions carefully will be prioritized.



---

If this role sounds like a match for your skills and the way you like to work, we’d love to hear from you!

title: CapCut Video Editor for Gaming Sleep Channel (Gaming Knowledge Required)
description:
I run a growing gaming YouTube channel creating 2-4 hour sleep videos covering lore from Skyrim, Elden Ring, and Oblivion, etc.



???? GAMING KNOWLEDGE ON AT LEAST ONE OF THESE GAMES IS ADVISED



I advise this because editors who know these games produce immersive, accurate work. Editors who don't struggle with image selection, even with detailed instructions.



???? THE JOB:



Edit 3-4 videos per week in CapCut (~1.5-2 hours each):

- Use my pre-made template (effects, music, overlays already loaded)

- Add 2-3 in-game screenshots per fact for the first 30 facts

- Match images to narration naturally (transitions flow with talking points)

- Light audio cleanup (fix awkward pauses)

- Extend background visuals for the rest of the video



I provide: Voiceover, music, CapCut template, image search guide

You: Find relevant in-game screenshots from google and assemble following my SOP



???? GROWTH PATH:



Start: Editing only ($200/month)

Later: Add AI scriptwriting + voice generation (I train you)



The AI tools only add 30-60 minutes per video once you learn them.



? REQUIREMENTS:



- Proficient in CapCut (show portfolio - gaming content preferred)

- Familiar with Skyrim, Elden Ring, Oblivion, or similar RPGs

- Deliver within 12-24 hours of receiving files

- Good English communication

- 10-15 hours/week available (expanding as role grows)



? NOT A FIT:



- Never played or heard of these games

- Can't meet 12-24 hour turnarounds

- Only want to edit, won't learn AI tools



???? PAY:



$200/month to start (3-4 videos/week)

Increases as you take on more responsibilities

Trial video: $5 paid



???? TO APPLY:



1. CapCut portfolio (2-3 videos)

2. Answer:

   • Which of these games have you played/watched? (Skyrim, Elden Ring, Oblivion)

   • Can you deliver within 12-24 hours consistently?

   • Willing to learn AI tools for full production role?

3. Confirm you'll do a paid trial video



Start: Within 1 week of hiring

title: Email Marketing Specialist Needed
description:
**About the Role**



We are looking for a dual-threat
 Marketer who is technically proficient in **Klaviyo** and creatively skilled in **design**. In this role, you will own the
 retention channel, building complex automation flows while ensuring every
 looks on-brand and drives conversions. You will be responsible for the full lifecycle of the subscriber—from the first popup signup to the VIP post-purchase experience.



### **Key Responsibilities**



#### **1. Flow Architecture & Automation**



* **Build & Manage Flows:** Construct and optimize core revenue-generating flows (Welcome Series, Abandoned Cart, Browse Abandonment, Post-Purchase, Win-Back, Cross-Sell).

* **Advanced Segmentation:** Create dynamic segments based on purchase behavior, engagement, and customer properties to ensure hyper-personalized messaging.

* **A/B Testing:** Continuously test subject lines, time delays, and content within flows to improve Open Rates, Click-Through Rates (CTR), and Revenue Per Recipient.



#### **2.
 Design & Creative Strategy**



* **Visual Design:** Design high-converting, mobile-responsive
 templates using **Figma**, **Canva**, **Photoshop**, or Klaviyo’s native editor.

* **Brand Consistency:** Ensure all assets (hero images, GIFs, typography, layouts) align perfectly with our brand identity.

* **Copywriting:** Write punchy, engaging, and sales-driven copy for subject lines, headlines, and body text.



#### **3. Campaign Management & Strategy**



* **Campaign Calendar:** Plan and execute the monthly broadcast calendar, coordinating with product launches, sales events, and holidays.

* **List Growth & Hygiene:** Manage lead capture forms (popups/flyouts) to maximize signups and maintain high deliverability by regularly cleaning unengaged subscribers.



#### **4. Analytics & Reporting**



* **Data Analysis:** Monitor key metrics (Open Rate, Click Rate, Conversion Rate, Unsubscribe Rate) and provide weekly/monthly reports on performance.

* **Optimization:** Use data to identify bottlenecks in flows and opportunities for higher engagement.



---



### **Qualifications**



* **Experience:** 2+ years of proven experience managing Klaviyo for eCommerce (DTC) brands.

* **Platform Mastery:** Deep understanding of Klaviyo’s triggers, filters, conditional splits, and dynamic codes.

* **Design Eye:** Strong portfolio demonstrating an ability to create visually stunning
s (proficiency in Figma/Adobe/Canva).

* **Copywriting:** Strong command of English grammar with an ability to write "sell-focused" copy.

* **Technical:** Basic understanding of HTML/CSS for
 troubleshooting is a plus.

* **Analytical:** Comfortable working with data to drive decisions.

title: Marketing & Content Creator
description:
The Role:



This is a hybrid marketing + content creation role. You’ll manage our social media presence, plan and execute content strategy, AND create short-form video content (TikToks, Reels, Shorts) for our apps. You’re the full package — you can think strategically about what to post and when, but you can also open CapCut, record a voiceover, and make a video that actually performs. You’ll be working across multiple apps, so the work stays varied and interesting.



What You’ll Do



Content Creation (50%)

• Create 6–12 short-form videos per month across our app portfolio (TikTok, Reels, Shorts)

• Produce gameplay clips, screen recordings with voiceover, app walkthroughs, and trending format content

• Stay on top of TikTok/Reels trends, sounds, and hooks in the gaming and app space

• Adapt your content style for different apps — a game needs different energy than a utility app

• Deliver raw and edited video files for repurposing across platforms



Marketing & Social Media Management (40%)

• Manage and grow Degen Game Studios’ social media accounts (TikTok, Instagram, X/Twitter, YouTube)

• Build and maintain a content calendar across all apps and platforms

• Schedule and publish content using tools like Buffer, Later, or similar

• Monitor and respond to community engagement — comments, DMs, app reviews

• Research trending hashtags, sounds, and content formats relevant to our apps

• Identify influencer and cross-promotion opportunities



Analytics & Growth (10%)

• Track key metrics: downloads, engagement rates, follower growth, video performance

• Assist with App Store Optimization (ASO) for both App Store and Google Play — keyword research, screenshot ideas, description updates

• Help set up and monitor basic paid ad campaigns when needed (Apple Search Ads, Meta Ads)

• Provide a brief monthly summary of what’s working and what to try next



Requirements

• 1–2+ years of experience in social media marketing, content creation, or both

• Strong portfolio of short-form video content (TikTok, Reels, or Shorts) — share your work

• Comfortable with voiceover and screen recording (face on camera optional, voice required)

• Proficient with video editing tools (CapCut, Premiere, DaVinci, or similar)

• Understanding of what performs on TikTok and Reels — hooks, pacing, trending formats

• Experience with social media scheduling and analytics tools

• Strong written communication and ability to work independently

• Genuine interest in mobile gaming, apps, or tech content



Nice to Have

• Experience marketing mobile apps or games on iOS and Android

• Existing audience in the mobile gaming or app review niche

• Familiarity with ASO for both App Store and Google Play

• Experience with Apple Search Ads or Meta Ads Manager

• Basic graphic design skills (Canva, Figma, etc.)

• Experience managing multiple products or brands simultaneously



Why This Role

• Get in on the ground floor of a growing indie studio with multiple titles in the pipeline

• Creative freedom — you’ll shape the brand voice and content strategy from scratch

• Flexible, remote, part-time schedule that works around your life

• Opportunity to grow with the studio as we scale — more apps, bigger budgets, more responsibility
